Soft, silky and balanced. Bit light taste for this percentage and no chaeacter. Still, has every character of high quality abbey dubbel: plum, earthy nuts, sweeter malts etc. Gives a good picture for everyone except hi-fi beer enthusiast.
Dimmigt mahognybrun med fast ljusbeigt skum. Doftar lätt av karamell och toffé. Smaken lite bränd kola och maltsötma. Eftersmaken domineras av farinsocker.

Óriási, gyönyörű, nagyon tartós, világos barna habja van. Sötétbarna színű. Illata finom fűszeres, picikét savanykás. Finom karamelles, pörkölt jegyekkel rendelkező nedű. Fűszeres, enyhén kesernyés. Utóíze pörkölt, kissé kesernyés, fűszeres és hosszan tartó. Testes sör
Bottle purchased in Kansas City. Poured hazy/cloudy brown, foamy off white head. Aroma was sweet fruit, plum, raisin. Taste was sweet, fig, plum.

0,3 bottle. Pours dark copper color with high, mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma of fruits, malt, peaches, plum. Flavor is light to moderate sweet, medium bitter. Balanced. Hazy medium body, soft carbonation. Smooth finish. Surprisingly pleasant.
Very dark brown pour. Aroma of figs, dates, raisins, caramel. Taste follows, with notes of orange rind. Full body, sharp finish.
Dark brown pour, tan head. Bunt sugar, caramel, bread, dark fruit. Medium to full body
0,33l Bottle, Beerlovers Vienna. Honey, sweet and slightly alcoholic aroma. Red/brown color with light brown head. Honey, bitter, bourbon and sweet taste with a bitter finish.

St-Bernardus Prior 8% 

Served in a tulip it is a dark plum brown with a sense beige head and a bready Graham and rich fruity stone fruit aroma. 

Medium to full bodied with a dry finish. The taste is stone fruits (figs, plums, apricots), rich caramel, bread pudding with a dry woodsy finish. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nez sur des épices et le caramel. Bouche dans la même veine. Finale plutôt courte. Bonne bière mais moi manque de développement.

Bottle into a tulip. Pours a deep brown with a moderate khaki head. Nose is dark roast malt and caramel. Taste follows. Good lacing,creamy mouth feel, and a long finish. One of the worlds greatest beers.

Aroma is subtely malty with hints of roasted coffee beans. Color is a deep, opaque, chocolate brown with a quickly dissipating head. Taste is sweet. The body is medium. Lively carbonation characterized by very fine bubbles. Finish is sweet and long.

0.33 bottle. A clear, dark brown color with a medium, off-white head. Aroma has a strong backbone of dark malts with additions of sugar, wood, fruits, and hints of coriander. Taste is sweet, malty, sugary - alright. A medium body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is long, sweet, and represents a good combination of malty and yeasty characters. Overall the beer is simply good, nothing to it.

Aroma: Medium rich, malty, bready, Medium-light spiciness, coriander. Light cherry. Slightly sweet. 
Appearance: Clear, light brown body. Medium, off-white head. Fine bubbles. Good retention.
Flavour: Medium rich, malty, bready, toasty. Medium bitterness, orange zest. Medium-light fruity, banana, prune, spicy, coriander, Balanced towards the malt. Dry finish with lingering maltiness and light bitterness.
Mouthfeel: Light warming, High carbonation, creamy. Medium body.
Overall: Complex, rich. A sipping beer with creamy mouthfeel even with the high carbonation. 

330 ml bottle, poured. 
26B. Belgian Dubbel
Aus der Flasche getrunken (vom Händler des Vertrauens). Starker Anblick im Glas und in der Alkohollast. Ansonsten finde ich es total überbewertet.
Bottle. Dark brown body with tan head. Aroma is nice fruity yeasty with slightly roasted caramel and hints of cocoa . Taste is nearly the same with some sourness. Aftertaste is nice balanced.
On tap at Cafe de la Gare. Dark brown with a fine beige head. Dried fruit, caramel, cocoa, figs, raisins, cola. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a sticky sweet aftertaste.

Aroma: raisins, dark caramel, gentle esters- banana, some roast, gentle alcohol, toasty. Pleasant and just right. 
Appearance: reddish brown, hazy, off-white head with good retention and great texture.
Taste: similar to aroma, light sweetness, lightly bitter, well balanced. 
medium body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long smooth finish, gently warming, slight dryness.
Overall: Nicely balanced, pleasant level of complexity, highly drinkable. Enjoyed it a lot.

330 ml bottle. Pours brown with a large off-white head. Aroma is complex with roasted malt, little hops and slightly yeasty. Head is full of apple aroma. Full body with a slightly syrupy texture and soft carbonation. Taste starts distinctly sweet with a sweet and slightly acidic and bitter ending. Well balanced. Intense roasted malt, honey, hints of mead and alcoholic aftertaste.

Yeasty aroma, I smell dough and cheese, but also sugar. Pours dark golden with a frothy head. Flavour is rich and quite sweet. The after taste tastes sugar. Medium bodied, average carbonation. The sweet flavour lingers. Nice beer.
Deep mahogany with a thin beige head. Caramel. Bread crust. Dark fruit. Some spice. A bit of alcohol. Bigger medium to lighter full body. Soft, a pleasure to drink.

It pours murky mahogany with copper highlights; the head is off white and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: banana, bubblegum, and raisins. The taste is medium sweet and finishes medium bitter; there are notes of the aforementioned aroma compounds. The palate is medium bodied with light carbonation and a medium finish. Overall, its basically the same as the 6.
Bottle (11.2oz) Muddy brown color. Big beige head that settle down.Carmel aroma and Belgian yeast. Taste starts out the same but there is more bitterness in the end than I expected.

Taste: spiced, bold earthy, with notes of clove and wild yeast. Complex candi sugar and bread nose.
Brown/amber color, unfiltered with refine bubbled head. Alcohol finish liquid breads that sustained the monks.

Cor âmbar com tonalidade caramelo, turva e sem brilho; espuma bege de alta formação e persistência de uma fina camada sem lacing.
Aroma de uvas-passas, nozes e pão; álcool em segundo plano bem inserido.
Sabor maltado seguindo o aroma com picância intensa até o final; leve amargor num final seco e alcoólico equilibrado.
Retrogosto seco, de nozes e álcool.
Corpo médio e alta carbonatação.

Look; beige good head, red brown misty body.
Aroma; hops, yeast, creamy caramel, slightly roasted brown malts, grapes, berries, floral meadow. 
Taste; hops, fruity leaves, brown juicy malts, caramel, malted candies, 
finishes malty, yeasty, juicy, fruity. 
Palate; good, a bit fizzy carbonation. 
Overall; belgobrownaleish. Tasty. 
[33cl btl 8%abv, BB040220 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */]

Opaque amber brown pour with a finger or two of creamy, lush head. Aroma of dried fruit, raisins. Taste is full - caramel malt, more dried fruit, dates. Has a slightly bitter hoppiness cooled by a candied sugar sweetness. Palate is full, creamy yet crisp, and absolutely delicious. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lively out the bottle, a deep dark mahogany with a tan lingering head.
Smells of roasted treacle and malt.
Has a thick oily texture which coats your mouth and lasts well.
Taste of sweet malt and loveliness.

Mahogany brown color, beige creamy head. Marzipan nose, Belgian yeast, candi sugar, raisins, hint of anise. Belgian yeast taste, candi sugar, caramel malt, hint of alcohol and dried fruit. Full to medium body, average to soft carbonation.

Brown color. Lots of carbonation. Metalic, yeasty (like the bottom of barreling bucket after primary fermentation), some caramel deep in there, some nuttiness, has a funky lactobacillus smell, but no sourness in flavor. Actually not that pleasant smelling to be truthful, but opens up as it sits in the glass a bit. Rich, caramel flavor, clear clove notes. Vanilla. A roasted and phenolic bitter finish. Leaves mouth numb. A good dubbel, but #1 of the style? Not in my opinion.
Pours dark liver, with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, blackberry, tobacco. Powerful, oily, mouth-covering. Nice umami and sour mouthfeel, almost no bitterness. Medium-persistence finish.

Recent and less recent samples, mainly 33cl bottles, here bb08/2019 (BL1). Aromatic 2-day old, leavened currant brown bread/rozijnenbrood smeared with sirop de Liège boldly hop-bittered for balance with fennel, mustard seed - pours like half a Westflemish dish in a glass, attenuated to older fruit caramel dryness.

Mahognifarvet Kloster Ale/Abbey Dubbel med større offwhite skumtop på 4-5 cm. Svinder til snelandskaber og lander på et par mm. Rolig og ufiltreret. 
Sød aroma af tørret frugt er det første næsen møder. Dernæst gærnoter. 
Ganske rig smag, som indeholder pæn stor bitterhed. Og ligeledes en anseelig sødme. Dejligt balanceret. En anelse beskhed i slutningen. 
Fyldig krop og solidt karboneret. Olieret konsistens og bittersød afslutning. 
Overall: Velsmagende, lidt humlet, Dubbel i yderst god balance. Værdig lillebror til Abt 12'eren. 
33 cl, flaske, 8.0 % ABV, BB: 06/10/19, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brunatne w refleksach rubinowe piwo o dość obfitej pianie, która powoli redukuje się do zera. Aromat intensywny, rodzynki, ciemne winogrona. W smaku lekko kwaskowe od ciemnych słodów i owocowe, bardzo smaczne, typowo belgijskie. Goryczka konkretna, ziołowa. Ogólnie klasyka Belgii w najlepszym wydaniu, piwo bardzo ułożone, wszystko w nim gra.

330 ml bottle shared.

Long lasting dark off-white head, dark color. Sweet taste.

Dark brown and hazy with a dense tan head. To me this is a small version of the St Bernardus Abt... all the same flavours... bread, red fruit, bubblegum, banana, yeast... just less complex and easier drinking. Really good.

A yellow-brown dark liquid with little beige head. Aroma is freshly baked sponge cake, plums, caramel. Some spices as well. Taste was sour and not much else. Not the expected malty sweetness, that the aroma seems to predict. Additionally some alcohol warmth. Full body with medium finish. Overall likable, but the taste was somewhat disappointing.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 Dobry belg to dobry belg, mistrzostwo slodów i fermentacji. Mocny zapach ciemnych slodów, rodzynek, czerwonych winogron, moszczu. W smaku suszone sliwki i figi, troche karmelu, nuty jablek i agrestu. Dlugi wyrazny finisz, lekko kwasowy i pieprzny. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, piwo w ustach lekkie, nisko wysycone. Sama przyjemnosc z powolnego saczenia.

Bottle 33. Bière foncée presque noire avec col beige généreux. Au nez, je trouve : chocolat, caramel, fruits rouges, cerise. Belle effervescence en bouche avec des notes épicées, fruitées et une amertume étonnante pour une dubbel. Good
Bottle, 330 ml. Courtesy of and shared with JFK10000. Pours dark brown with beige head. Malty, raisins, more dried fruit, licorice, bit spicy. Sweet. Medium bodied.
Bottle. Brown with a small head remaining. Aroma of yeast and fruits. Sweet malty taste with dark fruits, yeast and some spices. High carbontion. Well balanced. Medium body. Very nice beer!

Cloudy dark brown color, medium to big sized tan head. Dried fruit, sugar, figs, grapes and raisin aroma. Slightly sour taste, lots of grapes, some chocolate. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy. Somewhat watery, long sweet finish. Tasty, but not my kind of stuff.

Pours a cloudy brownish red with a nice white head. Yeasty, fruity aroma. Nice thick malt, tastes of cherries, dark fruit. Crisp carbonation. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Very malty, wiht notes of brown sugar, caramel and nuts, fruity, with notes of figs, wine and dried fruit, light spicy. Rather subtle flavour, light sweetish, with a dark malty, light warming finish. Misses flavour depth but tastes good.
Very good blend of Flowery notes coriander firm thick head nice light brown color very refreshing easy to drink
If I had one beer to drink for the rest of my life, this is it. I wont even attempt to describe this garnet red liquid perfection.
Donker roodbruin tot zwart bier met schuim. Smaak is licht zoet en vol, chokolade, koffie en caramel. Komt ietwat licht over. Desondanks erg goed.

Una cerveza negro-rojizo que tiene una espuma voluptuosa y cremosa, una gama muy amplia de aromas, dominada por el de la malta tostada. Equilibrio perfecto entre dulce y amargo y notas propias de las levaduras del estilo. Enorme ejemplar!
What a beer. Lovely dark colour and head, perfectly balanced taste, leaves nothing but pleasure in the mouth. An all-time favourite and more easily drinkable than the abt 12 in my opinion.

Aroma: Dark fruits, brown sugar, belgium yeasts.
Appearance: Brown, hazy, 2-finger head.
Taste: Medium sweet, malty.
Palate: Medium body, average carbonation, medium sweet malty finish.
Overall: Good balanced, tasty dubbel.
Bottle. Pours a brown color with white head. Sweet, malty, brown sugar, dark fruit aromas. Sweet, malty, dark fruit flavors with yeasty notes. Really nice!
Dark coloured. From 0,33cl. Cereal aroma. Medium gops.Rocky head. Sweet tast with long aftertaste. Soft carbobation.

4 years old bottle. Pours a hazy amber brown with white head. Aroma and taste are very complex with notes of yeast, dark fruits, malt. mead. Roasted malt and sugar bitter aftertaste with notes of yeast. Very good.
Una buena cerveza, para cualquier momento del dia es perfecta con muchas comidas

Dark brown, ridiculously big and long lasting head. Very yeasty aroma, nuts, dried fruits and caramel. Taste is sweet with light fruity sourness and bitterness from roasted malts. Very complex, but seems to be a bit harsh in the end.

Another amazing beer from this Belgian gift pack. Pours a chestnut brown with a nice head that dissipates. Nutty and yeasty aroma that continues on the palate. It's complicated. Nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle at the Head of Steam, Durham. Dark golden colour with a light, pale yellow frothy head. Aromas of haylage and red berries. Subtle notes of watermelon creep into the taste, along with bitter sugars and an aftertaste of brandy.

L:
-pours a cloudy brown with orange tinges and a big,foamy,offwhite head
S:
-caramel,toffee,spicy,chocolate,brown bread,slight plums,slight raisins
T:
-caramel,toffee,toasty,brown sugar,spicy,brown bread,raisins
F:
-medium body,
-medium to carbonation
-alcohol noticeable on the finish
O:
A fine Dubbel

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown, fluffy off white head that fades quickly. Slight red glow. Aroma has malts, sugar and a metallic hint. The taste is relatively flat: mildly bitter with Co2 and again a metallic undertone. Not what you expect of a double type beer.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España.
A: Dark amber / Ambar oscuro.
T/S: Malt, sweet, fruity, raisins / Malta, dulce, afrutado, uvas pasas.

Donker bruin bier met fijne en rijke witte schuimkraag. Geur: moutzoetig, brood, kandij. Hetzelfde herhaalt zich in de smaak met nog wat banaan. Romig mondgevoel en medium koolzuurprikkel. Vrij neutrale afdronk.
33 cl bottle. Pours a deep amber with a nice head. Aroma of raisins and cherries. taste is sweet. Palate is full body. Overall very good.

Uitgeschonken in St. Bernardus bokaal, troebel bruin bier met oranjeachtige gloed, medium hoge witte schuimkraag. Aroma's van; karamelmout, donker fruit als rozijnen, dadels en pruimen, iets vineus licht zurig, en specerijen. Het smaakpallet is complex en zeer gebalanceerd. Karamelmout, vijgen, dadels, licht houtig, specerijen als peper, kaneel en vanille, Belgische gist, rode wijn, licht zurige accenten. De carbonatie is stevig, de afdronk is relatief droog. Perfect voorbeeld van een Dubbel, en net als de Abt 12 erg goed, mooi complex in aroma en smaak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big head but instable. Deep reddish amber brown colour. Intense alcoholic flavor, spicy, phenolic, dark fruits, plum, caramel. High carbonation, full mouthfeel, sweet, warming. Long complex aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours cloudy reddish with a huge, mostly lasting off-white head. Good lacing. Grape and plum aromas, delicious fruity notes and some citrus too. Brown sugar. Bold and spicy, fruity flavours with a yeasty boost. A bit sour in a very nice way. Very well balanced alcohol... and Im usually picky about this. Toasted caramel, some soft blackberry-like flavours but not overwhelming. Good, but I prefer others.

0,33 l Flasche aus einem lokalen REWE-Markt. Kastanienbraun, mäßig Kohlensäure, schöne feinporige Schaumkrone. Riecht süßlich, nach Hefe, Karamell, Teig. Im Geschmack ähnlich, kaum bitter. Fast wie ein Likör

From a bottle bought at the Vineyard, Belfast. Nice frothy long lasting head, deep dark brown appearence, refreshing hay aroma, bitter/sweet taste and lovely long malty palate. One to go back to again!

330ml bottle. Clear black tea body, medium beige head with minimal retention and no lacing. Aroma of raisins, yeast, leaves, caramel. Taste of yeast, dough, caramel. A tad metallic and strongly carbonated. Ok.

Dark brown color with a long lasting beige foam head. The nose has licorice and heavy yeasty notes. The taste is well balanced with a little too belgian carbonation. Licorice and sweet yeasty and malty parts work well together. Calm aftertaste. This beer is a very nice representative of its style.

Poured from a bottle. Medium light brown color, full frothy off white head. Medium plum aroma. Medium body with a malt plum favor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A fruity raisin like aroma, pours a hazy dark brown color with a tan well laced head that lasts. A fruity raisin taste with a full body and a malty Belgian yeast finish.

Caramel color pour that settles murky brown with very active fizzy off white head. Smells of sweet fruit,  yeast, and a slight musk. Fairly strong carbonation in the mouth. Medium body. Flavor is heavy caramel, slight fruity notes, straw/hay. Flavor profile is nice and doesnt lean heavily in any direction.

Bottl (one of those whacky 11.2 oz sized ones the fuckin Europeans use). Pours a burnt sienna color, off white head with not much retention to speak of. Nose is dried fruit, a little bit o funk, band aids, vanilla, toffee, malt. Mouth is medium-full and creamy, sharply carbonated, relatively dry, hints of cider, banana, spice, toasted pumpernickel, fair amount of dried fruit (figs, raisins and prunes), reminiscent of whiskey without the charcoal. Solid.

750ml bottle - Pours a beautiful caramel color with little to no head. Smells of fruit and a little malt. Taste is amazing from the time the beer hits the taste buds to the aftertaste. Great, smooth beer.
Ready and malty, with delicious yeast and a hay/straw/light caramel profile.

Pours brown with a relatively small head that fairly rapidly dissipates. The wine/juice aroma is relatively subdued. Well carbonated, medium bodied, very smooth. Aftertaste is dry, but with an interesting banana sweetness that lingers on the tongue. Minimal warmth considering the 8% alcohol. Quite good.
Big bubbles in the light brownish head. Top is short lived. Aroma in the glass tending towards champagne aroma. Roasting is middle to light for this kind of brew. Rather creamy and easy to drink.

Smell of sugar cane, caramel, vanilla, come in murky brown color with thin white crown, Taste slightly bitter with caramel, malt, smoothly, medium body but somewhat high carbonated. Very good for its price.

The LCBO barely ponied up much for Christmas this year, but the St B mixer pack was the highlight. Love that happy drunk monk. Pours a cloudy coke brown, solid finger of tan head that didnt break down. Nose of caramel malts, nice yeasts, Taste is nice and heavy on the caramel malts, without being sweet, heavy yeast, mild dried fruits. Overall a solid dubbel as only the Belgian can do it.

33cl bottle. Served in a St. Bernardus chalice glass. Pours a murky chestnut brown with a very small white head that didnt hasitate long to disappear again. Aromas of sweet fruits, cherry, strawberry, earth, vanilla, toffee, brown sugar, hops. Taste was of initially pretty bittersweet, with hints of caramel, hops, brown sugar, spices. Very full foamy carbonated flavor in the mouth, with a fruity bittersweet finish. Overall a nice brew but still a bit too bitter for me.

(bottle 330ml)
Aroma:caramel,chocolate,dark fruits notes(plums, cherries),light note of alcohol.
Appearance:dark copper color,giant yellowish rocky head,
Taste:medium sweetness,caramely andchocolate flavour combined with cherry hint,dry finish,dark fruity aftertaste.
Palate:full body,over-carbonated,nice alcohol warming.
Overall:Very nice dubbel.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown colour with a huge tan head. Rich aroma of fruits, malt, some alcohol. Sweet, rich flavour of fruits and malt, some spices maybe, or liquorice... not sure. Alcohol is there both in aroma and flavour, its warm.
Zeer traag te drinken, een donkere kleur en voldoende schuimkraag. Best wel lekker.

Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a hazy brown colour with some bits floating in it with a fizzy off white head. Aroma of bread, toasted malt, some caramel, slight marzipan, a little vanilla, subtle raisin and brown sugar. Taste of bread, caramel, toasted malts, some banana, slight marzipan, a little vanilla, subtle vanilla, maybe chocolate and grapefruit late on. Medium bodied and a lively carbonation. A sweetish, chocolatey, toasted bitterness in the finish. Another good beer from St Bernardus, a different take on a dubbel. A lot of malty flavours with a subtle grapefruit hoppiness.
33cl Bottle. Pours cloudy brown. Marzipan, dark fruits, milky, chocolatey, sweet. Prickly carbonation. Backlog from 2014/04/02.
Aroma muito agradável e aparência perfeita, escura e com espuma duradoura. Sabor complexo entre amargo e adocicado, mas deixando um ótimo paladar.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2016 Tonaca di frate scura tendente al rosso, riflessi giallastri lievi, opalescente, schiuma beige di media persistenza.
Aroma di chiodi di garofano, pera e albicocca, vinosa e tostata, leggera prugna e ciliegia.
Al palato pera, ciliegia ed albicocca, questultima di maggior persistenza accompagnata da una nota di prugna secca, erbacea e tostata, note vinose.
Retrolfatto tostato misto a pera.
Corpo medio-pieno, ben carbonata, oleosa.

From 33cl bottle, poured into tulip glass

Aroma: caramel, toast, nuts, licorice, raisin, vanilla, 

Appearance: brownish/red, big tan frothy head,

Taste: medium sweet, light bitter

Palate: full body, creamy texture, average carbonation

Overall: Very fruity. Almost to the point of what Id expect from a Quad. Alcohol is well hidden, not warm at all. Lots of raisins, figs, dark fruit type aroma and tastes. Very sweet, lightly bitter. Some dark cherries in taste as well. Very good, slow drinker. Easy to digest, smooth.

Marrón rojizo con transparencia, espuma baja sin retención. Lúpulo especiado moderado, ligera acidez vinosa, malta maltoso caramelo bajo, frutos secos, melaza, albaricoque, licoroso. En boca lúpulo especiado moderado alto, lúpulo de amargor moderado alto, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, tibieza alcohólica, frutos secos, miel. Final maltoso con balance de lúpulo con ligera acidez, cuerpo medio, carbonatación baja.

Bottle @home. Drunk this many times but ive had this bottle about 3 years to age it before rating. Pours brown slightly hazy/murky/cloudy. Nose is malty, fruity, candy, yeasty, figs, prunes, chocolate or should i have just said everything that is good about the world. Taste is at it smells wonderful. While this may or may not be quite as good as the 12 this is a serious, serious beer.

33cl bottle from LCBO. Part of a taster pack. 8% alc./vol. Pour a hazy brown colour with one finger of lasting head. Lacing clinging to the side of the glass. Malty aroma, cherries, grapefruit, and plums. Taste matches the aroma with a metallic aftertaste. The balance between the hops and malts is phenomenal. Moderate carbonation. I wish they sold this separately in Toronto.
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2016 Offwhite head, dark brown color. Aroma is not very strong, malt, caramel, notes of herbs. Balanced taste, roasted notes. Medium to full body, finish a bit abrupt.

Une bière solide mais terriblement gouteuse et ronde en bouche.
Un must have quasi-parfait pour les apéros automnaux! Fonce mon frère ;)
Bottle @home. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Aroma fruity, caramel, little sweet. Taste the same, with a bit chocolate bitterness.
From elcervecero. In La Trappe chalice. After dinner. Not bad but after taking the Rochefort 8 yesterday this seems too soft in all aspects. However, pretty good for a dubbel
(bottle) clear, bright, reddish amber colour with a tall, beige head; aroma of bread, spices, stewed fruit; somewhat creamy palate; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
Very dark. Almost no cap. Rather weak but sour aroma. Tastes a bit sharp, sour. A bit fruity aftertaste
11.2 oz bottle. Excellent dubbel. Full body, fruity malty flavors, discernible alcohol kick. Wonderful.

Pours chestnut color, medium, beige hissing head. Aroma close to dunkelweizen: cloves, yeast, banana, plus notes of cherries and raisins in the background. There is more raisins and fruits in taste, slighty bitter finish with a shade of alcohol warmth.
on tap. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 30/10/2015. Color marron, aroma caramelo, sabores dulces. Muy buena.

Shared 750 ml bottle. Cloudy brown, giant foamy head. Malty aroma. Tastes a little sweet, malty, some notes of bread, toffee, and caramel. Alcohol comes through a bit, but not overpowering. Lots of carbonation.

Great herbal, caramel, fruity, malt aroma. Brown color, hazy liquid, long lasting white head. Medium-heavy sweetness, well balanced with light bitterness mostly in the finish. Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. A perfect and tasty belgian dubbel!
Denne St. Bernardus Pater nr. 8 har en mørk brunlig uklar farve og et medium hvidt skum. Øllen smager sødt og røget af karamel og chokolade. Desuden føles den god cremet. Over karboneret.

33cl bottle. Opaque dark brown with a dense creamy head. Raisins-like dark fruits , butterscotch, malt. Taste is moderate sweet with a dry and light bitter finish. Lively carbonation, smooth on the palate, medium to full bodied. Great dubbel.

Bottle. Reddish brown with a thick head that quickly dissipated. Aroma was malty, banana, and dark fruits. Taste was slightly sweet with flavors of raisins, banana, caramel, sugar, and spices. The finish is a little dry.

11.2 oz bottle into a trappist. Pours cloudy, dark reddish brown, large tan head. Nose primarily banana, and generic citrus, a little bit of raisin. Sweet in the vein of caramel, and bitter citrus rind. Medium bodied, finishes dry. Top shelf brew.

0,33 l bottle. Pours out in a dark brown. Huge long lasting light beige head. Dusty malt nose. Taste starts really smooth, malt with belgian yeast. Some citrus hints in the background of the middle part. Totally hidden alcohol. Really nice!

Color marrón pálido. Aroma a caramelo, malta, toffe...
En boca es carbonatada y cálida por el alcohol. Sabores a vainilla, pasas, caramelo, bizcocho...

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015 Delft 18-10-2015

Donker bruin bier met enorm hoge gisting en mooie volle schuimkraag. Lang niet zo goed en uniek als #12. Heeft niet echt bijzondere smaak maar wel enorm veel koolzuur. Heeft wel volle smaak en neigt zelfs naar vanille/mango. Redelijk goed te drinken maar niet heel bijzonder.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2016 Aroma: 
Malts, caramel, toffee, Belgian yeast, dried fruits, brown sugar and roasted malts.
Appearance:
Turbid/opaque ruby/brown beer with a medium off-white/beige head.
Taste/Palate:
Medium sweet, slightly bitter and slightly dry with malts, caramel, toffee, Belgian yeast, dried fruits, brown sugar and roasted malts.
Bottle 0,33 l. Dark brown color, very good foam. Aroma and taste: wine, spicy, caramel, toffee, warming, dried fruits and toffee, great drink for lunch! ;)

F: beige long lasting huge.
C: pale brown to brown hazy.
A: malt, fruity tones, orange, yeast, hops.
T: caramel malt, toffee, brown sugar, raisins, some orange, tangerine, syrupy, dates, figs, medium body, good carbonation, dry fruity finish with yeasty tones at the end, well done beer, according to Ratebeer first in Abbey Dubbel category.

Pours hazy, dark red-brown with a huge, three finger high, beige, head. 

Nose: Caramel malt, butter, vanilla, orange, red fruit, oak, brown sugar, toffee, whipped cream, raisin and hops. 
Taste: Yeast, spice, caramel malt, brown sugar, raisin, biscuit, dark fruit and vanilla. 
Body: Medium body. High carbonation. 

Its just a GREAT Belgian beer! Love it!
Excellent beer from St Bernardus, with a rare aroma and goes very smoothly in the mouth.

Dark brown color, big beige head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, dried fruits, syrup, yeast. Dry sweet taste with lightly bitter finish and aftertaste. Medium body and strong carbonation. Quite good.
Tap. Copper pour with a white head. Caramel, toffee, vanilla. Medium body.

750ml bottle, the only way, so I can get enough of one of the best. Mahogany pour with tan head. A well blended complex mix of aromas, dark fruits,yeast, toffee, rasins, figs and lots more. The flavors are also a smooth mix of dark fruits, cotton candy, bread pudding, Mmmmm, lots of tasty things. The beauty of this beer is how many different flavors blend so well together. Some heat in the finish with a smooth ending.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of vanilla, toffee, almond, bisquit and some spices... the taste is caramel and spicy with notes of red wine, dried fruits, toffee, brown sugar and spicy grasses... sweet, dry and, a little bit, warming aftertaste...
Tasting @ Gaultier 150905. Bottle (330 ml) from local supermarket, Brussels. Malty and sweet, nutty and dried fruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity.
@ Agards väg 5/9-15. Bottle from local kiosk, Brussels. Dried fruity with spices and some malt. Body is medium, dry finish.
Tasting @ gaultier. Bottle from kiosk in brussels. Sweet, malty with some dried fruit and almonde. Dry finish

Draught at the Porter and Sons, Tel Aviv. about time! Very dark brown with a beige head. Ripe plum, raisins and roastiness in the nose, roasty, bitter taste followed by alcoholic undertones. Full and heavy body, a little fruity finish, quite carbonated.

Copenhagen 30/8 2015. 33 cl bottle brought home by my in-laws from their vacation in Belgium (nice people). Very happy monk on the label indicating that this is good stuff. Pours hazy amber brown with big off-white head. Settles as thin layer of foam. Aroma of yeast, caramel, syrup and notes of alcohol. Soft carbonation. Flavour is caramel, yeast and toffee. Easily drinkable and pleasant bruin.
8/23/2006 11:37:12 AM 330ml bottle at home. Outstanding! I love strong Belgian ales and this one is very smooth indeed. Nice head, tasted fruits. Strong but not overpowering. Just right.
Bottle in the Magnolia Beer Cafe in Keswick. Ruby with an off white head. Mild yeasty toffee aroma. The taste is spicy with toffee, raisin and port. High carbonation. Very good.

Hazy brown. 
Medium body, mild flavor, watery middle, good carbonation but low heat for the ABV. 
Sweetish, bitter. 
Malty, barley drops.
Not as tasty as I expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Large frothy off-white diminishing head.
Murky brown body.
Light caramel/toffee malt aroma with light creamy touch. Metallic nose very present even after 5 min opened.
Medium thin body with almost flat carbonation and a very metallic finish.
Average taste duration slightly sweet, a bit acidic with low bitterness. Salty feeling and metallic flavor.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Pours a murky chestnut brown (almost looks like commercial iced tea) with a frothy, three finger light tan head. On the nose, mineral notes, dark sugars, musty wet basement, dates, dark rye bread notes and a light earthy aroma. Taste wise, apparent alcohol, dark bread, raisin, light molasses, mineral notes that leads into brown sugar, dried fruit, ruby port, fruit cake, and light Concorde grape and earthy notes in the finish. 100% solid.
Dark brown-ish ale. Very smooth, rich dark flavors of fruit and malt. Surprisingly mild for 8%.

33cl-flaska från Beernavigator Ett drygt år gammal. Brunmurrig färg med krämigt smutsbeige färg. Välmogen med stora välintegrerade maltiga och fruktiga dofter och smaker. Lätt syrlig och måttlig sötma. Russin, plommon, mörkt socker, mörkt bröd och torrare avslutning med en markerad beska. En närmast perfekt dubbel.
Really great malts, brown malts hazy brown appearance, flavor of dried raisins and other dark fruits. Flavor of rich malts and biscuit grains and light yeasty banana character. Great stuff.

Hazy brown, huge off-white head, thick laces after it falls. Aroma of dry fruit, white wine, roast acidity, minimal alcohol. Medium to full body. Oily. Sweet taste of dry fruit (prune, raisins) with light bitterness along. Some alcohol present. The same pictute in finish. Excellent balance. Very warming. Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy aroma. Sweetish malty spicy flavor with hints of dark fruit. Has a sweetish malty spicy dark fruit finish.

33cl Bottle
 Pours a mid brown with a thin whitish head
 Aroma is heavy malt with light spice and dry notes
 Taste is sweet grain with dry notes and a long bitter sweet finish
 ok but not great

330 ml bottle from Plonk. Best before 27.05.2018. Bubbly off white head, deep brown. Huge rich boozy alcohol aroma. Little sweetness up front with dry and moderately bitter finish. Highly carbonated, and medium-thin body, full mouth feel, warming alcohol finish. Malty, dry fruit/raisin, a hint of banana? A most excellent dubbel.

Nose is sweet, taste is sweet, life is sweet. Nice beer, I just cannot really understand it. It is not so strong but quite full in body. Sweet but not much sourness. I think it´s maybe even too sweet for me which is extraordinary.

Oosters Singapore on 03/07/15. 33cl bottle (shared), poured into an official St.Bernardus chalice. Light brown in colour with a thin beige coloured head. Medium carbonation. Funky fruity aroma, with malt, dark fruit and spices. Very sour on the palate, although the sourness reduces as the beer warms in the glass. Flavour of raisin, sour plums, malt and molasses. I do have a concern that the sourness was as a result of poor handling in shipping (dates was fine, BBE 2017).

33cl bottle, brown color, creamy lasting beige head, caramel and raisins aroma, banana, licorice and hops notes, balanced sweet flavor, medium to full body, clean finish with spices and honey, almost perfect dubbel
Een lekker donker bier van St. Bernardus. De typische smaak van de gist, tarwe, licht zoet, fruitig. Een milde variant van de 12.
Turva,licorosa,avermelhada,no aroma malte tostado,caramelo,passas,sabor adocicado,alcoólico e com leve picante,corpo alto.Excelente cerveja.
Finally got around to trying one of these last Christmas - solid dubbel, but Ill just spring for the Abt 12 instead.
Great dark brow color. Aroma is caramel, herbs, basement aromas, woody so great belgian.
On tap @ Ljungskile Turisthotell. Brown with a medium tan head. Fruity an dmalty tones. Malt, fruit and hops. Medium to full body with a long bitter sweet finish.

Prezentacja:
ciemnomiedziane, klarowne, piana bardzo obfita, ale dosyć gruba i szybko opada do zbitego trwałego kożucha, koronka słaba, ale ładne łzy
;
Aromat: 
drewno nasączone whisky, mosiądz, owoce w alkoholu - śliwki, rodzynki, toffi/karmel
;
Odczucie:
średnio treściwe, wysoko nasycone, lekkie ściąganie na języku, bardzo delikatne rozgrzewanie w przełyku, finisz karmelowy i alkoholowy
;
Smak: 
bardzo słodki - karmel, rum, alkohol, śliwki, morele
;
Ogólnie:
niezwykle bogate na każdym poziomie
.
Nose is really nice, Belgian yeast and sweet fruit. Classic dubbel flavours, yeast, dark fruit, molasses, spicy. A very good belgian beer.

Pours a dark amber topped by a fizzy/creamy head with a light tan. Retention and lacong are pretty good. The nose is fresh and earthy and gives off nutty caramel malts, dark fruits and some cloves. The taste is sweet, nutty and earthy through a medium body with sharp carbonation. Nice lingering toffee finish. Cheers!

Strong aroma, caramel dark banana notes. Hint of cloves as with all good dubbels. Dark colour, medium body. Medium carbonation, creamy texture. Long finish. Another beautiful dubbel from St Bernardus.
Aroma malt and caramel looks beautiful dark held up against the light some Ruby some foam taste some dark malt sugar Candy? Nice balanced bitterness
приятно& аббатск& пиво, во вкусе присутс& фрукты, сильно карбони&
Bottle from Beersnmore. Pours ruby with a fine medium head. Loaded aroma of some berries and caramel. Crisp and tart taste, refreshing. And malty indeed. Quite light for 8% ABV.
Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, spices. Taste is sour from the start and then chocolate and malty afterwards.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into an oversized wine glass at ~50 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a deep red-brown like burnished mahogany, and forms a thick head of just barely off-white, which lingers a bit ere dwindling to a cap and ring. Lacing is nonexistent.

Smell: Redolent with a variety of fruits, from raisin and plum to cherry and fig, with hints of currant as well. Belgian candi sweetness underlies the fruit aromas, like a mattress of cotton candy buoying the orchard upwards.

Taste: In contrast to the fruity nose, the taste opens with a serious wallop of dark bread, which is accompanied by both a rush of alcohol heat and a slurry of faint, mingled stone fruits. This persists through the middle, and at the finish, the alcohol falls away to reveal a beautiful caramel-toffee bread soaked in raisin and currant preserves and served up on a plate of leather. At times, a metallic tinge swims through the beer, coppery and harsh.

Mouthfeel: Incredibly fizzy and prickly, this somehow remains full and sticky. Theres enough carbonation to lend a sharpness to the entire tasting process.

Overall: I actually get far more noticeable alcohol heat out of the Prior 8 than the Abt 12, likely due to the reduced punch of the malt and yeast profiles. This is not even in my top 3 beers from St. Bernardus.
Dark brown colour with thin head. Aroma is yeasty and malty. Flavour has a bready, malty taste with some dried fruits. Slightly peppery in the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2015 Bottle from Auchan Market, Luxembourg City!
Pours dark brown with high creamy head. Aroma has chocolate, dried fruits and caramel. Taste of dark and dried fruits, caramel, toffee and vanilla. Finish is malty sweet with caramel and toffee.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2016 Piana grubo pęcherzykowa, błyskawicznie znikająca niemal do zera, barwa brązowa, mętna. W aromacie suszone jabłka, gruszki, rodzynki, trochę owoców leśnych, a w tle ciemne pieczywo i kwas chlebowy. Smak bardziej słodkawy aniżeli kwaskowy, oczywiście suszone owoce są i tu obecne, ale jeżyny i jagody połączone z pieprzem i chlebem razowym stanowią tu podstawę. Goryczka pestkowo-pikantna podbita rozgrzewającym alkoholem i średnim do wysokiego nagazowaniem przyjemnie kontrują daktylową słodycz. W afterteasie przyprawy korzenne, delikatna stajnia i alkoholowe rozgrzewanie. 
Dobry, bogaty w aromaty i doznania, Dubbel o półsłodkim deserowym profilu. Fajnie zbalansowany, choć nieco zbyt pikantny i ostry w odbiorze.

Pours a rich and hazy copper amber colour initially with big billowing tan head which quickly settles. Aroma is figs, brown sugar, bready yeast and caramel malt. Taste is initially quite sweet then medium bitter and lightly sour. Rich yet light mouth feel with medium noticeable carbonation, full bodied. This is a really nice Dubbel and perfect for those times when that is what you want!

12oz from mixed Bernardus 6p. Pours a mud like brown with a fizzy white head that quickly dissipates. Smells of slightly sour figs with alcohol showing. Body is actually quite light and heavy carbonated. Light easy drinking, taste of light fruits and the alcohol helps accentuate the tastes. Classic style, not my preference but good.

16/05/2015 25cl from tap @Zwembad de Treffer, Waregem.
Hazy brown with nice beige head. Light roasted malts, spices, caramel, bitter hops. Nice soft oily mouthfeel

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2016 Nice abbey dubbel. Medium body prune, fig, and candied sugar flavor. Becomes richer and the flavors come out more if you let it warm. Worth a try. On tap at VI. Belgian beer fest in Budapest.

Bottle with expiry date 16.09.18, bought in January. Frothy, quickly disappearing head, dark brown colour. Aroma is complex, with raisin, dark bread, brown sugar, and even a bit of hops in the finish. Alcohol noticeable, but does not disturb much. Smooth, very drinkable. Very good.
Bottle from Congress, Longton. Pours deep brown with off white stiff froth. Dark berry, malt, well carbonated. Decent.

33 cl bottle from punka in Tallinn ( 2.92). Murky reddish brown. Head light beige, retains nicely, leaving little lacing. The usual caramel, dark fruits, pear, some inspecific spiciness, brown sugar... Fizzy carbonation, above average body... Metallic, grainy and dry on the palate. Id definitely prefer Westmalle if in the mood of a Dubbel.
Heerlijk fris, donkerbruin, goede schuimkraag. Smaak blijft lang in de mond, moutig. Klassieker.

Bottle. Dark brown, creamy stable head. Malty with dried fruits and bananas in aroma. In taste fruity, malty with candi syrup noticable. Alcohol well hidden. Medium bodied, oily texture, high carbonation. Very good dubbel.

33cl bottle at home. A medium strong Belgian dubbel, high in carbon, brown sugar sweetness, some vanilla too. Full of character, with some earthy flavours and forest fruits. Not as classic and overwhelming as the quadrupple, but something to have on the beer map, for sure.
earthy, colore rame gusto uvetta e pugna parente stretta della più blasonata Westvleteren 8.ottima birra da meditazione.

Gushing infernal à louverture qui ma fait perdre le quart de la bouteille. Le liquide est dun brun foncé trouble, plusieurs particules en suspension. Col de mousse généreux qui dégage des effluves de levures épicées. Arômes de baies confites, cassonade, anis, raisins secs et pruneaux. En bouche, goût de fruits rouges jeunes, cassonade, anis. Finale assez brève et fade où survit un léger côté acidulé. Texture un peu mince et faible effervescence, surement dû à lexplosion du début. Dommage car le goût est là mais elle a perdue de son caractère.

Bottle. Pours a deep auburn red with a medium, large-bubbled, beige head. Aroma is marzipan yeast, dark fruit, light green apple, dried dark fruit. Taste is marzipan, dark ripe fruits. Semi sweet with a herbal finish. Fairly full, low carbonation.

Pours deep chestnut brown and bubbly with a foamy off-white head that fades quickly to a ring and coating. Aroma is nutty, some mild darkfruit, earth and yeast. Taste largely follows - earthy malted grains and light flavors of plum and cherry. Quite fizzy and more yeast and grain than sweetness. Nicely balanced, but less complexity of flavor than some other Belgian greats. Alcohol is hidden pretty well.

Bottle. Pours a deep red-brown with a high, light ecru, blown-insulation head. (Seriously, this head looks,like you could WALK on it. Nose is wheat bread dough, dark fruit, spice -- wait -- Irish soda bread? Yeah. Like that. Heavy and smoky on the tongue, with boozy and tawny Port notes; it doesnt, however, manage to overpower, providing an interesting balancing act. Finish is long, warm, and flavorful. Delicious.
Sample at a lcal tasting event. Brown body with a medium white head. Dried dark fruits, burnt sugar, herbs and yeast followed by a finishing bitterness.

Poured from a 330ML bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a nice fruit and malt aroma.
Appearance- Pours a reddish brown with a lot of floating sediment. Has a tan head.
Taste- Has a very balanced flavor with a great pairing of malt and fruit.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate to high carbonation
Oveall- Another excellent brew from St. Bernardus.
Flaska från Savuer Biere. Smak och doft av humle, malt, torkad frukt, honung, brunt socker, karamell med örtiga toner. Lagom sötma, lätt kropp, fin beska.
Pours dirty brown with a small fizzy beighe head. Aroma is toffee and earthy grains, light fig and plum. Taste is fizzy with carbonation, purple fruit, earthy grains and sweet butterscotch.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured reddish dark brown, big foamy off white head and lots of lacing on the glass. Aroma of malts, the typical Belgian yeast and fruits. Taste is of malts, dark fruit and yeast; alcohol is pretty well hidden. Very good beer, highly enjoyable.

Pours an opaque dark red -- color really only visible against the light. Three fingers of dense, packed foam thats slow to settle and settles unevenly. Aroma is super rich dark fruits -- fig, prune, raisin, cherry, silan. Taste is sweet up front, same dark fruits, hints of toffee, with some sourness on the back. Delicious. Copious lacing, medium body, active carbonation.

Poured from bottle, deep reddish brown with low beige head. Aroma is complex with notes of caramel, dried fruit, stables, nuts, herbs and spice. Taste is full with notes of bread, caramel, honey, spice and some fruit. medium body and a relatively short aftre taste. Very enjoyable!
Cant decide whether this is a great Tripel or a really delicious double.. Well, it doesnt matter; its a bloody great beer!

Very good beer. It was a little sweet, but not as bad as some of the Unibroue products Ive had so far. No aftertaste. No harsh flavours.

Will purchase again in the Christmas mixer pack.

MB

Marrone intenso, schiuma appena presente come un velo. Aroma di malto e dark fruits. Allassaggio è relativamente dolce, con malto, caramello, alcune spezie, chiude un po secca. Abbastanza alcolica, ha un corpo medio e una texture morbida.

From a 330ml bottle on 1/4/2015. Pours a cloudy brown, with a big off white head. The flavour features lots of dark fruit (plums, prunes, cherries), caramel, fruit cake, spice, yeast, and a gentle bitterness at the end. The palate in quite creamy and the carbonation lively. Pleasant enough drinking if a touch bland.

Bottle from Hop City Birmingham. Pours hazy brown with off-white frothy head. Aroma of pear, caramel, and malts. Tastes of pear, caramel, fruity, with a metallic aftertaste. Medium bodied. Lots of carbonation.
Pours deep brown with a foamy head. Tons of complex flavours like yeast, breads, brown sugars, toast, spices, etc.
smells a bit like sugary christmas cake, murky brown body with a ridiculous head, taste like brown sugar wash with some slight alcohol burn in the finish. and this is highly rated stuff?

Bottle - big foamy head, murky dark brown color, malty and Belg yeasty fruit aroma and flavor, moderate complexity going on, nice clean finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Flasche) Es hat eine braune Farbe mit einem rötlichen Einstich, es ist hefetrüb mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist malzig, leicht erdig, Zartbitterschokolade, Rosinen und Hefe. Der Geschmack ist malzig, leicht alkoholisch, fast rindig, samtig und bitter im Abgang.

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Color: St. Bernardus Prior 8 presenta un profundo color ámbar. 
- Olor: Aroma sutil de azúcar moreno, madera, canela, cereza y regaliz. 
- Sabor: Sabor a fruta dulce, malta.

Pours dark amber with a bubbly head that leaves a thin but creamy top with good retention. Aroma of cherry and other berries, yeast, dough and some raisin. Medium body, creamy feel, fizzy carbonation. Taste of caramel, sourdough, dark chocolate and sweet licorice. Long lasting and slightly bitter finish.

2015/03/21 - Pours a cloudy dark brown/amber colour with a foamy, khaki head that quickly reduces. Aroma is yeast, dough, herbal hops, raisin, toffee and nutty notes. Taste is very yeasty, herbal hops, nutty notes, toffee and mild raisin. Sweetness is very subdued. Mouthfeel is medium with lively, biting carbonation and a dry, herbal finish. Not my favorite St. Bernardus beer as I expected it to be a little sweeter and malt forward, but it was still enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ruby red with orange hues when held up to the light. 1 1/2 finger off white head that lingers for a while. Visible yeast sediment. Aroma is cherries, dates, candied sugar and belgian yeast. The taste follows the nose along with a rich caramel malty sweetness. Finishes bone dry. Very nice beer overall.

Dunkelrot bis braun mit beigem Schaum. Aromen: getrocknete Früchte, süßer Sherry. Geschmack: getrocknete Feigen, Rosinen, Kuchen, süßes Röstmalz. Im Abgang leicht bitter. 

Tolles Bier!
Bottle from a mixed StB case. This is quite a rich dubbel, somewhere between figs and chocolate cake. Light body for its gravity (as the Belgians do it). Not really that sweet or estery.

Bottle @ Koht, Tallinn.
Dark amber color. Fruits, bread and caramel aroma. Well balanced taste.

Rødbrun klar med fingerhøyt beige skum. Søt fra starten, karamell og kandissukker. Fyldig. Søt syrlig smak, brent karamell. Medium kullsyre.
Lillestrøm ølfestival - Klimt

Very deep copper body with a dense, creamy, very long-lived, light-tan head that laces the glass well before ending as a thin layer. Malty, fruity and strong aroma of dark dried fruits, sweet caramel, Belgian yeast and hints of vanilla. Strong flavour of dark dried fruits, caramel, Belgian yeast, sugar and alcohol. in the back I get vanilla and overripe banana. Moderate to light sweet taste with a long-lasting moderate to light bitter finish. Its got a quite hight carbonation level, yet it feels smooth on the palate. A brilliant beer! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 3.5 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Aroma of dates/ figs, raisins, malt and candies sugar. Very nice and complex. Taste is the same, but almost a dry finish, certainly not sweet. Nice amount of body. All around solid, very drinkable Belgian that doesn't taste strong at all. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl. bottle at home. Dark brown beer. Good taste with hints of chocolate, caramel, raisins, bread, ... Wouldnt say this is 8°.
12.7.2014. Hazy brown beer. Aroma has malts, nuts, caramel. Taste is spicy, malts, yeast, some sweetness. Not the best of the style but straightforward.

Somehow I was expecting a sweet, strong porter type brown beer from this. Not the case. Dumped it into a Stella glass and got a brownish orange brew with an enormous head which dissipated. Theres a little sweetness in it, a little fruitiness and some burned caramel and dark bread. Not one of my faves, but as with most in this style, it hides the strong ABV well. Got better as it warmed up.

I do dig this delicious Dubbel, but I bet I wont lose sleep over it. Which is normal to do with some brews. I guess? Ye olde monk juice is a leathery raisin brown, cloudy with a chance of thin, off white fizz adornment. Notes of brown sugar, whole wheat bread, cinnamon, raisins, toffee, red wine and light cellar dank are the whiff du jour. Flavours blend well in this boozy behemoth but booze does in fact beckon the sensory organ responsible for taste into action. Fizzy feel is in fine fettle as bumptious bubbles barrage my tongue into sweet submission. A beyond decent dunk this Dubbel, I do believe it is worthy of desire.
Dark brown with off white head. Dark fruit and malt aroma. Chocolate sweet malt. Heavy. Great lacing all thee way down
Off white head that laces the glass. Caramel and roasted malt aroma. Taste...well its St. Bernardus so you know its good.
330 mL bottle. Deep amber brown pour, tall semi-creamy tan head. Aroma is malty, some roast, but also fair bit of fruit. Sweet, caramel. Taste is malty goodness through out, yeasty and fruity.

33cl bottle from my cellar. Pours a dark brown color with a tan head and a little lacing. Aroma is malty, caramel, bread. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, molasses, a little nutty, with a sweet, caramel finish.
12oz bottle from a sample pack. Pours cloudy orange-red-brown with a nice foamy head. Nutty/floral/spicy aroma. Very smooth. VERY smooth.
33cl @ bottle. Dubbel della solita abbazia di garanzia di qualità di Watou. Marrone, aroma non invadente e solito ottimo gusto.

Bottle. Pours dark brown amber, with a big creamy head receding to finger thickness. Aroma is roasted malts and fruity Belgian yeast, with bread, nuts, wood and kandi. Full body, with average, pearly carbonation. Flavour is roasted malts and yeast with dark fruits, as well as coffee, wood, kandi and some herbal notes.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 26.08.18. Piana wysoka, acz "szampanska" - syczaca i dosc szybko opadajaca. Piekna barwa - rubinowo-miedziano-brazowa. nieprzejrzyste. Aromaty karmelowe, owocowe (wisnie przede wszystkim, ale tez jakies sliwkow-rodzynkowo-bananowe), slodowe, rowniez alkohol. Skojarzenie z wisniami w likierze. W smaku wlasciwie w pelni kompatybilnie z aromatem - jest kwaskowatosc wisniowa, jest slodycz karmelowa, jest alkohol likierowy (delikatny), jest tez wysokie wysycenie odczuwalne na jezyku, goryczka praktycznie nie wystepuje. W porownaniu z innymi dublami wydaje sie bardziej kwaskowate i stanowczo bardziej wisniowe - wiec jest tez bardziej orzezwiajace w sumie. Bardzo fajne piwo, i zaskakujaco lekkie, mimo %zmiany po slepym tescie dubbli - szczegoly tiny.pl/gwtlqOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

On tap at Man in the Moon. 

Dark brown with a small creamy head. Sweet and vinous with malt, dried dark fruit, caramel, honey and light chocolate. The body was full and the finish long with warming alcohol. A nice one.

Colore marrone rossastro, schiuma abbondante.
Odore: caramello, frutta matura, fichi secchi.
Sapore: caramello, frutta, alcool evidente, leggera astringenza, poco amaro nel finale. Sapore dolce predominante.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 Brown color with very thick smooth head. Complex, but not too intense aroma of fruits and candied sugar. Complex, but not intense. Taste is spicy and malty, dark fruits, raisins. Smooth, but high carbonation. Really good. The Pater is less complex, but heavier.

A dark, murky brown coloured beer with a frothy off white head. A musty malt aroma, theres a light, vinegary fruit aroma. Dry but full mouthfeel. The taste starts off with a dry, dusty, nutty flavour, then theres a mild boozy sourness that ushers in a red fruit flavour that lasts into the finish.

Pours a hazy, slightly chunky, brown color, topped with quite some tan colored head, that quickly disappears. Yeasty aroma, soury notes and slightly earthy. Taste is between sweet, yeasty and soury. Finish is malty. Not bad, a bit too sour, but still drinkable.

Appearance is dark mahogany brown, ruby hints, a half finger off white head. Aroma- lots of dark fruit, cherries, raisin, yeast, vinous, brown sugar, caramel, boozy. Taste- cherry, banana hints, raisin, bready, vinous notes, caramel sweetness, slightly bitter towards the end, fluffy mouthfeel. Very nice.

Medium brown pour, off white creamy head. nose is soft dark fruit and Belgian yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is caramel, figs, soft brown bread, and some raisins sprinkled on top. Finish is lingering and bittersweet. Balanced and delicious.

Heerlijk abdijbier, volle rijke smaak, lang houdbaar houdt koolzuur en schuim lang vast. Voldoende beschikbaar aan redelijke prijs. 
Deze moet iedere bierliefhebber in huis hebben.

Bottle, pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma: dark fruit, spices, brown sugar . Taste: raisins, figs, prunes, molasses, dark bread, chocolate. Medium sweet, lively carbonation, creamy, medium body. Dark fruit and chocolate finish with a light bitterness.

Brown with tan head. Even has some cute floaties! Aroma: caramel, vanilla, spice, red berries and some floral notes. Sticky palate. Aftertaste: caramel, spice, floral, chocolate and some alcohol. Overall: Nice, like the chocolate.

Bottle pours a murky brown, mahogany head that sticks around as a thin cap. Aromas of plums, raisins, allspice, light oak and molasses. Taste is light breads with dark fruits...raisin, plum...some fig and molasses. Finishes slightly spicey with some sweet alcohol combining with a bready spice. Nice stuff.

Rich aroma of caramel, dried fruits, raisins, sweet and spicy. It looks great in the glass - deep brown with massive, strong head. Perfect balance of malty sweetness, spicy-yeasty notes, minimal bitterness. Lively carbonation. Worth trying.
A really awesome dubbel. Pours a dark reddish brown. Aromas are very malty, bread and dark dried fruit. Sweet dark dried fruit all over the taste buds. Great stuff

*Old rating, best before 04.08.11.  Tolle dunkelbraune Farbe. Weich-cremig und dickflüssiges Bier. Mild, intensiv, Röstmalz, Nüsse, dunkle Früchte. Langer intensiv-caramelliger Nachgeschmack mit moderater Herbe. Toll.

Pours a murky brown with a thin off-white head. Aroma is dark fruits, brown sugar, and caramel. Flavor has more of the caramel and less of the rest, with a touch of boozy sweetness. There is a booziness that gets in the way of the aroma and flavor. Gets better as it warms up, but I still wasnt all that impressed.

Pours a deep opaque brown with a thin cream head leaving sheet lacing. The nose is raisins and caramel. The taste is the same with a full body. Although it has more structure and flavor profile than the Pater 6, the initial impression was that there would be more depth. 11.2 oz bottle in a variety pack with a best by date of 8/24/17.

An outstanding beer, IMHO almost as fine as Westvleteren 8, the best in the world. I have sampled many times at home and keep a couple of cases for aging; at a bar in Brugges; at a bar in Brussels; mostly in 330s but also in 750s. Warm, attractive nose with caramel, chocolate, fudge, malt, walnutes, herbs. Perfect head which is white as the driven snow. A very smooth presentation, goes down nicely but it has not the incredible smoothness of Westy. Lasts and lasts.
Plum, fig, spicy, banana, bubblegum. Slight caramel, but not very sweet aroma. Well carbonated with a nice mouthfeel. Flavor has some anise, dark fruits, candi syrup, melanoidins,
On tap during Brussels vacation. Brown with beige head. Aroma sweet, malty, plums, sugar and raisins. Taste is sweet, dried fruit, plums, ripe fruit with a sweet finish

11.2 oz. bottle from The Hop Yard, Raleigh, NC. Brown pour with a foamy light beige head. Aroma of green raisin, candi sugar, and dark fruit. Taste is sweet, but not too sweet, offering a strong malt profile but enough fruitiness to keep this from becoming overly sugary. Moderate warmth. As close to perfect of an example of a dubbel as you could possibly find.

0.33l bottle. Hazy dark orange body, huge off-white. When opening the bottle it pours out a bit. Aroma and taste of caramel, chocolate, cherry, plums and reisins. Qiute sweet and full-bodied. Nice one.

Pours a dark hazy ruby-brown with a large foamy off-white head. Floral aromas, Belgian yeast, plum, date, and cherry on the nose. Has a nice full body with a slightly chewy mouthfeel. Theres a nice amount of sweetness, but not overly so. A sort of dry cherry flavor is present along with that familiar St. Bernardus/Belgian yeast flavor.

Bottiglia 33cl comprata da giangaspero e bevuta a casa.
Marrone scuro con bella schiuma.
Corpo avvolgente, malto e finale amaro.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Bottle. Pours a dark brownish producing a creamy, tan head. Aroma of malts, dried fruits, coriander and hints of banana and yeasty esters. Taste is very well balanced. Moderate fruity, well rounded sweetness and a slight bitter touch finishing it off. A slight alcoholic warmth as well. Body is full with an almost thick texture. Co2 levels are high as is usual for the style. Very nice stuff.

The aroma is sweet rain molasses malt and dark fruit in character. Dark brown cinnamon colored body with a tan full bodied head that laces nicely.Spice molasses and raisin like fruit taste and warms the throat as it goes down. I can also detect caramel and a little ginger. Despite fruitiness it seems to finish off on the dry side but certainly leaves you feeling you want more.
Nose is really nice, Belgian yeast and sweet fruit. Classic dubbel flavours, yeast, dark fruit, molasses, spicy. As good as I though it would be. I could drink lots of this.

Lively aroma of yeast, bread, malt. Deep reddish brown color with fine white head, lingers with modest lacing. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, very tasty. Medium body, mildly creamy and sticky, with lively carbonation, long finish. Overall classic belgian dubbel, though not cream of the crop.

Bottle 33cl. Deep dark ruby brown, small frothy light tan head, recedes after a while to a thick layer, good lacing; rich aroma, sweet malt nose, caramel, raisins, figs, dark fruit syrup, bit soap, licorice, chocolate; taste medium sweet, light bitter, fruity, light spicy notes; medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation; aftertaste smooth sweetbitter, fruity notes, hints of  chocolate; a really excellent dubbel, very smooth indeed.
Poured a muddy brown. Strong caramel and earthy aroma. Lively carbonation with a full finger tan, bubbly head. Heavy lacing. Strong, slightly sweet. Minimal bitterness.
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 Très peu d'arômes à sentir, un des seuls points positifs reste le goût. Reste dans les classiques stouts, sans plus.
Poured from a 750ml bottle. Appearance is opaque tawney brown. Aroma of malts, Belgian yeast, and fruit. Taste is similar. Palate is not too thick. Pretty good beer, highly recommended.
From bottle. Dark redbrown colour. Rich malty aromas. Very strong, rich flavour. Sweetness and liqorice, malt, caramel. Excellently balanced.
Très, trop?, pétillante au palais, belle note de cacao et gout dalcool prononcée. Une bière quil faut avoir bu.
Very earthy beer. Smells of caramel and the forest floor. Taste is malts, caramel, and brown sugar. Head looks like huge piles of snow outside of a hockey rink until it dissipates.
Scent of brown sugar, dates, and caramel. Hazy mahogany colour. Slightly sweet front with flavours of molasses, raisins, and honey, Medium in body and carbonation. A really tasty beer,

Fantastic ale. Appearance is bold, and lacing is very good. The ale smells a bit sweet like caramel but also roasted smell. Taste has caramel for me and is good- aftertaste not quite so full. Palate is exceptional- creamy frothy and very very smooth in the mouth. One of the best dubbels ive had.

Scents of yeast, dark cherries and musty leaves come forth from the mounds of foam. The earthiness hangs around through the taste and finish, though theres a burst of sweetness in the mouth.A great, great dubbel, and who doesnt love a smiling monk on a bottle?
Dark fruits, cherry/raisin flavor and aromas. Pretty decent smooth beer. Not the best from St B, but still good

Malty sweet aroma with notes of dried cherries. Appearance is a hazy brown with good head and retention. Flavor is malty sweet with notes of caramel and dried cherries. Mouthfeel is medium with a high level of carbonation. Overall, I prefer their 6. This beer isn't as interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into St Bernardus glass a mostly clear bottle glass brown with think thin bubbled tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, banana, spice. Taste was carmel malts, wood, earth. High co2 and the alcohol warms in the finish as the more woody earthy to ES take over. Very nicely done.
5 oz flight pour. Dark golden brown pour with a fair amount of head. Herbal malty taste with some carmel.

Hazy brown color with a generous white head. Nice carbonation. Aroma is spicy above all, with banana, yeast and some caramel and dark fruits. Taste is spicy and yeasty also, like the aroma, with roasted malts, candy and caramel. Very refreshing to be a Dubbel and alcohol is well hidden. Aftertaste is spicy. Very interesting.
33cl bottle. Widely available. Average Belgium beer from the lot. 02/18 batch was overly carbonated. A bit of a disappointment.

When you open the bottle I noticed at once a pleasant perfume. Following this sense the aroma is absolutely delicious with roasted malt in the right measure, floral, herbal smell and an accurate touch of caramel.
It has a dark brown color and slight turbidity.
The cream is bulky and beige with medium duration.

The high carbonation is noticeable from the start and roasted malt notes has a beautiful balance as well. The caramel malt, wood, cocoa, licorice and nuts. Has a strong tone and rustic, yet does not appear heavy.
He brought me a medium flavor tempered pulling the same and so salty, I could see a slight memory of a brandy because it is volatile and appears just in taste. Alcohol is noticed in the heat that transmits the throat.
Long end she is malted reducing cabornatado taste and formatting a very soft palate between good bitterness and light caramel.
Medium complexity high is strong and powerful and full-bodied beer just right.
Being slightly dry and medium bitterness and prepares the way for the next sip.
Due to certain salient features not shown exceptionally balanced, but has a gorgeous footprint.
I liked its drinkability.
Caso típico da cerveja que faz juz ao estílo, essa Dubbel não tem o que dizer... Fruit yeast taste, dark color, sweet aroma.
Tuoksu hedelmäinen, alkoholinen. Vaahto kestävä. Maku hapokas, latteahko, helppo. Suutuntuma turhan hapokas makuuni.

Bottle from a mix pack. Pours a true copper, quite active, lots of carb, fluffy creame coloured head, loads of thick lacing. Nose is sweet malt, touch of roast, a little spicy. Tastes spicy, sweet malt again, a little heat. Quite smooth.
Tap at the yard house. Ruby red-brown color, thick creamy foam. Aroma of malt, chocolate and caramel. Sweet malt taste, light chocolate, lively on the palate. Great beer.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a murky, brown tone, with a modest layer of tan head foam, and spotty lacing. The nose was malty sweetness, ripened & dried fruit, and a hint of banana. Medium bodied, with soft carbonation, the flavors sweetness was more as brown sugar, esters included some ripe apple, and the alcohols disposition was pleasantly warming. Maybe a little age on this bottle, but still tasty.

11.2 oz bottle poured into chalice. Aroma of malts and some fruit with a slight almost smokiness. Pours a rich dark brown with a rapidly dissipating light beige head. Very great mouthfeel with a perfect amount of carbonation to it. Flavors of malt and yeast throughout. Exceptional beer.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours brown with small beige head.Aroma is sweet, roasted malts, some coffee and caramel, vanilla,dates.Taste is sweet, malts, toffee, caramel, dark fruits. Full body. Good beer.
UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 330cc bottle. One of my favourites from one of my favourite stiles. I always have them home. It just feels that everything in it is where it should be.

Butelka; barwa brazowa, zmętniona. Piana bujna, cienka warstwa zostaje do końca. Aromat owocowy, bananowy, przyprawowy, słodowy, ciemnych suszonych owoców, karmelu, wanilii. Smak owocowy, karmelowy, bananowy, przyprawowy. Alkohol rozgrzewajacy, trochę zbyt wyczuwalny. W ustach gładkie.
11.2 oz bottle pours murky brown with a tan head. Fruity aroma. Taste is malty and fruity. Very smooth and enjoyable. Great dubbel!
Im a big fan of the St. Bernardus Quadruppel and Tripel but Im afraid I didnt care to much for this Prior 8. Its a decent beer but rather lacks on the aroma.
