330 ml bottle 
Clear mahogany brown beer with beige head, quite faint for a Belgian ale. Aroma has sour appley Belgian yeast, dark fruits, dark sugar, raisin and fudge. Flavor has burned sugar, fudge and dark fruits. Palate is medium full and foamy. Finish has medium bite of bitterness. Aftertaste has alcohol, herbs, burned sugar and licorice. Pouring in the yeast makes the beer murky and adds some anise in the aftertaste. The beer is quite straightforward and harsh. OK for slow sipping, but Ive had better Belgian dark ales.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2015 33cl flesje via Jumbo, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 8%
Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin met dikke witte schuimkraag

Aroma en smaak: Belgisch gist, rozijnen, donker fruit, caramel

Conclusie: bekend abdijbier, blijft goed qua smaak

Smells beautiful, candi sugar, dark fruit and caramel in the aroma. Dark hazy brown, very effervescent with a long lasting brown head. Quite nice flavor in this one, upfront a chewy/spicy caramel flavor, finishing with more of the candi sugar and a bitterness noticeable around the tongue. All interesting malty characteristics, not much hop character in this one. Interesting, unique beer. Medium bodied and highly carbonated.

330ml bottle. Cloudy mahogany with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are bread, dried fruits, caramel, chocolate, brown sugar and alcohol with spicy and soapy notes. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, oily texture.

Bruin-rood bier met snel zakkende schuimkraag.
Zoetige neus vol met vijgen, dadels, rozijnen.
Zalig mondgevoel met zoete mout en gebrande karamel.
Lichte bitterheid in de afdronk.
Een topper!

Flesje 33cl tht 16 jul 2018. Mooi donkerbruin, schuim komt goed op maar verdwijnt vrijwel meteen. Veel mout en een beetje plattelandlucht is aangenaam aanwezig. Drinkt soepel en rond, de smaken zijn allemaal terug te vinden in het aroma. Vooral de mout. Alles is mooi in balans. Afdronk is licht bitter in de keel.

Appearance: Dark, rich, nutty brown-red, large white head, not a large amount of retention.
Aroma: Figs, dates, raisins, burnt caramel, toffee, brown sugar, sweet malts, hints of chocolate, and, chocolate malt, very slight hints of vanilla.
Palate: Full bodied and heavily carbonated.
Taste: Figs, dates, raisins, burnt caramel, toffee, rich sweet malt, banana, slight bitterness in the finish, but overall rich, sweet, and, complex, Michael Jackson once referred to Fullers Golden Pride as the "Cognac of Beers", I think the title is more fitting to this beer.
Overall: Absolutely gorgeous, complex, rich, sweet, reminiscent of Cognac in elements of the flavour and the level of complexity, lovely stuff this.
Very smooth.raisins and malt hits first written a bit of licorice lingering finishing with a flavor of dates. Pretty food

0,33 l bottle from Bierzwerg. Deep nut golden body with an inch thick foamy light brown head. Yeasty, wooden rock sugar and scented eraser on the nose. Inviting esters. Sweet, rock sugar, alco warm, Lasting meaty, mushroom like tones. medium to full bodied. Heavy carbonation.

On tap at Yard House in San Diego. Pours Amber with a creamy off white head. Aroma is caramel and burnt sugar. Flavor follows. Mild bitterness. Real nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours brown & bubbly. Aroma is odd: I cant quite place it but Mrs Tiki says it reminds her of a mechanics garage (she assures me this is a good thing). Flavour is a trip to the candy shop: melted rock candy meets dried fruit with a malt twang that hides some of the sugar. A great sipper. Bottle pulled from 6 pack sampler at the LCBO. Recommend.
bottle. Dark hazy brown with bubbly white head. Fruity, malty sweetness. Some yeast. Smooth and easy drinking dubbel, nice.
Pours a deep hazy brown aroma of raisins and prunes with some rummy notes. Flavor has more of the rummy notes, some acidity and raisiny fruitiness. Delicious beer.
Rispetto alla Pater 6, la prior 8 è molto più matura. Colore marrone, con un corpo ben strutturato, una buona presenza di malti, risulta essere molto corposa e rotornda e vellutata alla bevuta

330 mL bottle. Pours clear; deep mahogany with a thick cap of creamy off white head. Big malts up front, more bread than caramel. Light toffee leads into honeyed fig, overripe banana, molasses. Earthy-spicy Belgian yeast. Mild spicy-Old World hopping. A little sweet with just enough bitter hop to balance out on the drier side. Smooth, moderate to full bodied with high carbonation. Silky-creamy with great sustain. Just a hint of alcohol heat.
Braun, schaumig. Dunkle Früchte, Hefe, dunkler Zucker, leicht alkoholisch. Am Gaumen dunkle Früchte, Malz, Röstnoten, brauner Zucker, herb. Vollmundig.

Une bière très mousseuse, dun brun intense, avec un nez de fruits confits et de caramel. La bouche est riche, intense, avec les saveurs qui rejoignent les fruits et le sucre pré-mentionnés, mais lalcool est bien dissimulé, rajoutant à peine un peu de complexité au mélange, sans distraire de lensemble. Le tout peut sembler un peu sec pour ce style, par contre. Au final, une excellente bière, une très bonne dubbel, mais pas parmi lélite mondiale selon ce buveur.

Pours hazelnut brown with a white head. Has a nice sweet smell of caramel, burnt sugar, yeast and something earthy. The taste is very fruity but with something roasted. I get some dried fruits, nuts, burnt sugar, and some dark chocolate. The mouth feel is very siruppy.

This is great. Pours slightly murky brown lots of foamy head and minimal lacing. Nose is caramel and some fruit. Flavours of plums, some caramel, Cheerios hint of tang and brown bread. Taste light/med sweet light bitter. Medium body, somewhat silky with medium carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy amber color with medium offwhite head. Aroma - Nuts, caramel, fruits. Sweet taste with light bitterness.

330ml bottle from the LCBO. Brown body, off-white head. Earthy, wood, some dark fruit on the nose. The real beauty of this beer comes in the palate. It has a wonderfully sessionable and satiating body that is unparalleled. Some bitterness and alcohol presence in the finish, alcohol comes in a nice subtle warmth on the finish only.
Decidedly fruity but drier and more able bodied than its smaller brother Pater 6. Noticeable yeast and a fair bit of acidity. Long fruity finish.
Bottle. Dark Brown, white head. Taste is with coffee, nuts and caramel. This all combines to a nice drinkable beer. After one you probably want another one!
Dark brown colour, beige nicely lacing head. Roasted, sweet and creamy malt tones dominate the flavour with coffee, chocolate, vanilla, raisins. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation, good body.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 330 ml bottle from bier-deluxe.de.
Dark copper, clear body, with a big, creamy, stable, beige head.
Aroma with loads of dried, dark and somewhat fresh fruits, sweet apples, nuts, brown sugar.
Taste with the above mentioned aromas, also marzipan and slight roast.
Mouthfeel is medium, quite creamy, with a fizzy carbonation and it finishes warm, moderate bitter, fruity-sour and a bit sweet malty.

Delicious! Everything you want from a Dubbel, but with an even better balance than most beers of this style and with loads of lovely, multifarious aromas! Also pretty easy to drink, leaving you with a smooth warmth. Simply a perfect Dubbel!

A decent abbey dubbel that doesn’t get me all that excited. Dark, dried fruits. Medium palate. Some nuts. I expected more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle at home. Im going to be up front , this is an awesome beer. Pours a clear dark brown colour with a nice white head. Beefy, mellow, sweet, dark and luscious. Dark fruit, malt, sweet and lovely. A terrific beer, rich on the palate with a lovely finish. This is one of my favourite beers, a world classic. I am being a bit mean with the ratings, seek out and enjoy.
Beats Westvleteren?

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Pours hazy dark brownish with a lasting beige head. Decent lacing. Malty aroma of sugars and caramel. Something roasty as well. Bit yeasty, some dark fruits, spices... A tad of alcohol, some vanilla... Quite nice. The alcohol is somewhat disturbing though. Taste is a bit inbetween dry and sweet. Clear taste of the malts and the fruits. Moderately bitter, nice roastiness and a nice alcoholic kick that gives a lovely warmish mouthfeel in its bitterish end. Quite nice and quite well balanced. However, it doesnt last that long... Medium bodied, thinnish, yet creamy mouthfeel. Overall seen, quite a nice brew. It is definitely tasty and enjoyable, however not that groundbreaking also. Have had better dubbels though. Maybe Im expecting too much.

The smaller brother of the famed Sint-Bernardus Abt 12, with a thick, moussy, light beige, very lacing head, very stable, and a deep, dark bronze colour, clear but hazy with deposit, as expected. Aroma of bitter chocolate, molasses, raisins, dried plums, grass, leather, straw, iron, black pepper, dried banana, caramel, bourbon, soapy hops, nutmeg and quite strong liquorice. Taste begins with a refinedly sweet, dried fruitiness, raisins, dried banana again, apple, medium but still minerally carbonation, slick and slightly oily mouthfeel, deep caramelly and somewhat nutty and chocolatey malts, lots of spicy yeastiness in an elegant way, dry finish with grassy, leafy European hops along with the chocolate maltiness lingering on and a warming, whisky-like alcohol effect, on the brink of becoming wry but just managing to avoid that. Another great Sint-Bernardus, relating to its bigger brother in much the same way as Westvleteren 8 relates to Westvleteren 12: leaner, lighter, more dry and a tad more restrained, with a less attacking bouquet. Still a great beer in which malts, hops and yeastiness are balanced to perfection. I will do a side-by-side tasting of this with Westvleteren 8 soon, and Ill do the same thing with Sint-Bernardus Abt 12 and Westvleteren 12 the same day. Do not (completely) believe the people who tell you this is an easy-to-find alternative for Westvleteren 8: though the similarities are striking, this still is a great beer in its own right, and I am quite convinced I can tell the two apart in a blind tasting. Same for the bigger versions, Id like to add.

Old rating rerated 22.10.2014, 0,33l bottle shared with a colleague @ hotel room in Ulsteinvik:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is mild fruity, yeast, banana, caramel malts, dried dark fruits, grass, sugar bread, almonds. Taste is slightly dry and harsh boozy, grass, almond essence, old leafs, harsh yeast, paper, banana, sugar. Medium bitterness, harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

So smooth and easy to drink. Taste is very clean. Wonderful Dubbel. Malty aroma with some fruit aroma and malty complex flavor. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flesje, 33cl. Kleur is niet transparant roodbruin met een dikke offwhite schuimkraag die lang blijft staan. Zeer zwakke wat moutige geur. In eerste instantie wat weinig smaak, de bittere hop smaak komt wat later door eindigt in een wat zoete nasmaak. Wat mij betreft iets meer body, geur en smaak.
Pours dark amber, with a frothy head. Aroma is complex, nuts, dark fruity, alcohol. Taste also complex, fruity, somme roastedness. very nice.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 Color castagna, marrone rossiccio con schiuma beige fine, non troppo ampia ma velatamente persistente. Bellissimo e complesso lodore. Cereali, biscottini al burro, frutta candita. Poi mele alle castagne e pere, cioccolata , mosto delluva. Sul.finire cannella e coriandolo. Cè di tutto ed è duraturo. In bocca sento prugne, poi cioccolata e biscotti al burro. Il finale è alle castagne, ma astringente. Qualche sentore di frutta. Corpo pieno e carbonatazione massiccia, è cremosa in bocca. Non richiede una bevuta continua ma meditativa. Il retrogusto è di biscottini ai cinque cereali glassati con il cioccolato al latte. Per i miei gusti top dei top. Ottima

330mL BB 24.6.18
Murky bronze body with a good sized beige head hanging about.
Big whiff of yeast character on the nose; proving bread dough, clove, overly ripe bananas and pears, earthy dark brown candy sugar, toasty nutty malts, sultana, fig, touch of booze.
Lively carbonation, creamy rich body.
Palate deliver plenty of figgy, dark brown sugar, dried fruitiness, with undertones of earthy spicy hop, vinous fruits & peppery phenolics. Slight booze dries out the finish.
Tremendously good, though it must be said it lacks that little bit of extra oomph that the best Belgian/Trappist ales possess.

Pours clear (first glass) to muddy and particulate-laden (second glass) ruby-tinged deep amber with two fingers of loose off-white head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, light lacing (3/5). Nose is dark caramel malt, dark fruit, Belgian yeast, some vanilla. (8/10). Taste is moderate brown sugar sweet, mild bitter, alcohol (8/10). Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, with a smooth, lightly boozy finish (4/5).

A decent abbey dubbel that doesnt get me all that excited. Decent dark flavour and boozy finish, but ultimately falls just a little short. Im not sure exactly whats not doing it for me, but I just cant rank this above the 8/10 "world class" line. (15/20)

Draft. Dark brown with hints of bronze color. Initially thick tan head with substantial lacing. Fruit aroma with spicy notes. Light; some dark fruit followed by toasted--even a little smoky--maltiness. Medium to long finish with plum notes and some bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flasa. Tmavsia jantarova farba, pena skoro ziadna. Vona ovocna, citrusova. V chuti sladovost, citrusove a kvetinove tony, alkohol, horkost v pozadi.
Bottle. Aroma biscuits, nutmeg, raisins. Clear amber to brown colour. Taste is rather dry, high carbonation, bubbly mouthfeel. Spicy flavour, light fruity. Overall good.
Bottle from Fajry, thanks. Pours brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma is very nuty, caramel, sweet. Taste is medium sweet, sugary, nuts, lightly bitter. Bittersweet coffee finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a Chimay chalice.
A: Pours a dark amber to chestnut cloudy color. Forms a medium, fluffy and beige head. Medium retention and only few lacings left
S: Sweet caramel. Strong on Belgium yeasts and grains. Bit of vanilla. Dark fruits (mainly raisins). Alcohol
T: Sweet upfront. Strong on candy sugar. Caramel malts, dark fruits (plums and raisins), brown bread, roasted malts. Metallic. The classic Belgium yeasts. Bitter-sweet belgian style. Mild earthy bitter end
M: Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Bit molasses. Alcohol. Sweet in the beginning and a little bit bitter in the end
O: Good drinkability. Great Beer. St. Bernardus quality
[ BA Review @ 1/15/2010 ]

Bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark brown. Some off-white head. Quite sweet. Surprisingly light body. Some warmth. Soft carbonation. Candy, plum, brown sugar, rum flavour. Could use some more body and carbonation in my opinion.

Bottle from Hypermarche at John's in France. Honey cola color with foamy tan head. Aroma is bready malts but not as typically abbey style as I expected. Taste is more crisp and balanced than usual abbey style - not as sweet or plum-like. Happily some bitterness on the finish. Crisp and bubbly but not as much as usual abbey. All in all - pleasantly surprising un-abbey style abbey beer. Prefer it to the 12 from the same brewery.
Love me some Belgian sting ales!!! Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx cxxxxxgfbgggrsnqjtwmshjwyjwtjatjtwjtwjwtnstjcs

Presenta color ámbar claro con media capa de espuma con buena retención, en nariz aromas a malta tostada, frutos rojos, ciruelas y caramelo; en boca entrada suave y maltosa con ligero amargor, pos gusto dulce con notas a azúcar y especias; cuerpo ligero con carbónico alto y alcohol bien integrado en una cerveza doble de abadía que cumple las expectativas.
12oz bottle - pours a dirty brown with red hue and tan head. Sweet cherry cola aroma. Taste brings some brown sugar, cherry and bit of dark fruit. Super smooth, an excellent bottle of beer.
dark fruit, yeasty character abounds, but i found the flavor to be lacking in comparison to the aroma. pretty highly carbonated like all the St B brews. nice offering, but not quite a standout."

Nice. There are other Bernardus beers I like better but still very good. Beatiful copper red colour with a creamy head. Flavor is fairly sweet with brown sugar red fruit hops and yeast. Slightly alcoholic but well balanced. Top quality.

Bottle from Au Grain D?Orge - Deep brown ruby color with a huge frothy beige head fully lasting and beautiful lacing - Aroma of malt, caramel, red fruits, dried prune, spicy, candy sugar, very pleasant aroma - Flavor more caramel and candy sugar, dried fruits ( plum, raisin) spicy, hints of alcohol - medium/full body, medium bitterness, light carbonation, sweet, sweet malt dried fruits with hints of alcohol finish - really good beer, well balanced not too sweet, one of my favorite dubble

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 It appears hazy amber/orange with an off-white head. Aroma of yeast, caramel, red fruits and bread. Tastes medium sweet and light bitter in the finish. Very well balanced. Soft carbonation, full body and creamy, pleasant texture. A great beer.
Fenomenal. Deliciosa. Aroma divino. Desce que nem veludo. Saborosa demais. Uma das melhores
Bottle. Hazy amber color with a medium thick foamy off-white head. Aroma of caramel, yeast, syrup, mahogany and nuts. Sweet, sour and bitter taste in a good balance. Medium body.
A soft, sweet chocolate aroma, soothing. A subtile touch of banana in the mouth. Drinks easily. An excellent choice!

0,33 l bottle at home 
 caramel, cereal, floral, roasty, chocolate, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, creamy, fizzy,
Bottle 0.33l at Au Miror in Ypres Belgium.Pour it dark colour with small white head.Taste of caramel, Belgian Yeast and little bit of rust/metal.But very good balanced.

33cl in a proper glass. This beer is much better than the 12. The head is very bitter and nutty and delicious but it disappears quickly, leaving just 1 or 2 mm. It tastes great, not as much champagne/ alcohol as the 12; just about perfectly balanced. I give it my highest recommendation.
Dark brown body, huge beige head. Aroma is dark fruit, spice, alcohol. Taste is sweet with light bitterness. Medium to heavy body, average to lively carbonation, dry bitter finish.
Bottle at home, drinking like the Duchess of Solihull. Taste of caramel, bready malts with dark fruit. Sweet and comforting flavour. Delicious :)

Botella de 33 cl en la antigua internacional de Oviedo, tomada en junio de 1999. lote 458 hasta antes de fin de 2000. color marrón con aromas maltosos y sabores dulces con ciertos toques ácidos acabando con un ligero ligero amargo. No esta mal.
manque un peu de profondeur, malgré une belle apparence et des aromes de base agréables, une bonne bière tout de même

Couleur du caramel brumeux avec un tête moyen marron/beige. Larôme du malt, caramel, fruits noir et sec. Le goût est dabord du malt sucré et des fruit noir murs puis du caramel avec une finition légèrement amer.
Pours brown, minimal head. Taste of malt, rich, nutty, raisins. Nice dry finish. Thats it
Een heel lekker donker bier met goed veel smaak aan. Een van men favoriete bieren.

From a bottle in a snifter. Flavor is rich, sweet, complex, and with no downside. Very nice malt and caramelized sugars. Really good. Only negative is that I got a swig of the settled solids and it was not good.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Weak aroma, thick head, sweet taste of chocolate. Light carbonation. Mild palate and short aftertaste. Could have been so much more.
Bottle. Brown pour with creamy tan head. Aroma and taste of dark fruit, Belgian yeast and spices. Great stuff
Mild sweet yeasty aroma. Dark yellow with medium light yellow cap. Balanced sweet-bitter mild taste.
Grosse attente sur cette brune belge. Déçue. Une pointe dacidité un peu dérangeante.

Cloudy brown color, big white head with good retention. Solid amount of lacing. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Aroma is very roasty, lots of dried fruits, malts and hints of smoke. Medium sweet taste with dry finish. Very good.

Brown, clear with off white head. Some floating particles. Very sweet, full bodied, and malty with notes of caramel, chocolate. Low bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Transfer from BA review on 8-8-12 - 
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass
 Appearance  Served a medium deep reddish-brown color with a light haze and a one finger white head. The head faded over time to give a medium level of lacing.
 Smell  The aroma is heaviest of dark fruit aromas of prune, raisin, fig, and some cherry. These sweeter fruit flavors are also complimented by some aromas of a bready malt as well as some molasses. Overall the aroma is sweet and delicious.
 Taste  The taste begins more on the maltier side with hints of a roasted malt and brown bread. These flavors quickly sweeten as the dark fruit flavors that were detected in the nose come to the tongue. These tastes are mixed with a caramel and molasses flavor which greatly sweeten the profile. At the end of the taste, some boozy and vanilla flavors meet the tongue and take the taste to the end.
 Mouthfeel- The body of the beer is on the slightly higher side with some nice creaminess and has a carbonation level being just below average.
 Overall  A tasty brew, but in comparison to its bigger brother 12 it is nothing to really pine for. For the dubbel style it is more towards the top of the line, but not the best out there (at least in my opinion)

Bottle 750ml. Cloudy brown with beige head. Sweetish malty aroma, yeasty, milk chocolate, a bit floral. Heavy sweet-sour malty flavor, yeasty, milk chocolate. Creamy texture. Lively carbonation. Full body. Sweet yeasty aftertaste. Very nice.

pours a nice chestnut color with about an average foamy head. The head itself is rather dense just not very tall. Nicely carbonated.
Foam fades but the carbonation always keeps a wispy ring floating on top.
I get a rich malt aroma topped by candied sugar.
Rich and malty tasting with candied sugar yeast and fruity essence, maybe candied plumes. Alcohol taste is bold and in your face. Luckily the ABVs are at a more moderate level for this light weight.
A medium to full bodied beer with a drier finish.
Pours a dark brown body with a thick head. Malty aroma and a rich, complex and very nice taste. Well hidden alcohol compared to the abt 12.

Sweet, malty Christmas cake on the nose. Well carbonated to give this an initially light feel followed by a toffee ice cream finish. A very good, fruity Belgium classic ale. 

Rated by BrewTom

Pours a deep chestnut. with one finger of lacing tan head. Aroma is dense with yeast, dark bread, stonefruit, and a bit of hop. Taste follows suit with a moderate to heavy sweetness. Spicy yeast, a full body, and soft carbonation. One great beer
不知道是否家 Bernardus該有的紅酒&
Overall: Sweet, raisins, sherry, licorice.Note: Bottle 330 ml at Matverkstan. Reviewed 2014-07-05.
Bottle at home. Slightly darker than Pater 6, just as lively and easily identifiable Belgian style. Nose improved. Major note is still malt and the taste is still bubbly and balanced. Very enjoyable.
Large foamy head. Bready and malty, sweet and a little boozy. Creamy palate and medium body. Very good.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 On tap at the Atlanta Yard House in June 2014, and from a .33L bottle (BB date stamp of Sept. 2016) in a St. Bernardus snifter in June 2016. 

A: clear dark amber with a good beige head. 

Aroma: loads of dark fruit aromas including dates and raisins. Slight boozy with some nice spicy and bready aspects to the lingering aftertaste. 

Flavor: Sweet up front turning bitter-sweet by the finish. Very fruity as is the aroma.  Rich, with great depth. 

Feel: medium body; proper carbonation thats lively yet soft.
Eccellente esempio di dubbel, dai chiari sentori fruttati, maltati e caramellati, con accenni soprattutto di ciliegia e prugna.

Mélyvörös színben pompázó apátsági remekmű, mely rendkívül titokzatosan kezd, illata legalábbis meglehetősen visszafogott, alig árul el valamit a főzetről. Édeskésen hömpölyög a szánkba, melyet a tapasztalás útján egy pörkölt malátás aroma követ, amúgy belgásan, végül némi komló jelenléte zárja a sort. Az ízek azonban annyira együtt vannak, hogy szétválasztani és külön kiemelni őket felesleges volna, tökéletesen összetett, masszív darab.

Pours dark cloudy brown amber with a large beige lasting head, some mild lacing. Dark dry fruit and Belgian yeast as well as some mild fruity alcohol ester fill the senses. Taste is mild toasted caramel malt followed by a mix of dark dry fruit and Belgian yeast, bread notes. Palate is a medium body, smooth mouth feel with good carbonation. Dry fruit, yeast and bread notes with mildly toasted caramel malt and alcohol on the end. A very well made and nicely balanced brew.

0,33 bottle purchased in Rome. It pours a typical abbey/dubbel reddish brown, frothy ivory head which quickly dissipates and leaves a lacing. Nose is dry fruit (prunes), amber malts and caramel. In the mouth this beer offers a nice feel: yeast, light caramel feel and bitter sharp cut which cleans the mouth in the end. Very dry end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Brown, clear with small particles. Big head, gusing.
Aroma: Pretty weak, I expected someting more intense. Alcohol, caramel, dark fruits, yeasts, bread.
Sweet taste. Flavor of bread, caramel with alcoholic finish. 
Full budy, high carbonation.

I expected someting great from this classic beer. Maybye it is not a good day for a beer :)
33 cl bottle shared two ways. Hazy darkish golden pour with a frothy head that fades quickly. Nose has figs, sugar, grain and some honey. Taste is yeasty with sweet malty notes and grainy.
Clear brown pour with light head. Aroma is dark fruit. Taste is plum and mellow maltiness. Good beer.

a nice head and dark brown and nice. Fruity aroma, almost a little dark cherry mixed wirh plums. Tastes a little cherry, maybe a little plum. Complex taste of fruit,, malt sweetness and warming alcohol finish.
best beer for my opinion.

Always a fav and never rated before. Draft at the Yardhouse in Boca in a chalice. Pours a very hazy, brown with hint of orange. Thick pillow head lasted and laced. Aroma of Belgian yeasts, sweet dark candies, malts, fruits like orange and apricots. The taste is similar with that traditional style Belgian yeasts and sweet dark candied sugars. Orange and apricot esters with some other dark fruits as well (plums or prunes?) Biscuit, bready finish. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation. Always good.

Brown with burnt orange tones. Nose of yeast esters, Belgian candy, faint datk fruit and toasted malt. Flavor is lightly sweet toast malt, with hints of roasted malt, as well as mild dark fruit and other fruit yeast aspects. Lingering biscuit, toasted malt and fruit. Enjoyable and clean.
Bottle. Deep brown with a beige head. Dark sugar, prunes, toffee and bread. Sweet candi and toffee.

33cl bottle from t Drankenhuys. Hazy brown with a medium off-white head. Medium to full body with light carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. Sweet with some bitter tones. Brown sugar, caramel, spices and dark fruits. A full flavoured tastefull brew.
UPDATED: APR 19, 2015 Bottle. Brown, minimal head, brown foam, medium bitterness, full body, soft carbonation, & long finish.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2014 From bottle, pours hazy dark brown with tints of orange and a HUGE light beige head. Head was 6 inches before I had 1/4 inch of beer in the glass. Dense fine foam lasts forever. Aroma is caramel and dark fruits with Belgian yeast. Taste similar, mildly sweet with some bitterness. Perfect medium body. Lovely.

Donker biertje.
Smaak: caramel, chocolde, kruiden met een licht bittere nasmaak.
Goed bier.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2014 Hazy brown colour (not that dark), medium/large head which dissolves to a nice 1 cm layer. Beautiful cake, toffee, caramel, brown sugar aroma, with a little hint of licorice. Tastes caaake, dried friuts, dates, cookies, belgian yeasts, with a little licorice/( smaaall coffee) perfectly sweet end. Leaves a fresh, bit dry, perfect sweet balanced palate. 100 % malts here, but with an incredible balance. A lower gravity sister of the St. Bernardus Abt 12, so you can defenitely discover where those deep belgian flavours come from. One of the best dubbels on the planet, if not the best. A must taste, if you love dark belgians

Aroma: caramel, honey. Appearance: medium hazy dark, medium beige head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: initial sweets make way for light bitters, getting a bit bitter, caramel sweets in the background. Overall: nice Abbey Dubbel. Bottle at t Brugs Beertje, Bruges.
Black pour with a monstrous head, aroma is toffee, caramel, dark fruits, spice and alcohol. Taste is fruity, roast malt, alcohol and bananas. Excellent

The body has a dark burgundy color with lighter reddish high lights. On top the head was about one finger thick and hangs on well but slowly fades to a ring of foam around the edge of the glass. It is light tan in color and makes some spotty and slippery lacing. In the node dark fruity and estery notes mix with a mild sweet alcohol presence. Its flavor has a pleasant sweet and malty complexity. There are hints of dates and figs sweetened by Belgian sugar, warmed by a mellow brandy like alcohol presence and tempered by some mild bitterness of hops. The palate has a smooth but lively texture with active carbonation.
Dark brown color, Aroma of sweet malt and some yeast. Full bodied with high carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter. Very good abbey ale
Bottle. Dark hazy brown with huge light brown head. Sweet aromas of malt, plums, brown sugar, raisins and prunes. Flavor is sweet, lots of dark fruit, malt and spices. Syrupy texture.

Obviously related to its big brother, the 12. And we cant help but compare. The same looks, but overall a bit less. Less pronounced taste, less body, shorter finish. Still excellent quality though, worthy of the name

From bottle. Tawney brown with pint glass filling off-white head. Some sediment. Full aroma of dark fruit, vinous at first, rounded out with a caramel malts and suggestions of sugar candies. Nose sweetens on warming. Taste is dried figs and raisins, buttressed with a beady malt quality. Just a little dash of pepper. Very well put together. Nice, round flavors that blend effortlessly into one-another. Great tasting.
pours dark brown. smells sweet malt and belgian yeast. taste is the same good beer

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2014 
Location: Draft at Mekong, 5/2/14, Wouldnt have guessed this wasnt rated yet


Aroma: The nose is malty and rich, lots of dark fruit (plum, raisin), brown sugar, and spice

Appearance: It pours a dark brown color with a reddish hue, and a light brown head

Flavor: The flavor is malty and sweet, fairly complex, lots of dark fruit, and some spice as well

Palate: The body is medium-plus, it has a pretty good mouthfeel, and a bit of heat

Overall Impression: 
This is beer I hadnt had for quite sometime, but it also a beer I knew would work in the exact situation that existed at the time, so I picked it out, and as I knew I would be, I was quite satisfied. No complaints here. This beer does what it does, and it does it rather well.

Pours dark cloudy brown. Aroma of sweet malt and some yeast. Taste is clean and crisp, with sufficient medium carbonation. Taste leans to the sweat side (a bit too much) but is balanced well by some mellow bitterness, which is slightly hoppy, and by the carbonation that lends a slight sour tang. Flavor profile is strong malt and caramel, some yeast and liquorice notes, with some fruitiness and spice hints, perhaps some gentle herbal notes. Some taste of the alcohol combines to a wine like flavor. Goes down nice and crisp with well balanced sweetness and bitterness. Very good abbey ale, but a tad to sweet. Will make a great desert beer.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with an overflowing frothy beige head that leaves good lace. Flavors of sour fruit, yeast, a bit of alcohol and hay. Complex and moderately balanced. Need to let the rest of the bottles sit for a while before opening. Body is light to medium, fizzy carbonation, light sourness and a bitter sweet finish.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2014 Copper hue and a large creamy khaki-colored long lasting head. Nose is complex (malty, hoppy and yeasty). Full bodied with high carbonation and velvet texture. Taste is sweet and bitter. Palate is dominated by toffee, chocolate, herbs, flowers, hops, soap, earth, raisins, port, rum and much more. Bitter aftertaste. flaska hemma. lätt skum, vit färg, stora bubblor som snabbt försvann. Jästgrumlig brun färg. Doft med tydlig maltsötma, karamell, jäst, örter, diskret lakrits, lite bröd. Kraftig karamellsmak, lite lakrits, örter, plommon, russin. Torr sötma i eftersmaken. Lätt beska i smaken som sen nästan är obefintlig i eftersmaken. Kraftig kropp som bryts av till en fräsh len vaniljton i eftersmaken.

333 mml Tap tasted on 29/04/2014. Brown colour with a very intensive white and mid creamy head. The flavour is predominant red fruites and cola. The aroma is very dark fruit, caramel and sugar. Very nice sweet aftertaste. Full body with medium/high carbonation. Next one please!

Location/Date:Bottle on April 25th, 2014. 
Appearance: Pours a dark brown red.
Aroma:Aroma of dark fruit..
Taste: Malty, dark fruit, yeasty.
Palate:<Medium light, lingering aftertaste.
Summary: Surprised I havent had this yet, as its the #1 Abbey Dubbel on RB. Really tasty.

On tap at World of Beer. The Villages, FL.

Not as good as I was expecting. Maybe I had my expectations set to high. Poured with a two finger head which dissipated quickly. Tasted like a standard Belgium Dubbel. Raisins, figs, dark fruit. Well balanced and tasty brew.

26 apr 2014, tap. Brown. Nose is lightly burnt toast crust, faint coffee, mild alcohol. Thin/med body and mildly fizzy. Cherries, toast, lightly meaty, toasty grain, sugary malt, mild alcohol. Pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very attractive chestnut brown colour, butter coloured head. Medium bodied, fresh and invigorating in the mouth. Malty, subtle banana and spices. Like a quads baby brother, very enjoyable in its own right.

Bottle from Dranken Pauwels. Murky reddish chestnut brown, big off white foam head which dissipates to thin. Nose is malty and fruity. Rich toffee and caramel , fig and prune dried fruit, bit of sugary sherberty spice. Taste is toffee and caramel, dried fig, fruit cake. Delicious malty Belgian beer.

Dark amber, reddish, clear with big white, dense, medium-lasting head, medium lacing. Malty sweetness, moderate and noticable fruity esters esp. fresh apple esters, than dark fruits - plums, raisins. Medium malty sweetness, low bitterness, some yeasty and earthy notes, fruity and fresh - apple and dark fruits esters, some alcohol noticable. Medium body, high carbonation, very low alcohol warmth. Refreshing and fruity dubbel. Highly drinkable.

For me this beer was like their Tripel but maltier and with less alcohol. It has a medium low body, spicy, orange, coriander, etc. I thought this was an excellent beer, but it is just ok, will drink it again, maybe I had a bad batch?

Pours medium brown with a small white head that stuck around and left great lacing. Aroma is earthy, yeast, dark fruit and spice. Taste is sweet with some tartness. Medium bodied, smooth and not quite creamy.
It is a strong beer and it tastes like it. But that said it does taste smooth and full of flavour

Dark brown. Cloudy. Yeast bits at bottom. Tastes like a malty Duvel. High carb - slowly gushed from bottle. Dark fruit / pruney. Tasted better as it warmed up. Aroma was amazing when warmer too (obviously...). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma frutado, notas de caramelo e cravo. Sabor levemente adocicado com toques amargos e algo de banana. Aparência caramelo escuro, sem nenhum resquício no paladar além da beleza dessa garrafa. No geral, sem palavras.

From a bottle. Medium to dark brown with a good beige head. Both aroma and taste combine spices, caramel and bananas. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Vrij warm in het paultje, veel en lang schuim, volle, lekkere smaak. Droppig, niet scherp maar zacht.
Tap at Smithouse in LA. Brown pour, large tan head, lots of lacing, caramel and hoppy aroma, some spices, sweet flavor, again lots of caramel.

Beautiful pour into the glass with a nice color. Brown sugar, date and figs on the nose. Nice head w/excellent lacing on the glass. The lighter mouthfeel contradicts the heavier aromas but in a very pleasant way. Nice finish and an excellent beer.
Bottle. Pours a nice dark brown. Nose is dark fruits and brown sugar. Taste is sweet, raisins and figs. Great dubbel!

Hazy brown, coppery color with dirty white head, disappear quickly. Lovely, intense sweet aroma. Dark fruits, dried fruits like plums, apricots, wet bread, pepper, malts. Taste is semi sweet. Flavors of dried fruits, apricots, plums, red wine, roasted malts, raisins. Warming sweet finish. Full body with medium /high carbonation. Consistency liqueur. Very good beer!

Bomber to a snifter. Gift from the Newlyweds. Thanks Jana and Russell! Pours an attractive hazy brown with rapidly receding foamy white head. Notes of raisins, spice, toffee and fresh baked bread... A warm satisfying finish ... Tasty!

brows picy candy spicy caramel toffee medium dry ness
Scura nocciola spezie discreto malto

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a hazy brown Color with white head. Aroma of alcohol, nuts and toffee.Taste is bitter with nuts, toffee, earthy notes, ripe fruits, syrup and malts.
