Grapes and sugar aromas, yeasty/bread. Grape juice, honey, plums, caramel, sugar, candied orange. Light body.

Bottle poured into a snifter glass. Dark hazy brown with a medium tan head that left pretty heavy lacing. Smell is of raisins and malt. Taste of same but with a floral body. Very light for as dark as it is! Quite tasty on an early spring evening. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml. 2010. Brune. Beau collet beige. Nez: caramel. Banane. Noix. Cartonné. Raisin sec. Anis. Bouche: caramel intense. Ronde et riche. Un peu madérisé. Noix (légèrement rance). Légèrement fruité. Fruit séché. Figue/datte. Caramel au beurre salé. Vanillé. Très bien vieillie.
Cerveja forte, encorpada e marcante. Coloração escura, com ótima formação de espuma e boa persistência. No sabor, um caramelo marcante.

Hazy brown color , medium beige head. Aroma of raisins , caramel malt , hint of chocolate. Taste is malty with notes of dark fruits , caramel , spices. Medium body , moderate carbonation. Fruits and light bitterness in aftertaste. Great!
Bottle at var. Hazy brown color, white head. Bitter taste with nuts, toffee, earthy notes, ripe fruits, syrup and malts. Bitter finish with hops, nuts, toffee and malts. Excellent abbey dubbel.
Bue en bouteille de 33Cl. Classique double belge, assez corpulente. Couleur orangée foncée. On sent les malts avec une finale à peine amère. Alcool bien équilibrée. Good.
Dark brown pour with a white head. Tastes of malt and caramel with a hint of fruit. Very good.

Privatimport via Belgianbeerz.com. Mörkt brunröd färg med stort fluffigt skum. Doftar russin och kavring. Hint av cocos när den kommer in i munnen men utvecklas till en maltig russinmacka som fortsätter att utvecklas efter att den passerat gomseglet. Liten smak av jäst och väl dold alkohol. En riktigt bra Abbey dubbel.
Pours opaque copper, dark fruit and raisin aroma. Taste is raisin and bread. Dry finish, light to medium body. Light alcohol. Classic example.

33cl bottle @ home. Dark-brown color, big beige head. Aroma caramel, dark fruits, cocoa, medium roasted malt which turns to a bit heavier later. Taste light sweetness, medium (later heavy) bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, average to lively carbonation, fine bitter finish. Excellent dessert style abbey dubbel.

Massive malt nose of chocolate, coffee, and hazelnuts. Great color and thick head which left decent lacing. Taste was sweeter than expected, and quite fruity. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Hazy cooper with a thin off white head. Aromas of caramel, spice, plum, raisin and clove. Flavor is similar with some dark fruit. Medium bodied lingering dark fruit.

0,33L bottle, BB 12.12.2017. Pours dark red amber with off white head. The head stays. Aroma is caramel and fruits. Taste is surprisingly sour, fruits, malt, and yeast. Alcohol is well hidden. Overall: nice one.
Dunkel mørkebrun farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell og toffee. Smak av malt, karamell og frukt. Melkebaren.
Nydelig duft av toffie, karamell og krydder. Fin karamell farge. Tynn hinne med skum. Smak av karamell, toffie og krudder.

11.2 oz. bottle from Hazels. Appearance: two fingers of light brown head, deep amber to brown color, very cloudy, Aroma: light roast, molasses, leaves, slight nuttiness, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, slightly dry finish, slightly oily texture, light but noticeable alcohol warming sensation. Taste: very malty sweet with light yeasty sweet finish. Overall, complex aroma and tastes that fit together nicely. Not very unique, but very well done version of something that has been done a million and one times.

Non è che si presenti poi bene con quel suo mogano torbido, ma fa però da subito una bellissima (ed indissolubile) schiuma.
Ottimi aromi si percepiscono a livello olfattivo. In bocca poi è morbida, corposa e rotonda; da una bella sensazione con gusti di caramello, frutta candita e forse mandorle.
Assolutamente non frizzante (pregio non da poco), lascia un ottimo retrogusto ed i gradi si fanno sentire con uno scendere giù che ha delletilico.
Birra complessa che forse trova nella degustazione la sua vocazione migliore. 
Un ottimo acquisto da ripetere senzaltro.
------& is then that you present well with his dark mahogany, but it does, however, suffered from a beautiful (and unbreakable) foam.
Great aromas are an olfactory. In the mouth it is soft then, full-bodied and round, with a nice feel with flavors of caramel, candied fruit and almonds maybe.
Absolutely not sparkling (no small merit), it leaves a great aftertaste and degrees are felt with a fall down that delletilico.
Complex beer that is perhaps the best tasting his vocation.
A good buy from again for sure.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a hazy brownish-red with a tan head. Taste sweet, malty, dark fruit. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach getrockneten Früchten, Hefe, Karamell.
Geschmack hefig, Karamell, Früchte, leicht gewürzig.

Bottle from Great Grog. Chestnut brown body with a thin off-white head. Light lacing. Subtle aroma of brown sugar, wood, cinnamon, cherry and liquorice. Flavour of caramel, grass, fig and Marmite. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. A decent malty Dubbel, but, if Im honest, its less complex and interesting than I hoped it would be.

This beer was quite a surprise. Its a little sweet but not too sweet, but the best of it all is its creaminess and nice aftertaste it leaves in your mouth. If youre looking for a strong beer with a punch, this is not for you but if youre looking a beer with delicate flavors and details, you must definitely try this one.
33 cl bottle 8.0% abv. Huge head, malty nose. Dark bitter chokolate hints, sort of dry mouthfeel. Alcohol heat. Some dark fruits too but not too dominating. A class abbey ale.
A sweet citrus yeasty aroma that is very unique. Has a deep gold brown color and a wonderful sweet malty flavor.

Divine bière brune. A goûter absolument.

La Prior 8 est une bière délicieuse dun brun foncé qui présente une saveur ample avec une agréable touche de malt et fruit. Elle est coiffée dune mousse crémeuse avec un arrière-goût en bouche qui accorde subtilement la douceur et lamertume. (8% vol.alc.)

Diverse Flaschen (33 cl), in Belgien wie daheim. - Dunkles Rotbraun, trüb. Intensive obergärig-fruchtige Nase. Auch im Antrunk intensive, süßliche Fruchtnoten, die an einen Weizenbock erinnern: Banane, Mango, Pflaumenmus, etwas Bonbonartiges. Stark rezent, zu sehr schäumend. Kandissüße, Röstmalz und zarte pikante Säure, dazu eine eigenartige herb-kühle Note (Pfefferminz? Anis?), die bei Erwärmung noch deutlicher wird. - Nicht so recht mein Fall: zu kandissüß-weizenbierartig und zu kühl im Abgang.

Pours a very dark brown color with a solid, pillowy head that drops to a thin beige film on the surface. Beautifully rich, creamy-smooth aromas of figs, raisins, brown sugar, nuts, spiced apple cider, and yeast. Flavor is sweet brown bread, mellow spices, and apple and banana yeast esters. Raisin and clove phenolics on the back end. Overall refreshing, smooth, medium body, slightly creamy and great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a nice dark brown. Smells of dark fruits and brown sugar. Taste is sweet, bready, raisins, figs, and malty. Quite smooth.
On tap at Biercab. Dark brown colour with beige head. Malt, caramel, roasted aroma. Malt, caramel, dark fruits taste, with some chocolate and roastiness. Medium to full body.
Sour, dark fruits, spices aroma. Dark brown with good head. Plum, fig, dark fruits, spices with good carbonation and mild alcohol flavor. Very good beer!

Brown sugar, dark malts, a dark-fruit ester profile, and some spices in the aroma. The taste is full: bitter, with some sweetness coming through, but the aftertaste is a bit dull for such a rich nose. Solid, medium mouthfeel.

Dark brown pour with decent light brown head. Aroma is big dried fruit, yeasty, caramel. Taste is sweet up front, dried fruit, caramel, yeast. Finishes slightly more bitter, feels a little oily, thick, with a little alcohol. Great.

Bottle 0.33L.
Brown body with reddish nuances, slightly hazy;  large, frothy, tan head, mostly lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (caramel, roasted) and light hoppy (herbal) aroma with notes of spices, raisins and dark fruits.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet flavour well balanced by a moderate bitter character more apparent in the finish. 
Medium body with oily-to-syrupy texture; soft carbonation.

75 cl bottle. Pours a clear red color with a huge off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and spices. Taste of malt, caramel, toffee, spices, bread, yeast and lots of berries and fruits. Sweet and mild with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Alcohol very prominent but doesnt feel out of place. Very good.
Brown with beige head. Light malt caramel and red fruit aroma. At taste is smooth and light sweet with full body.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A clear dark brown beer with a large light beige head not very persistant. Aroma is complex : nose is herbs and smoke ; flavor is fruity (berry) and alcohol. Medium bitter, light sweet, sour note. Full body, medium texture, good carbonation. Dry bitter finish with backfiring. Beware ! Great dubbel. Refreshing. Cheers !

Bottle from Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Reddy amber. Cream coloured, thin, but tight, lasting head. Aroma is spicy, some clove, ginger. Light toffee. Yeasty sourness. Medium sweetness, with a light sourness underlying. Sweet, then lightly sour, dry finish. Very nice.

33cl in a Trappist glass. Pours a nice medium brown clear liquid with a white head. Huge flavours of juicy fruits, malt, and sweetness with the ABV is very well hidden. This is the most flavourful example of a dubbel that I have tried. Very much on a par with the flagship ABT. Very easy drinking - both nourishing and refreshing.

25.4 oz bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown with foamy tan-colored head. Fruity aroma, touch of banana. Slightly sweet flavor with big yeast character. Touch of raisin or maybe fig flavors. Full bodied with creamy mouthfeel. Quite good.
Pours a dark reddish-brown with a tan head. Dark fruity raisin aroma. Sweet fruity taste, dark red fruit, raisins and a little alcohol. A little bit of an alcohol aftertaste. A very nice brown beer.

Perfect example. Pours brown tan head. Some what yeasty but in an enjoyable way. Nice plum fruity nose. Great great great aroma. Malty flavor, raisin somewhat vinous. Slight alcohol heat, again in a most enjoyable way. Fantastic.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 
Plein de gout et le gout "trop alcoolisé" ne se ressent pas...

Trop sucré par contre

Pours a dark brown color with a thick tan head that fades very slowly with ample lacing. Aroma of malt, dark fruit, raisins and licorice. Taste of malt and dark fruit, with raisins. Mild bitterness and a bit of a sweet finish. Fairly full body, smooth and very well balanced. Has a subtle warming effect. Good example of the style.

Pours a clear light brown/hazel beer with a nice foamy beige head.
Smells fruity and spicy.
Tastes bitter with a hint of sweet. Leaves a nice sweet palate, can feel the alcohol.
Great Belgian beer!

Bottle shared by my brother. Cloudy amber to brown pour with a huge tan head. Aroma consisting of malt, citrus, caramel and toffee along with slight herbs and fruit. Malty and caramelly flavor with light citrus before a grassy finish.

Nose is bread, yeast, a little malty sweetness, red berries, a little banana give it a fruity note. Taste is malt and bread leading to a a brown sugar sweet banana, cherry finish with spices, pepper and cloves. Mouthfeel is slick

Dubbel is out of fashion at the moment but I really enjoy a good one, and this is the best.

Nice brown colour, creamy beige head. Medium body with aroma of caramel, yeast and dark fruit. Palate is a bit thin. Almost no aftertaste.
This beer is very overrated!

Aromas of raisins, yeast, a touch of caramel, and some funk. Deep brown color with a thick tan head. Yeasty, green raisin flavor. This is probably great by Belgian standards, but its just not my jam.

Tasting at RW&B. Bottle->stem. Medium brown with small offwhite head. Solid Trappist dubbel with dark fruit, bready malt, Belgian yeast, candied figs. High carbonation. Very good, but I actually prefer the Pater 6 when tasting side by side, due to the latters lite smooth drinkability.

330 ml bottle. Deep red-brown pour with creamy straw foam, slightly hazy. Aroma is quite fruity, typical St. Bernardus strain, light nutty aromas, light metallic notes, candi. Taste is malty, quite bready actually, semi-sweet, fruity, light roasty finish. Palate is med-full bodied, a bit lighter than I expected, good carbonation. Good.

Nice foamy beige head with Cassonade and cinnamon flavor. Brown opaque body with tiny particles and bubbles. Dense taste with sweet mushroom and chocolate malt aromas. Perfect balance for an abbey ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ar: Orange, peach - a little oxydation - hint of mossy hops.
Ap: Reddish-amber, hazy - small off-white head with low retention, leaves a ring of foam.
T: Orange and peach - some toasted malt - low bitterness with a herbal and mossy character - more light stone fruit and citrus on the finish.
P: Medium-light body with high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: A fair Belgian amber ale, though doesnt really have the heft of a dubbel - flavor falls sort of flat.
Unottima birra belga scura che lascia soddisfatti. Corpo importante sorretto da una nota alcolica decisiva. Dolce, con note di frutta rossa e leggero caramello. Viene voglia di farsi monaco!!
Absolutely wonderful! The definition of fine Belgian Ales! Fruity notes. Rosy hue. Lacey head. Clean, crisp washdown. Gentle body. Superior brew. havent been disappointed by a St. Benardus beer yet.

Bière brune avec des reflets rouges, haut col de mousse laissant une dentelle sur le verre. Aromes très agréables : caramel, réglisse, fruits confits. En bouche, grosse carbonation, très sucrée, gouts de pruneaux, malts grillés, épices, fruits confits. Beaucoup de corps. Ya pas à dire, sont balaises les curés !

Pours a BEAUTIFUL rusty brown with a lingering tan head. Smells sweet and fruity and inviting. Very carbonated. Burped a lot. Flavor is of dark fruits with belgian yeast characteristics. This beer is so so so so soooo smooth and creamy, its fantastic.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Big bottle purchased at Surdyks. Pours a mahogany color and maintains an even head throughout. Dark fruit balanced with Belgian yeast. Incredibly smooth and alcohol is nearly completely hidden. Maybe biscuit-like taste. One of the best beers around. A testament to this brewery that this one scores a 4.7 and isnt even the highest rated in their arsenal. I would gladly drink this fine monk concoction again.

Corked bottle. Unfiltred cloudy reddish brown, small head. Maybe a little clove to go with subtle dark fruit aroma. Yeast, some biscuit, dark fruit, . Alcohol is hidden, very smooth and warming. Incredible.
Bottle from a shop in Belgium, bought in 2011. Fruity smell with cherries and similar red berries. Reminds me a bit about their Christmas Ale. Feels aged with round flavours. Very nice!

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a cloudy amberish brown with foamy light beige head. Smells of dark fruit, Belgian yeast, and mild malt. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Nut earth bread yeast aroma. Full bodied Creamy texture. Sweet bread Flavour. Good beer

Amber with bubbly cream head that fades at a moderate rate. Aroma/flavor of light fruit (pear, bit of banana and apple) and some spices with a bit of bread, but not as much as I had recalled from the draught version I had years ago. Light body. Good, but not amazing.

Drunk from 33cl bottle. Spicy brown beer. Very pleasant.
 


 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours light brown with a decent dark fruit aroma. Slightly tart fruit flavor that balances the malt body well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A great example of the style. Definitely an enjoyable beer. A little dark fruit, brown sugar, and yeasty. Was actually looking for their Christmas ale, but had to get this one instead.
This is probably too cold cause I left it outside in December. Brown sugar, dried fruit come through, as does a flavor that seems more like a German beer than a Belgian. Pretty good
Pours a hazy brownish-amber. Has a sweet prune and wheat aroma. Taste is very wheaty and yeasty with some citrus, prune, and light hop and yeast aftertaste.

Somehow I havent rated this. Bottle thanks to Dan! Very appropriate for the season. Pours a cloudy brown color with a large mostly white head. The aroma is big sweet yeasty and nutty notes. Excellent flavor: nutty, berries, toffee, burnt caramel, some dry yeast, a robust lively palate. Very full. Light heat. Excellent.
Ruby red-brown colour, thick creamy foam. Aroma of malt, chocolate, a bit nutty even, ripe fruit. Sweet taste, creamy chocolate, bit sparkling as well, but still not heavy to drink. Beautiful beer.

It is superfluous for me to add anything to the litany of praise for this beer, but superfluous I must be. 750ml cork-finished bottle six months past date (no problem for a beer of this giant caliber, Ive been cellaring it just to see how great these become with times inscrutable passage). As wonderful as all the yuletide beer releases are, theres really no reason to look further than Prior 8, if you want to taste Noel in a bottle. A nose packed with stewed fragrances ranging from fruity through spicy and bready to things like the pleasant body odor one might find on a love interest. The taste reflects, with great balance, depth, and persistence, the nose. What Id most like to convey is the drunk-vs-drinkability factor which is off the charts. Pop a 750ml, drink it in 45 minutes, and crash around your chosen scene in a state of warm jolliness.

Aroma us light alcohol and chestnuts. Head shoots out of the bottle, Brown Colour, lightly hazy. Taste is nutty plums. Medium bodied, Finish Could be a bit longer. I think the aging made This Very Soft and mellow bbe 19.11.2014.
Bottle 75 CL. Pours dark brown copper with nice white medium lacing head. Notes of Belgium yeast, bread, toast, candy, very smooth, hazelnuts. Extremely smooth.
Alkohol i duften. Let perlende skum, meget behagelig carb. Kraftig, krydret smag. Eftersmag af tørret frugt. Rigtig god.

330ml bottle shared with jeevan on a line up with 6, Tripel & Christmas. This is more like it! Pours hazy copper with a thick white head. Aromas of caramelized sugar and dried fruit, prunes mostly. Taste is wel balanced between sweet and bitter. Creamy texture, long finish. Very nice.

Gushed a bit when opened  Light brown/deep copper, clear with a few flakes of sediment floating around, beige head. Aroma of earthy and biscuity malt, some cocoa, ripe fruit, raisins. Flavor: some toffee sweetness with a candy quality, light spice and peppery phenols, bready and nutty notes, prunes and raisins, a fungal note late, slightly hot alcohol.
Dark brown color with a big head. Smells like bread and brown sugar. Taste is fruity, sweet and malty with a very soft bitterness at the end. Not sticky and even a little bit dry. Nice!

Smaak van zoete pruimen, caramel wat langzaam in gebrande noten overgaat met kersenbonbon als nasmaak. Aroma is kruidig zoet, mandarijn en wat chocolade. Goede kraag op donkerbruin. Wat veel koolzuur.

Trying to relive the Westvleteren 8's I had at In De Vrede on two occasions last summer. 

Overflowed out of the bottle a touch. Poured into a Westmalle glass with a tight, white head. Deep cola brown and a gentle lacing too. 

Smells of raisins and yeast. 

The taste starts with the same raisin sweetness, but also adds some sherry and a sour-apple-y Belgian yeast character.

Quite spritzy on the mouth. 

Overall, Brune's have never been my favourite style...more of a poor man's strong dark and Quad, but this does bring a bright, candi sugar quality to the equation which gives it its own quality. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Murky brown pour. Bready flavour with dried fruit and yeast. The use of candi sugar, Im sure, keeps the body light. Very tasty.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2013 Bottle: murky, leather brown in color; fully opaque, filled with tiny bits of sediments, & capped with a dingy, off-white layer of fine foam that lasts for a long time & leaves nice lacing behind. Complex around of grapes, apple skins, pears, plums, earth, dirt, caramel, brown sugar, rotten banana, spice, Belgian yeast... Very sharp & in your face, void of heavy phenols & any unwanted chalkiness. Taste contains notes of sweet grapes, juicy plums, candied dates, sugar-coated raisins, clove, cinnamon, apples, caramel, toffee, cocoa powder, earthy esters, toasted bread-y & spicy Belgian yeast. Phenols eventually show up, but in a mild & controlled manner, balanced well by the sweetness of the brew. Burnt sugar, malty, toffee, & dark-fruity finish. Much better than the Pater 6 in my opinion, fantastic dubbel.
Fles met nagisting: donkere troebele kleur met in het begin een goede schuimkraag die snel wegebt. smaak begin hazelachtig nasmaak waterig/bubbelig.
Donker troeblig biertje met witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie; caramel, toffee, koffie. Lichte nasmaak. Lichte bitterheid.

Aroma is somewhat tart with berries, some toffee typical to aged Belgian ales and caramel. Flavour is slightly tart with woody notes, berries, some toffee and caramel. Alcohol is present but does not disturb. Good

Bottle. Dark red. Starts with a big foamy head. This dies down to form a small white head which endures. Thin, dry lacing on the glass. Smell - typically yeasty, alcohol coming through. Body - medium to light, slightly foamy, a little spritzy carbonation. Taste - liquorice forward, dark fruits and sweet malts. Slightly drying. OK.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Aroma:sweet roasty malt aromaTaste: sweet malty taste balaced well with hops, nice malt/hop mouth tasteAppearance: dark brown body barely transparent with a large volume of fruit thin sediment, thin ring had that lasts

Slightly cloudy brown. Small white head leaves small bubbly islands. Marzipan, dark fruits in alcohol, raisins, touch of milk chocolate, brown sugar. Taste is sweet, but goes to a bitter finish quite fast. Medium mouth, with quite a lot of prickly carbonation. Overall very nice, great taste, but it is also a bit light and undefined.

11.2 oz bottle. Poured a reddish brown with a huge fluffy white head that dissipated quickly and left lots of lace. Aroma was raisins, plums, and spices. Taste was raisins, yeast, spices, and some alcohol. Very good.

FROM NOTES: August 8, 12
Poured on draft at The Trappist into a St. Bernardus tulip. 

A: Slightly sweet with hints of dark fruits that give way to a whisper of apple. Very little, if any, hop presence. 
A: Pours a medium brown with a mild off-white head that quickly dissipates. Some visible sediment observed in the glass.
T: Follows the nose, but a bit more bready in the taste than in the smell. Dark fruit, raisins, plums, yeast, and faint apple notes. 
P: Moderate body with low carbonation. Alcohol warmth towards the finish. Heavenly creamy mouthfeel. 
O: Overall, this is a true world-class beer. Easily considered a definition of the style along with greats like Westmalle, La Trappe, etc.

Dark brown/orange/amber pour with huge fluffy off white head and a pilsner & dark fruit aroma. Sweet dark fruits & candy sugar with a delicate bitterness on the palate finish with a crisp after bite. The alcohol is hidden fairly well in the taste (not the buzz though) and finishes flat & boozy at the bottom of the glass. Very good dubbel.

de couleur brume avec colblanc on sens des note de fruit confit abec des note pruneaux een boucvhe c est un gout de fruit confits melange avecx une gout sur rn fin de bouche c est une trs bonne biere abbey (rate 150)

From tap at kazematten in Ieper. Hazy brown with large tan head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, dried fruit. Very good. Taste is medium sweet, low bitterness, toffee, plum. Very good balance. Alcohol is not present. Really good.

330ml bottle into a Trappist glass. Deep murky brown with ruby hints and a nice one finger head. Carbonation fairly high compared to many dubbels. Sweet toffee & dark fruit aroma with a hint of funkiness. Taste is highly astringent and cardboard-like. Think I definitely got a bad bottle, looking at the other reviews. Such a disappointment, especially after the outstanding Achel 8 Bruin I had the other night. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2013 Pours a hazy golden brown from the bottle with fluffy off-white head that leaves good lace. Aroma is sweety Belgian maltiness and a hint of yeast. Taste follows, almost German bock tasting. Not too shabby.

330ml bottle, pours hazy red waith a large bubbly head that subsides and leavs a lacing, sweet malts in the nose, cherries, dried fruits, belgian yeast esters, banana, palate is slightly oily, the finish is sweet, alcohol well hidden, carbonation lively. Very nice classic belgian brew.

Bottle brewed in Belgium and poured into glass. Head is off white and fast to dissipate. Color is dark reddish brown. Very hazy. Average body and medium carbonation. Aroma is malty. Quite sweet. Very tasty and enjoyable beer.

Beautiful clear dark amber pour with large tan head. Smell of dark malts and fruits. Toffee and caramel somewhere also. Yup! Taste is awesome. Bitter dark chocolate, malts, plums and raisins and such a nice alcohol warming aftertaste. Lot going on here. The lovely thick sugary mouthfeel why I love St Bernardus so much. Will have this again for sure. For me just as nice as bigger brother abt 12.

Poured a dark red amber with large brown head that subsides after a while leaving good lacing.

Obviously many will want to compare this to the Abt 12, but it is quite a different beast. The first thing that strikes me is the sweetness, not in a bad way, this beer is well balanced, but you certainly notice the candy sugar, and what I would assume is a lengthy boil. Chocolatey toffee notes that cling to the back of the palate. No hops noticeable as one would expect.

Overall, this is an exceptional double, that is really quite unique. Certainly worth hunting out, in my opinion, and whilst different from the Abt 12 (surly a good thing), this is none the less exceptional.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Alkuperäinen arvostelu: suutuntuma täydellisyyttä hipova. miedon hapokas ja alkoholinen, kielellä tanssahteleva nektari. lämmittää juuri sopivasti kielentaustoja. raikas, hiukan makea jälkimaku. ei juuri muuta kuin alkoholia mutta hyvähän se näinkin tulee... 3.9

Uudestaan: BBE 08.02.17. 75cl pullo. Ruskean kotikaljamainen olomuoto, ok vaahto. Suutuntuma maanläheinen, dunkelmainen, kuitenkin iso pallomainen alkoholi, hyvää perusdubbelia.

Draft at Clinton hall NYC. Pours a deep brown color. No head. Bready and malty like a bock. Not as flavorful as I'd like but good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - sweet and malty with hints of caramel and toffee. Hints of raisins and dates. Color - dark amber with a thick off white head that is long lasting with decent lacing down the glass. Flavor - very malty and crisp. Chocolate and toffee. Well balanced with a slight metallic finish.....common for the hard water in Belgium. Mouthfeel - full bodied with moderate carbonation Overall Impression - very well balanced. Has great malt flavor with little hop bitterness. A very tasty Belgium Dubbel! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Pours a cloudy brown/dark amber. Aroma of roasted malts, nuts, dark fruit, spices, raisins. One of the better Dubbels Ive had.

330ml bottle. pours a cloudy brown/amber. aroma is of malts, caramel and fermented fruit. a little yeast in there too. taste is very smooth. slightly thin but really malty and again, lots of fermented fruit. finishes with alcohol and heavy yeast. nice.
Aroma is malt and dark fruit. Taste is the same with a tiny hint of alcohol. Typical dubbel in aroma and taste. Great overall.

Great sweet abbey beer, with a strong malt flavour and a good aftertaste.

For cap collectors: red and grey cap, with the imprint of "St.Bernardus.Prior" and an"8" in the centre.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Head: beige, medium. frothy, below avg. retention. Colour: amber-brown, cloudy.

Aroma: dried fruit, slightly spicy, light alcohol/solvent. 

Taste: typical dubbel
Bottle at Porte Noire. Smell of oak and nuts. Cloudy copper colour, beige head. Aroma of nuts, oak, cognac. Sweet. Lively carbon, oily texture.

Dubbel Model for me with everything - taste, aroma, palate and appearance. Absolutely clear aroma - malt, caramel, toffee, prunes, hints of peaches and delicate yeast. Very smooth in taste, well built with soft and smooth carbonation. Aftertaste is not very long but without any side traces.
Another great one from St. Bernardus!
750 ml bottle pours a hazy brown color with an off white head. Aromas of dark fruit, yeast, sweet malt. Full bodied, smooth and well balanced. Great.

330ml bottle. Aroma is walnut, malt. Appearance is very dark brown, light cloudy, a nice brown-ish head. Taste is light sweet, a bit sour, and light bitter in the end. A very nice, malty finish. Overall superb.

Bu dans un verre à St Bernardus. Une jolie couleur marron-bronze, une petite mousse qui part très vite. Elle est assez riche en goût mais bizarrement cest le goût de banane que lon sent le plus. Ce qui apporte à cette bière un côté unique très intéressant !

Cant believe Ive never rated this but to be honest I do usually drink the older cousin. 33cl bottle from CANBIF Fall 2013. Light hazy brown with a dark beige head. Fruity, yeast, brown sugar, some plum. Somewhat sweet with a bitter undertone that balances things, moderate+ carbonation and moderate body, refreshing, dry but a tad biting on the finish. Prefer this with a little bit of age on it as things mellow but still a tasty beer.

33cl bottle into tulip

Lille France

Appearance: Chocolate hazy brown with rich tan head. It didnt stick around very long. 

Aroma: Roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol,

Taste: Average sweetness for the style. Some bitterness in the finish

Palate: Medium to full body. oily texture, longer finish

Overall: Well made, Nice body, decent aroma and appearance. Got better as it warmed. I liked this, but not as much as the Rochefort 8.

330ml bottle. Clear ruby red glowing chestnut colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white to beige head. Malty, autumnal fruity aroma, yeast, hints of fermenting fruit, red apple. raisin. Taste is sweet malty, notes of dried fruit, raisin, tart and dry counterweight; prickling carbonation.

Belle couleur sombre et belle grosse mousse. Arome légerement malté et un peu de cerise noires. Gout ou lon sent lalcool, un peu le malt et une bonne amertume qui accompagne la fin de bouche. Pas mal

330 ml bottle. Pours a sediments-filled orangeish brown with a very thick, very resilient white head. Aroma is caramel, milk chocolate. Flavor is caramel, brown sugar, strawberry and other field berries. Finish is dry, some black licorice. Lingering red fruit flavors. Medium body, slightly sticky and prickly mouthfeel, average to strong carbonation. Good.

Draft @ Amesbury Ale House. Tulip show a murky, dirty brown color with thick foam that lace the entire glass. Nose is malt forward and pleasing. Candy sugar, plenty of dark fruit and yeast. Any brewery that brews this style should try and reproduce this beauty. Flavors of brown sugar, yeast, raisins, plums and caramel malt. Hints of pumpernickel bread. Full in body. Slight alcohol warming after the sip without displaying any alcohol flavors. Nice complex brew that I would never turn away.

Pours an opaque toffee brown. Aroma is sweet, caramel... Alcoholic, with notes of plum and raisins. Flavor is bright and bold and pretty much perfect. Rich, sweet, spicy, fruity, and even better than I expected. Wonderful.

Poured from a 1 pint 9.4 oz bottle. Full bodied, hazy brown color, big tan head, nice lacing, mild carbonation, malty and silky mouthfeel. Very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
brown, hazy, tan foam, roasty, toast, nuts, soy sauce, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

330ml Bottle. This pours a dark reddish brown with a think light tan head that doesnt hang around for long. Its aroma is sweet but with a decent whiff of burnt caramel and dark fruits. It tastes sweet too with hints of cocoa caramel and toffee with a tart bitter then sweet finish. Comes with lots of added burps!! My 1st abt so I cant compare it with others.
Poured reddish brown with a frothy off white head. Aroma of sweet zesty candy. Medium body, flavour of sweet berry fruit, dry, bitter

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2013 St. Bernardus Prior 8
The traditional abbey ale brewed in the classic style Dubiel. Ruby color turns into purple. Smooth, rich, creamy texture, almost oily.
Malty, fruity, complex flavor.
Very dark, and highly carbonated. Thick light brown head. Slightly sweet, tart apple aroma. Very mildly bitter with complex earthy maltiness. Fruity with a hair of spice and alcohol in the finish.
Bernardus prior 8 gedronken van de fles uit bernardus glas. glas schuimt niet mooi vol. Kraag is vrij snel weg. Desalniettemin een lekker smaakvol dubbel bier.
Had this beer some time ago. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.

I dont understand why this beer is so high rated. Oke it did tasted like a double abt / brown beer should taste. But the aftertaste was horrible. A lot of metal taste, I hate this kind of tastes in beer because it vanish all the good if it.

330 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass at home. ABV 8%
Chestnut brown colour on the body, with a tall light beige head. Good retention, thick lacing on the glass.
Aroma of dark fruits, ripe pears, sugars.
Taste of raisins, figs, sweet overripped pears, pleasanlty sweet. Alcohol notes on the aftertaste.
Thick body, good carbonation with a tiny bite on the tongue.
Quite good.

pours hazy dark golden-reddish with a nice creamy off-white head, some retention and lacing. nutty caramel, grass, bit of butter, booze, fruits, bit of dust, soap and bubblegum, light oxidized notes. average to moderate carbonation, light body - oily, grassy-peppery-spicy and earthy-astringent slightly harsh finish. boozy. ok..

Major gusher and then a slower one, a first for a St. Bernardus product here... Pours a dark brown with a nice white head that leaves great lacing and stays for the whole duration. Later pours were murky brown. Aroma of spices, candi sugar and raisins. Taste is sweet of course but all in check with a bitterness that does its balancing job and nothing else. Flavors of brown sugar and plums. Carbonation was higher than usual (might explain the gusher) and body was medium. This always satisfies.
Bottle pours muddy brown, high carb. Aroma is dark sweet fruit, taste is same with light bitterness

had this one a couple of times. pours a medium dark brown colour with a big lasting head. good amount of sweetness, with caramel, coffee, dark fruits, and a small bitterness. overall its a solid beer
UPDATED: NOV 5, 2013 Nice one! Ths beer has quiet a "kick" to it. Not as good as the Bernardus Abt, but a good beer for a rainy fall day.

Pours very nicely with dark red colour, carpet lacing and decent head. Floral aroma and some sweet malt. Also raisins and a subtle more of booze. Nice clove in finish. Comes together very well. Tap at Farmhouse in Burlington.

Un excellent produit, une très belle Double. La couleur est profonde, le nez le palais sont ronds. 
Larrière bouche est longue et douce.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Tulipa. Color marrón y apariencia velada. Espuma bronceada con bastante buena retención. Aromas de malta caramelo, toffees y matices de melazas y frutos oscuros. Los sabores son los esperados según el perfil aromático.Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación moderada. Notas de levadura Belga y sutil calidez alcohólica. Fruta oscura en el retrogusto. Agradable asimilación.
330ml bottle. Tulip glass. Brown color, hazzy appearance. Tan head, fairly good retention. Caramel malt, toffee aromas, hints of molasses & dark fruit. Flavors as expected from the aroma profile. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. Belgian yeast notes & subtle warming alcohol. Dark fruit on the aftertaste. Nice drinkability.

33cl bottle.
Aroma had a lot of herbs, bread, spicy, pepper, candy sugar.
Copperbrown, beige head, fading. A small constant sparkling.
Taste is prune, burned malts, light sweet.
Full warm mouthfeel.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown-ruby amber colour, frothy white head and aroma of earthy caramel, dark fruits, yeast. Taste is sweetish caramel, spice and light bitterness, with bread, dark fruit, alcohol and yeasty notes. Foamy mouth feel, medium bodied, well carbonated, warming dry finish. Very drinkable.
Kado gekregen, thuis gedronken, koperbruin kleurig met een beige schuimkraag, ruikt naar alcohol, caramel en een beetje fruitig, smaakt wel lekker

11.2 oz bottle- Pours hazy ruby red with a light tan two finger head. Aroma is dark fruits, spicy, caramel. The taste is caramel candy, malty, fruity, Belgian yeast. The body is medium and carbonation is champagne like. Good beer, most of what this brewery does is good, well excellent!

Nice beer on a style where there doesnt seem to be much variance. This bottle had some age on it so the color was a chocolate brown with small particles in it. Low head that dissipated. The aroma was of sweet bready malts with toffee. The palate was heavy and creamy. Much more full than I expected and pleasant. The Belgian yeast was there but did not overpower. The malts were thick but grainy with nice touches of caramel and toffee. Nice finish and obviously done with experience.

(Bottle). Fruity nose with aromas of yeast, apples, pears, tart citrus, sweet malt and alcohol. The taste is fruity with hints of citrus, yeast, spices and warming alcohol. In the aftertaste there is a slight bitterness, and strangely enough is the body perceived as a bit thin, as if it can not quite keep up with all the flavors.

@ bierhuyske 
pours brown, smaller than usual white head. smell is caramel malts, sugary . 
taste has some metallicness, and remembering of the 12 . but less intence, and less alcohol, obviously . earthy, sweet ( sugar) and yeasty . ok ..
hazy brown with a thick white and persistent head. Some notes of alcohol, yeast and fruit in the aroma. Medium carbonation. Light sweet flavour that ends dry, asking for another sip. A good beer.
Saddle brown color. Nice head. Aroma is milder with some brown sugar, dark fruit notes, and bread. Creamy texture. Average carbonation
From bottle in Rochefort glass. Pours very dark with a medium persisting head. Smells sweet sour and tastes full and sweet, aromas of dark bread, alcohol and dark caramel with al long finish.
Dark, sweet, dark fruits, alcohol, nuts. Very nice winter beer. Still not as good as the 12 one.

Erwartet hatte ich eine Bombe, am Ende war es eher ein Knallfrosch, aber ein durchaus leckerer mit einem schön pflaumigen Aroma zu Beginn, was sich auf dem Gaumen fruchtig und schwer forsetzt. Ansonsten etwas Röstmalze, Karamell und dunkle Schokolade. Für diesen hohen Score also nur ein Knallfrosch ;o)

Bottle brought home from Belgium. Pours out in a unclear and cloudy dark brown colour with creamy steady head and smooth body. Nose of Belgian yeast and hops. Taste of mild hazelnuts, light malt, honey, barley, Belgian yeast, chocolate and hops. Nice and easy to drink, enjoy- and quaffable.

Dark, almost opaque brown with thick lacing and a fuzzy head. Smells properly belgian and also very fruity. For me, the nose of this beer was better than the taste. Pretty weak finish, but the fruitiness is very strong in the beginning.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown beer with small head. Aroma of fruity malts and marzipan. The taste follows with some full fruity malts, marzipan, dark molasses, toffee, yeast and spices. Medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation. A very good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle 0.33l at home. BBE 15 01 18. Colour is dark brown with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Belgian yeast, dark fruits, hops, sweetness and malts.

Pleasant aroma. The appearance is very dark with a fine frothy head. Very Belgian flavor. Seems a little thin on the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas de caramelo y frutos rojos. En boca tenemos tb el caramelo tostado, sabores afrutados y una ligera acidez. De lo mejor del género.
Very accessible beer, complex in taste, but not in aroma. Palate is smooth and warming, a nice alternative for his bigger brother Abt 12.

330ml bottle at Brabant. Pours rather murky cola brown with a thin tan head. Aromas of sour dark fruits, caramel malts, some bright citrus and yeast, Taste is plums, prunes, raisins, cherries, caramel malt, earth, vanilla and bananas with a mild, slightly bitter finish. Prickly mouthfeel at first, lots of carbonation, but is rather soft on the palate in the finish. Good, but was expecting a bit more from this beer.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Caramel, fruit, alcohol aroma. Flavour is caramel, dark fruit, some hints of alcohol. Slightly bitter finish.
Typical example of a fine belgian dubbel. Sweet, caramely and roasted. Excellent.

Slightly dark, but clear beer with a firm foamy head. It has a lot of hop in the aroma, which reduces the rest of the sentences. It has a lot of carbon hydroxide which "bites" on the tongue, and i can not find a lot of taste. The aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Een licht donker, maar helder bier met een stevige bruine kraag. In het aroma veel aspecten van hop, maar dit "verdoezelt" de rest. Een overvloed van koolzuur "bijt" op de tong, en van smaak is niet veel meer terug te vinden. De nasmaak is licht bitter.

Bottle from the beer palais at Watou, Belgium. Nose is liquorice, dark caramel, leather. Earthy texture with a complex vibrant flavour rich in spices, stewed fruits, dark malts.. just sweet enough. A great beer but Karmeliet & Westmalle still have the edge over this.

Doskonaly podwojny dubbel. St Bernardus bardzo tresciwy aromatyczny i troche nawet chmielny. Osad wedruje po calej butelce i jest od razu zmieszany i natychmiast metny, przybrudzony kolor ciemnego brazu. Wysycenie spore i dymek jak z ogniska. Wspaniala uczta zwlaszcza do sera podpuszkowego.

Brown color with 1 finger off white head. Aroma of plums, molasses, liquorice, brown sugar, raisins. Taste is light to medium sweet, fruity and sugary flavor, citrus tang. Medium body, creamy to thick texture, average carbonation. Tasty
sweet caramel aroma with some cherries, taste pleasant sweet also caramel en malt. creamy sensation in mouth. Overall a very nice beer.

Pours muddy brown with low off white head
Aromas of trappist yeast, earth, mud, cherries, molasses
Nice abbey with sweet liqourize, syrup, caramel, trappist yeast, cherries

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma: Bit, fruity, red fruit, sweet, bit of yeast Appearance: Amber, red, off white head, staying head, medium lace Taste: Red fruit, caramel, malt, yeast
Amber/brown color, hazy, with lots of carbonation. Huge beige head (lasting). Fruity, zesty aroma. Wonderful taste, full body, a bit sweet. Reminds me of Rochefort 8. Great beer.
mmm aromas are boozy, stewed fruits etc... pours pretty standard. taste is i guess perfect abbey dubbel with great length. superb example of the style, but not what im into right now

Sweet grainy malt kinda liquorice and bready notes. Off white foamy head and a dark brown almost rust body. Sweet tart berry with a smokey maltness with a slight grassyness. crisp and carbonated on the palate

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a dark mahogany with a frothy off-white head and loads of lace. The aroma is dry malt and liqourice. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with bags of alcohol inspired liqourice, yeast and malt on the surprisingly smooth palate. A gift indeed from Belgium!

Poured from 12oz glass into a St Bernardus chalice.
Rich brown with small amber head and lace.
Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, toffee, coconut and prunes.
Moderate carbonation and mouthfeel.
Flavors of sweet malts, caramel, brown sugar, milk chocolate. Ive had this beer many times over the years, fresh and aged, big and small bottles and on tap. Always lovely in large part from the delicious yeast that helps all their beers. Overall very rich and flavorful, a bit more sweet and less roasty than many dubbels. Always a pleasure.

Bottle. Hazy brown liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of dried fruit, bread, caramel, toffee, light banana, dried fruit and light bubblegum. Taste is light to medium sweet and low bitter with notes of bread, dried fruit and toffee. Light to medium bodied with medium to high carbonaiton.

Bottle 33 cl from Boissons Center - Montagny (CH). Reddish brown beer with a nice and huge foam, very cracklid. Sweet aromas, fruity with dainty and licorice. The taste is powerful, bitter and soft, roasted, fruity, licorice, coffee, banana and very spiced. Fat texture, a litthe prickly. Aromatic beer, very long in mouth with a bitterness of almond.

I really love the balance of this beer. There is no cloying sweetness to be found here, it does not taste boozy, but it still has plenty of flavor and is a great example of the style. Time and time again this brewery lives up to its reputation. I prefer drinking this when the weather is cold outside but it is still light enough for a summer evening when you are all hopped out and ready for an adult beer.

Un ton en dessous de sa grande soeur Abt12, cette Prior 8 est tout de meme un esuperbe biere de degustation. Robe ruby, tres belle carbo donnant un collet genereux. Des aromes legers de fruits rouges et caramel. Tres bien equilibre en bouche.
Pours a nice brown beer with a good white head. Dont smell much.tastes a bit licorice. Nuts.

P:  A murky dirty dark pond water body with a creamy froth of khaki head with excellent retention. 

S:  Salty caramel apples, roasted cinnamon and sugar coated pecans, sweet molasses, dark candy sugar, prunes, subtle herbal gum and a syrupy sweetness. 

T/M:  Roasted caramel and dark sugar malt with a spicy phenolic fruit profile. Smoldered grain, boozy prunes, old school gum, sugary pecan pound cake, green and red apples and roasted ground spices.  Prickly carbonation in a medium body. Finish has a burnt barley flavor and lightly smoked wood. 

O:  Good stuff but I think I like Pator 6 better. Good balance of flavors and a huge dose of spice.

33cl from Auchan (Luxembourg). It pours a hazy brown with a thick white and persistent head. Some notes of alcohol, yeast and fruit in the aroma. Medium carbonation. Light sweet flavour that ends dry, asking for another sip. A good beer.
Brune foncée, pétillance moyenne, mousse qui tombe rapidement. Moyennement fruitée (raisins, cerises du nord, prunes), un rien surette, présence de caramel. Une réussite de plus pour St Bernardus!

Ar: sugar, dried fruits, yeast, light roastiness, alcohol, big maltiness. 
Ap: Hazy Brown/reddish colour, big beige head. 
F: big sweetness, lots of yeastiness, dried fruits, alcohol, sugar, some breadiness in the maltbase, enjoyable.
P: big mouthfeel, Lively carbonation.
T: impressing without being exceptional.

Pours a dark brown, with a interesting purple hue, when in the light. Finger of off-white head that leaves moderate lacing. Nose is very sweet with a lot of malt character. strong presence of dark fruits, mainly raisin and plum. Spice, yeast and hints of alcohol. Mouth is also very sweet with yeast, plum, raisin, spices (a lot of nutmeg) caramel and malt. Creamy feel with a very dry finish and a mix of carbonation.

Light pour in the St Bernardus glass.  Full bottle pour with yeast.  Very dark red in color.  Buttercream colored head about 1.5 fingers of head with tight bubbles.  Aroma is very pleasant with sour cherry tones (almost a kriek) and sweet malts.  Very creamy and enjoyable on the palate.  Initial sweetness on the palate followed by classic dubbel notes of malt, dark cherry and very light yeast.  Zero hop bitterness.  Finish leaves a slight warming sensation which prepares you for the next sip.  This is a great beer.  Wouldja - Yes

11.2oz served into a Chimay chalice. Best by: 20/07/16

A - Garnet brown with an active cream colored head that never breaks.

S - Spice bread, earthy yeast, dates, raisin, toasted banana, cinnamon, nutmeg, alcohol vapors.

T - Figs, nutmeg, spice bread, dark Belgian candy, green banana, dark cherries, plums, herbal spice bitterness. Really dries off on the finish.

M - Moderate airy carbonation, heavy side of medium.

This hits all the marks of an incredible Abbey ale. A well constructed beer with great flowy carbonation, dark fruits, rich bready malts, interesting spice profile, and a snappy dry finish.
I only wish I had a 750ml instead of on 11.2oz bottle.

Serving type: bottle

05-18-2012

Would I drink this if handed to me?  Yes.
Would I buy this beer?  No.
Very strong taste.

3ccl bottle. pours rak brown with a small fast diminishing head.  Aroma is malty, fruity, plumy with some hints of alchool. Flavour is sweet, fruity, again you can slighty feel the alchool but in a great way. More dry finish but great

Bought a bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Aroma of cloves and cinnamon, and a nice sweetness of raisins and caramel. Has a dark brown color and a nice light brown head, is well carbonated. Taste is semi-sweet and has a slightly bitter taste. The beer is well balanced and has a full finish. Afterall, this one is better than Bernardus Pater.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 Bottle. Cloudy deep brown color, with a large dark head, a bit lacing.
Aroma is a sweet mixture of caramel, chocolate, vanilla and raisin. Taste is dominated by dried fruits, chocolate and malted flavors, very balanced, alcohol is pretty hidden.  Creamy, medium bodied. Nice Dubbel.

Spreads and feels up with a small after taste. Perfect balance with lots of flavor with minimal dryness
, coffee
Nice dubbel. Funky monks. Flea giving Clara a bath is a sweet scene. John falling apart on film is sad.
Cerveja com corpo e malte como destaques, muito saborosa, intenso teor alcoólico bem inserido e agradavelmente percebido no palato, cerveja com a cara da escola belga.

From a 33 cl bottle at home.  Pours a cloudy brown with a massive beige head.  Sweet malty aroma.  Flavors of caramel, toffee and a hint of banana.  Huge carbonation provides a lively but smooth mouthfeel.  Slightly bitter finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, clear chestnut brown pour with foam off white head, quite sweet nutty aroma, taste is firstly sweet brown sugar with bready malts a lot of dried fruit action, I detect some clove and spice the mouthfeel is quite viscous and luxurious.

Drinking with boozedude:
Bottle into glass..brown pour..brown head...grape raisen ..taste is maltd faint hints of coffe..grape... awesome
Despite the grammar errors, I agree. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle into glass..brown pour..brown head...grape raisen ..taste is maltd faint hints of coffe..grape...  awesome

Bottle. Poured muddy brown, thin head, delicate lacing. Awesomely sour nose with caramel, malt, some cherry. Medium carbonation, smooth and creamy mouthfeel. 8 percent alcohol present but not over the top. Warming, balanced and satisfying.
deep brown color.  Strong malt nose, similar to brewing smell.  Complex flavor, but short in the finish.  Cleans up quickly.

Bottle. Pours a very heady deep copper color. Fluffy, thick light tan head. Caramel, molasses, and brown sugar notes. Some dark fruit as well. Medium mouthfeel. Caramel, dried fruit, some banana, and a little biscuit. For 8% the alcohol hides well behind the sweetness. Tasty.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 From BandC. Richly spiced and warming. Somewhat wine like in after taste and palate. Serving: bottle

Renk siyaha yakın kahve. Köpük dolgun ve açık-kahve beyaz arası. Koku rochefort 6ya benziyor içim biraz daha kompleks. Önce gaz, sonra topraksı meyveler ardından kalıcı bir acılık. İlk içim çok vurucu,rochefort 6 ya göre daha gövdeli bir bira. Şişede fermante oluyormuş. damakta meyve tatları, dilde gaz ve acılık. hafifi  de olsa alkol tadı da var ama %8 için normal, bardağaı salladıkça çıkan kokular beni benden alıyor.
Caramel and spices. Sweet and smooth, yet robust and complex. Alcohol comes through but not overtly so.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées aux notes terreuses (raisins, prunes, notes dagrumes et de cerises noires), de caramel toffee, léger de sucre brun aux notes rôties avec des notes de réglisse noire, de chocolat noir, dalcool et dépices (clou de girofle, poivre léger). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quavec une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (prunes, raisins, léger de cerises, traces de pomme) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût de caramel toffee et léger-moyen rôti avec des notes de chocolat noir et de pain ainsi que quelques traces de mélasse. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool avec une très légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen-long, légèrement amer dalcool, léger de rôti et de houblon herbeux avec un goût de levures fruitées (pelures de raisins et de prunes). (2006)

Nose is raw sugar, caramel/fudge, honey and raisins -- intense! Was expecting something less stellar than Abt 12 but this one is absolutely full of taste and thick-bodied enough! Long-lived aftertaste
Dark brown, hazy. Brown sugar and dark forest fruits. Some roastedness. Sweet.

Dark ruby/amber tinged brown, long lasting head in Trappist glass. Smells..plums,dark fruit, some banana, caramel and sweet malts. Tastes..dark fruits and roasted flavours, malt, caramels and toffee. Really a sensational drop.

Pours a dark Brown brew with a big beige head with good rention, aroma is modertae to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with plums, prunes and bananam, médium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, moderte bitter and low acidic with prunes, plums, banana, caramel and spices, bittersweet and vinous finish, good balance.

Aroma: dough, caramel, alcohol, cooked vegetables, 
Appearance: amber, cloudy, frothy, white foam, 
Taste: medium bitterness, light sweetness, 
Palate: full body, slick feel, lively, bitter, long finish, 
Overall: harsh, feels like it has more abv, not as good as the 12
August 2010. Pours redbrown with a while head. A solid dubbel all the way. Good stuff!

Bottle from Julios. Rated from bottom of the bottle. Poured into a stem glass. A hazy russet brown with a frothy tan head. Spicy-sweet-yeasty aromas. Flavor is smooth and complex. Some brown sugar notes. Some plum-raisin notes. Some yeast. Lingering dry sweet finish.
Jäst och sedvanlig belgoshit. Lite syrlig därtill. Äh fan det här är inget att hurra för. Typisk belgo

Bottle. Opaque brown pour. Very large off-white head. Dark chocolate caramel. Aged red fruits. Prunes. Dates. Raisins. Good flavors though a bit muted. Almost creamy body. Hard to rate something so classic, but compared to other proper Trappist Dubbels the flavors feel blunted. Still wonderful and classic.

Bottle @ il Campiglio. la migliore Dubbel secondo me. profuma di frutti rossi e di caramello.  h auna bella schiuma color nocciola discretamente cremosa dal perlage fine. un color mogano, tra il marrone ed il rosso, una discreta carbonatazione visibiel già nel bicchiere. Il corpo è pieno. Il gusto è di zucchero caramellato, di frutta candita e di banana. Lacool si sente molto, avrei giurato avesse 10 gradi in una degustazione alla cieca. il luppolo scompare sotto questa miriade di sapori, lo si avvete appena. ottima.

Nice looking pour, Deep amber brown color, huge head, actually took me a few tries to fill my glass!! A little disappointed with the flavor, malty, sweet with just a touch of bitter, but with a sort of "artificial" flavor more expectant of a lesser beer. Overall a good beer, but didnt live up to its scores.
Dark brown chestnut colour, medium mokka coloured head, fruity sweet caramel, yeasty smell, dark fruit, medium carbonation, medium bitter wine like taste

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08.04.2015
Aroma is somewhat tart with berries, some toffee typical to aged Belgian ales and  caramel. Flavour is slightly tart with woody notes, berries, some toffee and caramel. Alcohol is present but does not disturb. Good.
Dark beer, lots and lots of top. Tastes and smells a bit vanilla and is very drinkable, not so bitter taste.  Very good beer but not very distinguishable.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours cloudy brown with a thick beige head with great retention. Aroma is toasty, dark fruits, caramel. Smells like most Belgian dubbels, but this is a style that I dont care for too much anymore. Too malty, too estery. Taste is much better than the aroma let on. Its sweet and estery but not cloying like I was fearing; it is a bit boozy. Mouthfeel is foamy, body is full. So far, my least favorite St. Bernardus. Its obviously a really well-made beer, just not really up my alley at this moment in time.

0.33l bottle @ Braai Tapperij de Mug, Middelburg. My first ever from the Bernandus! In its proper glass, this is a deep dark amber-brown one with a big and near everlasting almost creamy beige head and some big dark floaters. It has a really lovely perfumy-aroma. I get lots of candy, some alcohol, fruity dry dishwasher powder and some sweet caramelly thing. Quite lovely. Its average big-bubbly carbonated and it has a nice light oily texture. Flavors are also quite elegant and a bit stingy. Booze up first melting in to a light bitter malty Belgian thing. Warming sweet finish with a hint of wood, chocolate and dry yeast. Yeah, this is damn tasty! 30.05.2012

Bottle at home from drinkstore pours dark ruby brown with fluffy cream head. Dried fruit malt flavours and aromas, very easy drinking for 8%, none of the unpleasant related flavours, a nice dubbel! Well deserves the top spot.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Erg lekker biertje. Niet te zoet, en voeld ligt voor een 8 procent bier. Lekkere volle smaak
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013 Brown creamy head. Hoppy floral fragrance. Malty sweet taste with spicy undertones. Nice drink.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours amber in color with a creamy tan head. Brown sugar, some dark fruits, hints of dough  in aroma. A bit of some nuttyness as well. Bready malty, some fruity elements in taste. Creamy mouthfeel. Smooth and tasty. Nice combination between the bready malts and dark fruits in this one, they work very well together making this a really delicious brew. Dried dark fruits and dark but not that overwhelmingly sweet bread in aftertaste.

Pours a large frothy light brown head that mostly lasts. Body is murky red brown, sparkles are visible. Aroma contains light bread, straw, molasses, herbs, citrus fruits, dough, leather, banana, grape, raisin, plum, cherry, cassis, cola, forest fruits and spices. Fkavor starts off light acidic, then goes to sweet and bitter. Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Great beer! Subtle in it's flavors, lots of aroma's. Mjammie!

Funny, Ive drank ABT 12 for years but have very rarely sampled to Prior 8, when I fancy a Dubbel I turn every time to Westmalle so have had little exposure to others. 33cl bottle poured in a Westvleteren chalice, no head to speak of, though the cellar is colder than normal due to Belgian winter stretching to 6 months this year. Light brownish reddish colour lightening to the edge of the glass. Aroma is significantly lighter than its big brother beer.  its a pleasant, tasty beer but without the wow factor of the ABT 12.
Aroma hint of plum???  Big head :) tasty but not spectacular...good fairly smooth fruity taste...but not amazing  by any means...good though

Bottle.  Dark brown pour, a decent amount of carbonation which seemed to last forever and an aroma of candi sugar and a bready malt.  Flavor is nice malty figs, brown sugar and just enough sweetness to mellow the alcohol.  Solid all around.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Very malty and nutty with just enough sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

13/III/13 - 33cl bottle @ Trollenkelder (Gent) - BB: n/a (2013-240) 
Clear brown beer, creamy light beige head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: bit fruity, apple skin, dried fruits, floral, cloves, aniseed. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit yeasty, caramel, bitter hops, bit grassy, spices. Aftertaste: spicy, some aniseed, chocolate, yeast, apples, bit bready, caramel, bitter hops.

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours a nearly clear dark brown with a rock solid one finger light tan head that refuses to go away. Tons of carbonation maintains the head nearly throughout with huge globs of lacing clinging to the sides of the glass.

There is a huge clove and banana Belgian aroma along with some light hints of dark fruits and coriander. Really pleasant and inviting.

The flavor is a wonderful marriage of dark caramel, figs, raisins, and dried cranberries. More coriander, clove, and banana that becomes especially prominent towards the finish. Mouthfeel is pretty dry with just a slight stickyness that is on par for the style.

Overall, a wonderful Dubbel with perfectly melded but very in your face flavors. Every St. Bernardus beer I have had has blown me away and this ones proves no different.
Which Belgian powerhouse. Very taste and aroma. Strange Belgian taste. Is not fond of this beer at all.

Bottle. Pours cloudy brown with somewhat lasting light brown head. Aroma is raisins, sundried fruits, yeasty and floral. Flavor is malt, yeast, raisins, spices, fruits. High carbonation. Mildly dry aftertaste.

Head: thick beige foam. Colour: ruby red. Aroma: candy, fruit. Taste: roasted malt. Palate: dry, medium CO2, light bitter finish. Overall: nice.

A really nice dubbel.  This one pours a hazy brown with a moderately sized tan head.  Flavors tend toward malt and spice, and the beer isnt as sweet or yeasty as many dubbels, which is a nice change from the usual.  Good!
On tap at OL Beer Cafe. Pours a malty brown color. Strong malt taste and well balanced taste.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2014 dark brown colour, minimal off-white head; aroma of caramel, some apple, hints of marzipan(?), plum, and quite intensive alcohol; taste of dried fruits, brown bread, roasted sugar, and well hidden, though present alcohol. really good dubbel

Very good.  Id almost expected it to just be a slightly milder version of Abt 12, but it isnt.  It has a similar warm, brown color and splotchy head.  The aroma is similar; there are dates and rasins and allspice, nutmeg, etc.  All of that is there in the flavor, too.  But there is a bigger tingle and burn from hops than Id expected, and some nice caramel in the finish.  I enjoyed this very much for its own sake and Ill buy it again.

330ml bottle - Pours deep amber with a thinnish tan head. Nose is stewed apple, fresh dates, sweet and malty. Flavour trends toward dark fruit (plums), malt, with a rather tasty bitter lasting finish. Bit of a boozy warmth at the end, and nice and slick on the way down. Good job this one.

Pours hazy brown with a long lasting, tall, light tan head.
Aroma of caramel, dark fruit.
Taste is tingly caramel malt, slightly bready, yeast, fruity.
Very nice....smooth.
33 cl bottle from colruyt dark brown with beige head. Aroma of strong alcohol and port. Tastes very sweet caramel.

Ugly label. The pope stopped for a reason ;-)
Decent taste, well ballanced, but lacking after taste.

Not sure why me but unlike the other reviews I had a good size head on this one. Off white in color. Dark brown beer , definitely aroma of caramel. Maybe a little hint of pepper on the backside. St Bernardus is on a roll with me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled, 0.33l. Pours hazy dark brown with small creamy tan-like head, not much lacing and with tiny, but lively bubbles. Aroma of spicy hops, mild caramel, mosty wine marc and dry fruits (raisins, plums, apricots). Taste starts with sweet and rich malt, mildly toasted, then followed by fresh fruity and winey sourness. Alcohol is quite hidden, but it hits you from the back shortly after first sips. Mouthfeel is sweet & sticky, while finish is moderately bitter with long aftertaste. Full body, thick texture and fizzy natural carbonation in palate. Very good, however still too sour for my taste...

Estoy es un cervezón. Color rojizo, caoba, con una espuma cremosa que va dejando una marca pegada a la copa. Sabor complejo, malteado, especiado, a pimienta, castañas, acaramelada y un fondo entre amargo y picante. Alto cuerpo, graso y con bastante gas en el paladar. Si está muy fría pierde sabor y aroma.
Lots of sweet malt, dark fruit, a little caramel. Need to update this review, this is from several days old memory.

appearance: Chestnut brown, hazy. Huge creme foam top that fades quickly. Lovely lacing.

smell: Has a medicinal smell to it combined with caramel, dark fruits and licorice.

taste: A little odd. It has some contradicting flavors somehow. I get caramel, brown sugar with a spicy smokey licorice finish. Its interesting but it doesnt really seem to click somehow. After some lingering i get fig as an after taste. I get a lot of medicinal phenol flavors together with alcohol in the nose, which adds to the slightly weird flavor combo. 

mouthfeel: Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Quite creamy with a nice carbonation kick breaking through. 

overall: Its an interesting beer. Im not sure if i like it or not. Its not bad and i do enjoy it, but its just not a "Wow!" moment i had with their Triple. So its def. not their best.

Bottle shared by yrcrz - thanks!  Pours cloudy and brown with a thin head.  Aroma is sweet and malty with some cheese and spice.  Taste has delicate malt and spices.  Plenty of sweetness, and some vanilla too.  Clean finish.  A fine Dubbel.
Aroma is malty with hints of old cheese. Taste is sweet and complex. Pours beautifully dark. Really good beer and wouldt expect anything less from St. Bernardus.

Very nice aroma, but hard to characterize. Smells malty with a hint of cheese, candy in the background. Brown and hazy with light but creamy head. Definitely not clear. Very tasty! Like a slightly watery version of Kuhnhenns 4th Dementia. Malty with a hint of cheese, some caramel and butterscotch. Quite likable. Thanks to my cousin who has not yet come up with his Ratebeer ID.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2013 Brownish with offwhite head.
Aroma is apricot, bit caramel.
Bittersweet, taste is caramel, fruity (apple, apricot) and yeasty, a bit spicy.
Very nice beer, though not as (dark/) good as the 12.
330 ml. bottle.  Pours a cloudy brown with a nice biege head.  Aroma of malt, yeast, and fruit.  Taste is malt, fruits, berries, yeast, caramel, and spice.  Very enjoyable!
Pours a dark colour, well balanced, slightly sweet/candy like and has a slight yeast flavour

Appearance: Cloudy amber color with a thick tan head. Nice lacing.Aroma: Lovely balanced sweet fruity and malty.Palate: Medium to full body. A bit sweet and some bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Plum fruity, light acidic, some spices and a fine mild malty background.Overall impression: What can you say that is not said before about this outstanding classy and complex beer? I am going to buy a lot more. Amazed!.Personal stats: Bottle  from Slijterij t Fust in Hoorn, Netherlands.

From the corked, caged 750 ml. bottle.  It pours a deep amber-brown with a silky beige head that lingers.  The aroma is wonderfully vast with yeast, dark malts, grape, raisins, yeast, and molasses.  The body is bold with good stability in the texture.  The taste is beautifully complex and defines the style with dark sweetness up front and a peppery but mildly bitter finale.  I think this is one of the finest beers I have ever had.
Brown colour with light brown head, disappearing. Smells candit sugar, roasted malts. Taste bitter, some hops, some liquorice and also caramel. Well bodied. Another great one.

Prominent fruity aromas of raisins, cherries, and apples, with some subtle chocolatey and nutty scents.  The appearance of liquid ebony, with dark ruby highlights, and a decently retaining, khaki head foam.  Sweet with some savory elements, caramel and molasses flavors, and some tartness as well.  Full bodied with spicy, lively carbonation, and finishes with refreshing fruity and malty tones, and some presence of alcohol strength.  Rich, smooth, spicy, and complex.

Dark and only slightly coloured look, but with a luxurieus white head. Rich taste with lots of fruity accents. I found some red apple in it. Marvellous

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The prior has everything that its weaker brother in cowl has - Im talking about the pater. This has the lovely brownish turbidity with a sloppy head, the wonderful, yeasty aroma of sileage and old fruits, with plums, apples and berries. It has the sourness in the flavour, the sweet mellow taste to bend our knees in prayers,...BUT...it carries a bit of a priorish arrogance. Too bad. The elevated alcohol just spoils it. It is perfection with a higher alcoholic content, over the top. Sorry, but Im not even interested to know how the abbot fares. This arrogant prior has left a sour note and I will keep confessing my sins to the pater.

Very prickly carbonation, exactly what I was craving at the moment -- a solid dubbel, none of the aversion to phenols that were part of my initial reaction to my first dubbel (from New Belgium). Complex, sharp, deep, dark, spicy, toeing the line of too hot, but ended up being perfect.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Classic look of a belgian dark ale. Aroma is yeast, candy sugar and apricot to begin with. Then the caramel and toffee smells come along as it warms. Taste is full bodied malty fruits. So drinkable and delicious. It finishes even better - sweet but not sickly or cloying. Slight bitterness at end of palate. Overall, not freakishly complex, but one of my favourite Belgian beers. Exciting. Love the caramel toffee gear. Definitely one to buy again and again.

330ml bottle at home. clear ruby red brown. Beige moon cratered persistent head  and good lacing. Sharp yeast driven aroma with a hint of cranberry. Flavour is driven by complex bready nutty malts with bas of raisin and a acidic sharpness. High carbonation that tickles the tongue and is a little numbing. Really nice dry finish with a slightly biting bitterness. Great example of the style.

11.2oz bottle. Clear dark red color. Good big kinda of beige head. Good lace. Nice dark fruity nose. Medium / bigger body. Soft carbonation, dry texture. Nice complex malt flavor. Dark fruit, some pepper and spices, nice robust maltiness. Moderate bitter taste, kind of a sweet dark fruity finish. Plum, raisin, red grapes, cinnamon, light ginger, some ripe banana evident. Great Abbey Dubbel. I probably could have handled a full-size bottle.
Hints of apple, and peach on the tongue. Slight honey citrus bouquet. Amber fog in color.

Corked & Caged 750 ml Bottle. Appearance is a cloudy dark ruby and copper color with lots of tan foam and thick lacing. Aroma has notes of Belgian yeast, plums, raisins, toffee and toasted malts. The taste starts with a significant amount of caramel malt, figs and brown sugar followed by a blend of yeast, currants, vanilla and holiday spices. The body is silky smooth and creamy with medium-level carbonation and a dry, alcohol warming finish. As with all their offerings, its a rich, lively and festive brew.

Hazy chestnut with orange highlights.  Good head and lacing.  Light fruit aroma of apples and pears.  Belgian yeast flavor dominates with funk and alcohol apparent.  Moderate mouthfeel with high carbonation.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a caramel color with medium off white head. Fruity smell with citrus amd some yeast.  Taste is more yeasty than the 6 and mot as spicy as the 12.  Don't like as much as the 6 or 12.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu tulppaanilasiin hyvin tummana ja melko runsasvaahtoisena, vaahdon ollessa valkeaa ja nopeasti katoavaa. Haju on hyvin mausteinen, jonka alla on yrttisyyttä, kuivattua hedelmää ja hitusen anista. Maku on mausteiden ja kuivatun hedelmän yhdistelmän valtaama, marjaa, maata ja ruohoa on taustalla. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen, pistelevä ja melko täyteläinen. Kaiken kaikkiaan mukava tumma belgi, hedelmä ja mausteet pelaavat hyvin yhteen.
Bottle 75cl BBE 27.4.15 @ home Pours clear brown with a medium head. Ripe fruits, caramel, malts in the aroma. Smooth, round mouthfeel. Toffee, fruits in the taste. Nice

Pours a murky brown, slightly purpleish color, with a huge 4 finger head.  Aroma is as someone else put, wet clothes, sweet, and malty with a hint of dried fruit in there as well.  Flavor is sweet and malty with a ton of various dried dark fruits in there, plum, raisin, etc and belgian yeast.  A little boozy at the end.  Highly carbonated with tight champagne type bubbles.  Sweet, but not overly so.  A well rounded brew.

Aroma: fruity, sweet

Appearance: super dark brown, practically black, darker head, medium size head dissipates relatively fast

Taste: sweet and fruity, frothy, 

Palate: some c02 burn, frothy, not much aftertaste, dry 

Overall: pretty similar to the 12, a good beer, a bit more alcohol taste than the 12

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great aroma....great flavors.  Great beer all around. One of my favorites. You will like this beer.

pours an opaque burgundy with a large tan head which diminishes quickly.lots of lacing sticking to the glass.heavy malt and the yeast reminds me of wet clothes in the basement.flavor is sweet,raisins and malt but very faint.medium carbonation anda full body with a slick mouthfeel. chalky finish.you get a lot of yeast and malt but not much else.abt 12 being one of my favorite beers,prior  is a little disappointing.very drinkable but not very exciting.

Served in a chalice. Pours an opaque brown with a small beige head. No visible carbonation. Aroma: Very grapy. Strong malt notes, a bit of lemon, ginger. Palate: thick bodied, fizzy, strong. nice long finish. Taste: sweet. really nice and complex

Pours a dark brown with tan head. Sweet malt aroma. Flavor is of strong malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Caramel, sweet, toffee aromas. Pours dark brown, tan head, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation. oily texture. Taste is sweet, caramel, a bit roasty, with sweet aftertaste. Nice and enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours a darker brown with a fairly thick off-white head. Nose is slightly sweet with some definite yeast notes in there. Taste is also fairly sweet, but not too strong. Interesting.

33cl bottle from Cotteridge Wines.Poured a dark brown colour with a medium,lasting tan head.Malt,fruit and toffee on the nose which also all came through in the taste.Also some vanilla and a little spice.Nice tasting beer however i would like to try again in 75cl bottle as i am sure it would taste even better as a lot of this style of beers do in the larger size.

Aroma: nice, matches flavor, but not very strong. Appearance: perfect, like a typical st. Bernardus. Taste: good, but More like a 12 lite more than anything, not what I was looking for. Palate: taste falls at the end and carbonation is a little strong. Overall: its good, but disappointing considering the source, I can see why 12 is really the only one people drink.

Bottle 0,75L. Amber-dark brown colour with not to big light brown head, that sits down slowly, but doesnt disappear. Lightly sweet caramel aroma, some honey, dark fruits and some milk chocolate notes, too. Sweety bitter taste at the start turns into a moderate bitter aftertaste. Full bodied beer with dry texture. Very well balanced, nothing predominates. Alcohol is well hidden.

Dark brown pour with a thick tan head.
aroma is light toffee, dark fruit,  lovely cake like maltiness. hint of clove spice as well. 
Flavour is dark fruit, banana ester, toffee, hints of vanilla and woody bitterness and light spice on the finish.
THe appearance and mouthfeel of this beer lets it down. Minimul head retension. Although the taste conjures morish dark fruits the overy carbonic body adds a limp unsupperted fizze
Belgian Beer Fest.  This is heavy brew with a full thick mouth feel and deep sweet flavor.  Pretty dense but still accessible.

Net als de 12 is dit een fruitig bier met een volle nasmaak en een schoon uitzicht. er staat ook een mooie schuimkraag op die een wat oker uitzicht heeft. Ideaal bier voor de zware bierliefhebbers  die niet te rap zat willen worden.

Draught at tuulensuu, tampere. Dark hazy brown color, hint of red. Smooth white head lasting a while. Very light aroma of belgian sweetness and banana. Balanced taste of sweetness, full malty body, some hops, medium aftertaste. Hops at the end definitely raises points.
UPDATED: JAN 23, 2013 33 cl bottle. Beautiful aroma. Excellent frothy head. Full body with a smooth and voluptuous mouthfeel. Well balanced, not too sweet, alcohol is well hidden. Pure pleasure.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 
33 cl bottle. BBE 08.04.2015.
Lots of sweet ripe fruits on the nose and on flavor. Caramel malts, molasses and some syrupy notes. A lot sweeter than I recalled. Not as much berry notes here though. Very tasty.
6336
Rating for tap version: 8-3-7-3-16
Tap @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours hazy copper color with a small head. Aroma of ripe fruits, caramel, mild toffee, some yeast and cellar notes. Flavor of caramel malts, ripe fruits, some mild sugar, toffee and berries. Quite berryish.
4336

December 13, 2012 bottle from binnys.  Brown pour with huge head that lasted and lacing.  Aroma was malty, sweet fruit, and bready/yeast.  Taste was primarily the malt, had a touch of sweet fruit and a dry spicy alcohol finish.  Palate was a bit thin and maybe even watery at times.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2013  Muddy brown in color with middle-lasting creamy cap it has sweet, yeasty-fruity aroma, no bitter, almost no hops presence in taste and after. Some pears and vanilla touches in a flavor. A spicy on tongue. Mild dry finish. Above medium body, gely-like texture, pleasant mouthfeel. Good one. Although seems to me like incomplite. .

Im pretty sure I shouldnt be drinking dubbels at the moment cause theyre not my bag. Still, this got better the further I drank through it, some spice to finish it off. Disappointed though. There was a kid at my school called Philip Prior. He was really really short, but lived in a house that had turrets, does that mean he wins?

Look: Dark brown almost black body, 2 finger off white head. Smell: Dark berries, spices, cereal grains, apples, bready notes, mild bubblegum, cocoa. Taste: Berries, spices, yeast, candi sugar, roasted nuts, malts, mild tartness, funk. Feel: Medium body, nice tight carbonation. Overall: This is very good. Well masked abv, drinks like a 5% brew. This is Recommended.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 Dark brown color with persistent and frothy tan head, sweet aroma and complex taste, oriented in sweet  and roasted notes,  full and smooth body, soft and pleasurable carbonation. Licorice aftertaste.
