Bottle from Beer Ritz, Leeds. Pours a deep reddish brown, finger of bubbly head that dies. Aroma is spice, banana, cloves, plums. Taste is fruity, with a bit of spiced plums/peaches, a bit of banana and belgian yeast going on, but a real bitterness too, balancing it out. It gives the impressoin of sweetness at the start, but you realise that it actually isnt sweet at all. Very odd but really interesting sensation. Fairly long tasty finish. Medium-full bodied, but overcarbonated (minus one palate point). Very nice dubbel indeed.
dark brown color, aroma of spices, caramel, dark fruits, bready yeast, brown sugar, flavors are the same, little booze on the finish, med body, easy drinking for the avb

Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff nov-12: mørkebrun med høyt beige skum som varer. Aroma av karamell, malt og eik (vanilje). I smaken er der i tillegg kandissukker og litt velstekt brødskorpe. Behagelig karbonert. Lang ettermsak. En herlig dubbel!

Pours a cloudy brown with a thin beige head that sits on top through out. The aroma has a lot of fruit, sweet malt and a bit of spice. The flavor follows with a big malt presence and yet well balanced. Not at all sweet, it has a bit of a bit on the throat. Big bodied but easy drinking.

Aroma agradables y complejos. Las notas principales son a maltas y chocolate.

En cuanto al color, cerveza obscura con destellos cafe y ligeros tonos rubí a la luz. Cuerpo medio, carbonatación de media a alta y corona de espuma ligera pero de larga retención.

En boca, igual de comlpeja que el aroma. Las primeras sensaciones son de cremosidad y un amargor muy bien equilibrado.

Al paladar esta cerveza es sensacional. Encuentra un excelente equilibrio entre el amargor inicial y el dulzor final. Las maltas se perciben en el sabor de la cerveza, el retrogusto es suave pero a la vez acentuado. Su final es de media duración sin dejar sentir su potencia alcohólica.

En general hablamos de una excelente cerveza. Una gran representante del estilo, ideal para consumir sola acompañada de un buen libro, como aperitivo o simplemente en un momento de excelente relax!

Pours a dark brown colour with an off-white head that stays in the glass for a long time. Aroma of malts, caramel and oak. Flavour also brings some candy sugar. Soft to medium carbonation. An avarage + dubbel in my opinion.

Served in a St. Bernardus goblet. 

The beer is chestnut brown with a half inch of tan head that leaves ample lacing in its wake. The aroma brings brown bread, yeast, brown sugar (though the aroma is not sweet, per se), light spice. The flavor is light and easy. Minimal alcohol presence. Bread, yeast, malt, light spice. A stellar example of a dubbel.

Wow, this is a flavorful beer! With a dark hazy brown color and a slightly sour smell it has a rich and a vibrant flavor with grainy aspects and a full body. IT lingers for a while and leaves you coming back for more. One of the best of the best, after all it is a Belgian beer....

Very nice beer. Touch of caramel and malt on the nose. Red-brown-golden appearance with a tannish head. Taste is toffee, treacle and a touch of maltyness. Palate is bitter, warm and a touch alcoholic, but good. Great beer though. 
I suspect the one I had hadnt been aged for very long; Ill definitely buy another and sit on it for a year or so and give it another go cause good dubbels age very well, and I know this one will too.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy brown with white head. 
Aroma spice, dark fruits, roasted malts, caramel, yeast. 
Taste soft sweet, spicy, little bitter and some alcohol. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Great tasting beer.

Bottle. 2005 vintage. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Smooth, rich fruit aroma -- prunes, raisins, dates -- and dark sugar. Watery brown color. Very mild fruity initial; the alc. becomes noticeable in mid palate; flavors smoothly slip away in final. Thin-medium body. This has mellowed very nicely. Maybe it has lost a bit of its flavor. But so glad I had a chance to sip this mature beer.

330 ml bottle. Cloudy orange-brown colour, thin off-white head. Sweetish and spicy aroma of dark fruits, yeast, malt and caramel. The flavour is sweetish malty, with dark fruits, a little warming alcohol, and a pleasantly spicy warm finish. Very tasty.
Bottle. Pours hazy. Brown. Clear herbal and malty aroma. Not sweet. A weak touch of caramel. Malty.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Nut brown with beige medium to thin head. decent lacing.
Aroma fruity, bread, light roasted malts.
Bit too much fizzy. Intense with bit dry finish.
Much lighter than Abt 12 aroma. Thou flavour is balanced and smooth.
Another great abbey dubbel!

Bottle at home (Spar, Popperinge) - 20/10/12.
Almost clear chestnut brown with a thin off white head - carbonation visible in the glass.
Toffee, malt, yeast, fruits and hops on the nose.
Taste follows nose, a little nutty, sweet candy, dark fruits.
Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation - a little too much as Ive found with most of the St Bernardus beers which lets them down. A little too sweet overall.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Dark brown, pleasant head with good lacing. Pleasant smell of malts and ripe fruit. Strong taste of roasted malt, alcohol,  subtle sweetness. Hoppy aftertaste.

One of the first abbey beers I tried back when I was researching for my European beer tour in 2010. Definitely a classic. Now living in Belgium, where you can buy it super cheap, in 6-packs! Beautiful pour into Duvel glass. Dark brown with some haze. Head is very uniform; fine bubbles; a bit tan or off-white. Aroma is deep with layers, but not to in-your-face. Incredibly well-crafted--so balanced. Palate stays pretty dry. Definitely a standard-setter among abbey dubbels. Oh, and you have to love the label art.

Dark fruit aroma -  figs, raisins. Pours a cloudy brown with a mostly diminishing ivory head and fine lacing. Taste is lightly sweet - prunes, raisins perhaps a hint of caramel. The finish is quick. Medium bodied and creamy balanced with fizzy carbonation. Overall, an excellent Dubble. Will drink again

330ml bottle. Pours brown with a small beige head. Loads of sediment floating in the body. Nose is dark fruits, cinnamon, prune, molasses, caramel, grape, hints of alcohol and earthy yeast. Beautiful complex fruit malts in the flavour. Hugh carbonation which settles to a velvety texture, medium full body, Short finish, slightly warming. Delicious.

From 33cl bottle bought @ La Birreria (Andorra). Hazy brown body with a puffy beige head lasting and leaving a nice lacing. Prune, clove, cinnamon, raisin, nuts, caramel and toffee aromas which explode in the nose. Medium sweetness, very light bitterness, no sourness. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation, enhances the complexity of the aromas covering the high alcohol content. Extremely well balanced Dubbel, that I am setting on par with the Westmalle or the Chimay on the top of the class.
750 ml bottle aged for around 5 years. Dark ruby pour, complex aroma and taste with slightly sweet almost plum like notes. Wish I had a few more bottles in the cellar...

What a great dubbel. Slightly darker than the 6 with a thicker mouthfeel. Heavy prune notes and carbonation is just right. More good stuf by St. Bernardus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Post Office Vaults, Birmingham. Smells wheaty and brick dusty. Firstly a robust choc malt/biscuit nut combo. Then some of the more floppy Belgian yeast/wheat combo comes through. I try Dubbels so infrequently that its hard to say how this compares to others. But I like it. Its very good.

Great.  The nose is malt in the caramel and light chocolate range.  There is also a big yeast presence. Deep brown with a thin but dense beige to tan head.  Sweet and very malt forward with just enough balance from floral hops.  Smooth and full bodied with a sweet finish.

#926
 Dunkelbraun, ziemlich trüb, ein paar Schwebeteilchen sind auch sichtbar, nicht so dolle Optik. Leicht hefig-säuerlich und malzig im Aroma. Der Antrunk ist für 8% Alk. eher verhalten; geschmacklich kommt eine Pumpernickelnote "bittersweet" vor. Das war´s dann aber schon. Aromenarm und langweilig; die deutlich alkoholische Note im leicht herberem Abgang trägt auch nicht zur Bekömmlichkeit bei. Insgesamt für ein belgisches Abteibier doch sehr enttäuschend.
	
Test vom 18.10.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 8,8,6,8,5,7 - 7,15
Draft at flying saucer. Pours brown with a thin khaki head. Big yeast notes on the nose. It smells like rising bread. Big yeas on the tongue with a slight sweetness. Nice!
Dark brown coloured beer with a small head. sweet chocolate aroma. Nice sweet malty flavour. (Bottle 33cl)
330ml bottle. Murky chestnut color. Medium beige head appears, stays. Not much aroma. Malty, caramel in aroma. Hops, caramel, malty and fresh grapes in flavor. Nice grape juice aftertaste.
Pours a dark red and very carbonated. Aroma is sweet, dark fruit, fig, and an alcohol burn. Taste is very complex,  dark fruit, yeast, and is smooth but still taste the 8%

The quintessential dubbel!  It doesnt get much better than this.  Viscous, malty palette displays sweet brown sugar tones with hints of plums and candi sugar.  Gorgeous, foamy head.  Perfect balance between alcohol and malt.  My favorite style of beer!@

An alcoholic aroma can be very deceptive at times, and this is one of those cases. Alcohol with some sweetness. However the body is soft, creamy, filled with caramel flavours, some sweetness and no real hint of alcohol until late in the aftertaste. A very drinkable beer!

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2012 aroma : caramel, cereal, chocolate, floral, alcohol, 
apparenza: red, brown, hazy, minimal head, 
gusto: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, 
palato: medium body, lively, creamy, long  bitter finish, 
si presenta di colore scuro,rossastro e di aspetto torbido con poca schiuma..laroma è la cosa migliore di questa birra,estremamente complesso e ricco: fruttato,caramello,lievi note di cioccolato,cereali,quasi assenti gli aromi del luppolo..il gusto è meno sorprendente dellaroma,ma stiamo parlando comunque di una grande birra:carbonazione media,molto dolce con il luppolo che sopraggiunge verso la fine della sorsata e che si prolounga con un bel finale morbido e leggermente amaro!

Subtle head, light brown with a little redness. Apple juice smell. Yeast with carbonating bite, light sweet fruit taste, dry.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smaak is noot- en fruitachtig. Halfvol mondgevoel en een licht zoete en Zeer licht bittere afdronk. Robijnpaars. Redelijk biertje

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Dichte, beige schuimkraag op een koperbruin bier. Zakt snel in. Bier is troebel. Filmend, levendig door voldoende koolzuur, zonder te aanwezig te zijn. Lichtzoet. Aroma: peper, mout, drop en rood fruit. Lekkere dubbel, hoewel vrij zwaar.
Pours a cloudy brown body with a white/tan head. Smell is astringent like citrus peel with notes of bread. Taste is also citrus with a slight malty sweetness. Not too bad.
The best dubbel in my opinion, such tasty and creamy feel. The more I have it, the more I like it.

On tap at Belgian Beer Weekend, Brussels. Has a hazy deep reddish brown colour with a big light brown head. Aromas of dried fruit, chocolate, wood, leather and some perfume and hops. Much of the same things in the flavour as well. The mouthfeel is slick, and has a light bitterness. A great abbey dubbel with a wonderful balance.
Yowza! A perfect abbey dubbel. Copper/orange with a skin of a head. Flavor is full and subtle at the same time. Just the right amount of sour in the palate. Fabulous!

Bottle at home. 
Offwhite  two finger foam, dark amber with brown notes. 
Spicy aroma, malt and sugar. 
Malty, pepperish taste and sugar aftertaste. 
Really nice. 

Bolton Brew Rocks !!

Pours a very murky dark brown color with a decent head that quickly fades.  Aroma smells like candy and burnt sugar.  Lots of fruitiness too, dates, raisins, dark fruit.  Taste is pretty sweet and tasty, like liquid candy.  High carbonation gives it a sparkling wine quality.  As it warms and flattens, the taste gets much maltier and the mouthfeel gets more chewy and thick.  Finish is bubbly and fruity.  Overall a pretty tasty beer.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2012 330mL bottle from a boutique shop in Arras, France. Pours a muddy reddish brown with a small head. Aroma is devine, complex malts with loads of yeasty elements thrown on top, somewhat dank and musty, very inviting! Flavour is equally complex, this is a great beer to sit with and contemplate. Chewy, dark malty body with figs, dates, raisins, caramel, and a host of other characters. Finishes sweet and leaves me wanting more. A 750mL would be consumed very quickly if I had one, as this is eminently drinkable.
Pours hazy brown with off white head.  Sweet and fruity aroma.  Taste of sweet dried fruits.
33cl bottle at taberna belga, braga, portugal. Dark brown color. Medium to high carbonation. Medium thick head. Low to medium sweetness. Honey, malt, wood, yeast aroma.

Pours a hazy brown umber with a touch of ruby on the edges...nice two finger off white head that sticks around for a bit.  Aromas are earthy, sweet malts, caramel and touches of fig and raisin. On the palate its got a nice carbonation level with great mouthfeel. Flavors are dark but refreshing; plum earthy mushroom, fig with touches of candy sweetness and a nice mellow bitter hop finish that dries up the mid palate fruit malt sweetness.  Nice beer as is expected from St. Bernardus.

18-AUG-2012, bottle @home, brought by Morten.
Hazy brown with lasting tan head.
Spice, caramel, wine aroma.
Dry vinouos with high carbonation. Sweetness is there. Finish is hoppy bitter. OK.

Pours an opaque brown with a medium tan head...nice retention and lacing.  Aroma has light candi sugar, mild fig, raisin, and faint leather.  Flavor has nice candi sugar notes without the sweetness, mild earthy hop bitterness, leather, and fig.  Mouthfeel is full and silky smooth with a dry earthy/bitter lightly roasty finish.

Bottle shared with esp0r and edvard at Amundsen, august 18th 2012.
Amber body, sparkling, low tan head.
Aroma of licorice, dried fruit, grassy hops.
Taste of yeast, biscuit, sugars, fruit and alcohol. A bit low bitterness

Pours cloudy brown with a creamy to tan coloured head. Aromas of toffee, sweet fruits, belgian esters, slight banana and some brown sugar. Big rich flavours with sweet candy, malt, slight fruit and a slightly warming finish. Very rich and tasty stuff.

Big bottle shared with daje and ed at Amundsen
Aroma of malts, dry fruits, some yeast esters and caramel. Medium sweet, quite fruity, light to moderate bitter. A bit more easy-drinking than expected and possibly a bit simple in the flavor mix

Bottle to a New Belgian glass. Pours deep mahogany color which is hazy and shows a off white/khaki head that settles to a thin film. Aroma has some roasted malt a little tootsie roll and subtle licorice and nuttiness. Taste is more of the above with it being bitter and warming from the alcohol. Palate is medium and chalky.

On 33 cl bottle at La mayor cerveceria
Dark golden, some sediments, good foam.
Red fruit aromas, good yeast, malt & dried fruits.
Full body & complexity.
Very enjoyable
Kinda boozy on the nose, with notes of cherry and a bit of sweetness.  Taste is slightly caramel malt dominated, pretty good but not my style.

First impressions: Poured at medium-low rate, its murky, hazelnut brown with an ashen tan foam. It smells of figs, candy sugar, alcohol, toffee. Upon warming, very nice caramel and toasty bitter notes shine through, with just a hint of fruit.

A-- Big puff of white cloud upon uncorking this. Poured a very hazy cherry brown color. Some sediment in the pour. One finger off white brown head that dissipated pretty quickly but on swirling the head retention was very good. No lacing but very visible alcohol legs and small beads of carbonation.

S-- Really reminds me of a spiced cake. Something like that. Bready yeast, plumbs, cherrys, raisins, Cinnamon, and some lemon and orange.

T-- A lot of plumb, raisin, lemon and orange. A little bit of alcohol mixed in on this.

M-- More it sat in my mouth the more the lemon came out and the raisins and plumbs felt to be soaked in rum. Has a citrus like feel to the carbonation and a little more than medium body and carbonation to this.
Delicious. Very good balance between a light maltiness and backbone. Cookie notes. Deep and complex. Much easier to drink than their big boys.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a murky, dark mahogany colour with moderate-sized off-white head.  Aroma is caramel, dark fruit and Belgian yeast - nice, but a little muted.  Flavour is quite big with rich, slightly toasty caramel, a little brown sugar, plum and stewed grape, and a gentle spiciness.  Mild alcohol warmth in the finish.  Fairly creamy mouthfeel.  Very nice.

Poured from a 33 cl bottle into a St. Bernardus branded chalice.

Pours a molasses brown with a two finger light beige head. The head remains as long as the beer, significant lacing coats the sides of the glass. The aroma of dark fruit, fig and dates, sweet cream, and a hint of alcohol rises from the chalice. Notes of sweet malt, caramel, spice, bread, and almond can be found thoughout this brew. Medium-bodied, perfect carbonation, creamy velvet on the palate. An exceptional dubbel from a fantastic brewery.

75cl bottle at Amundsen (shared with Alexcg). Pours amber with an off-white head. Fruity aroma with caramel, malt, dark dried fruits and a hint of alcohol. Sweet, fruity and malty with a nice balance. Some dryness in the finish, also a hint of bitterness and maybe a little roasty. Sweet, but very pleasant. Nice!

A very great belgian beer, complex and enchanting
Visual: Cloudy red-brow with a pearly long-lasting white head.
Aroma: Very complex, dried fruits, bit of caramel,  bit of port wine.
Taste: Loads of dark fruits, some caramel, toasted and slightly Port like. Medium to heavy body.

---Rated by Sumonation
Brown colour. Toffee caramel aroma. Sweet caramel syrup taste.

Bottle brought back from Lille. Pour dirty brown with a thick white-beige head that settles to a nice thin carpet over the beers surface.  Aroma is delicious. Like a fruit cake, theres a bit for everyone, chocolate, dried prunes, spice. I love it. The taste is formidable, more complex and sweet than its little brother the 6. Malt, caramel, dried fruit, anise, backed by a perfectly leveled bitterness. A little less carbonated than belgian ales tend to be and I would normally comment on that, but in this beer it makes perfect sense. Its a wonderful beer, and so well it hides the 8% ABV. Mmmm.

Pours a red-brow brew with a thick, long-lasting tan head. The aroma is very complex with a lot of dried and dark fruits, typical Belgian yeast character and a very elegant Port wine aroma. The taste follows the aroma with loads of dark fruits, some toasted and Port like and some hop bitterness in the aftertaste.  Very well balanced beer that hides tha alcohol very well. Very intense and complex.
Overall: I get a lot of caramel, but well in balance. Not much alcohol or hop character. Very drinkable.

Amber brown. Taste has a bit of a wintergreen / menthol twang, but not enough to be annoying. Otherwise what you would expect from a candi/belge beer: the yeast esters, the caramel, malts. A nice drink, smooth and everything. Compared to Rochefort 8, they are quite similar. This one has more hop bitterness in it and is lighter on the aromatic side (not so much plume and dark flavors).

dark brown color. huge head slowly that dissipates slowly.
aroma is caramel.
taste is great. sweet malts, not excessively and well balanced body. airy carbonation.
smooth!
it goes well with goat cheese or apple tart, but the latter replaces the sweetness by  more astringent flavor. nice anyway!
Amber colour with a nice frothy white head. Sweet caramel malt aroma. Syrup malt flavour. Thick syrup like texture. Nice tasty brew.

Bottle at Brasserie V.  Thick opaque brown with a patchy beige head.  Rich chocolate and dark fruit aroma.  Delightfully fluffy and light on the palate. with delicious brown chocolate doughy notes.  Almost as light as the freshest dunkelweizen, with the added complexity of the belgian yeast and specialty malts.  Some mellow coconut tones.  An awesome, world class beer.  Solid fruity tones, lots of depth.  Hides/incorporates the alcohol expertly.  Way more chocolate richness than the draft version..compared side by side the draft comes off as more of a thin amber.  The bottle owns.  Delicious.

Kleur lijkt op rozijn, net als Pater 6. Smaak heeft ook wat overeenkomsten, rozijn, brood. Iets zoeter (niet te) van caramel en meer kruiden. 

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2012 Deep brown. Head dissipated pretty quickly. Yeasty, banana, alcohol in the aroma. Lots of brown sugar, raisins, figs, mild hops on the back end.

33cL bottle.  Another winner from the Watou Saint.  Aroma is malty, bread.  Appearance is gorgeous, similar to the 12.  Brown color, careful on the pour, lots of sediment.  Body is heavy as well, a full beer but easy to sip.  Taste is fantastic, not as "grapey" as the 12 though.  Still, a fantastic beer and one of my new "old" favorites.

Have a bottle from early 2012 pour into wide mouth glass. Reminds me of pouring a cola color wise... creamy darker head. Malty smooth taste with a slight bitter aftertaste. Alc is felt in the stomach but not really tasted.. awesome!
Hazy brown colour, reddish foam. Sour wine smell. Pleasant strong fizziness, foamy in mouth. Very sweet taste, sour tinge. Leaves week coffee aftertaste. Medium strong. Quite good beer.

330ml bottle. Rusted mahogany pour with ample head that sticks around and leaves lots of lace. Tons of fruit esters on the nose, red and purple things, with some spice and brown sugar. Fairly full body with a nice malty/yeasty flavour. Theres a warming brandy feel to the finish.

Reddish brown, deep but clear until the yeast fond is poured; fine beige foam.
The nose is quite hoppy with some spices, softened by sugars; not that strong but a typical smell of a Dubbel.
The taste is pretty similar: hops, quite some spices and decent bit of alcohol, a touch of roast. Quite bitter but not excessively.
The aftertaste is smoother and creamier, a mix of light roast and malts.
To me its quite similar to Rochefort 6 though a little bit more outspoken and slightly hoppier.
750 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with light head. Aroma of roasted malt and caramel. Similar flavor though more pronounced toffee/caramel taste. Slight sweet with coppery finish. Full body.

Dark ruby amber with a frothy 1/2" head, slow to dissipate.  Streaks of lace encircle the glass.  Taste is mild caramel malt with light bread and spice.  The sweet moves aside at the finish for a bracing bitter malt with alcohol undercurrents.  Quite good.
330ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Dark brown colour with nice beige head. Aroma is dark fruits. Flavour is fruity, yeasty, sweet.
Pours Darks hazy brown with one finger head that lingers until thick creamy lacing. Darks fruits and spices on the nose. Sweet with dark fruits, caramel, pretty standard beer from Belgium beer.

Bottle. murky brown with creamy light brown head with good lacing, aroma of sweet dark fruit and a possible yeasty brown banana smell and some nice bitterness on the end of the aroma. A pleasant taste of sweet dark fruit, light alcohol with a slightly bitter finish. Palate is disappointingly lighter then expected. Overall a very nice beer.

Pours slightly cloudy dark copper color with frothy head that dissipates rather quickly leaving behind small lacing. Thin layer of head does remain. Aromas of apple, wine. raisins, and other dark fruits. Flavors of raisin, plum, brown sugar, and malt dominate with a hint of wine and touch of alcohol on the finish. Mouthfeel is heavy and creamy. Overall it's an excellent beer, though not as complex as other dubbels. Best sipped and enjoyed. 

--- Cheers
Cloudy, murky brown with a fluffy white head. Thick lacing in the glass. Prune and fig nose. Lively mouthfeel with a fruity and savory balance on the palate. Long, intense finish.
Dark yellow, ligh brown with thick foam head lacing to glass. Drank this at one of beer tasting evenings. Good addittion. Good Belgium beer. Aroma is bit sweet, but taste is not. (Utrecht 201203)
Draft at blue monk, how have I not rated this yet, darker cola pour; brown. Sweet smelling aroma, some raisins and other dark fruits. Sweet flavor, raisny. Not overly sweet but spot on. Very nice

On tap at Belga Sörfesztivál, Budapest. Clear, dark brown color with creamy, light brown head. Roasted malty aroma, brown sugar, parfume, alcohol, coriander, fruits, maybe some cheese flavour - a very complex and rich one. Dry taste, but the malty and alcoholly sweetness appears. Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Yeasty, cheese finish. Typical St. Bernardus beer, small brother of the Abt 12, but its not as liqoury like that. Its more like a beer. Delicious, rich, but drinkable.

33cl bottle at Håndverkerstuene. Best before 2017-02-02. Brown colour with a medium big head. Subtle aromas as first, but as the beer warmed up the flavours opened up as well. Notes of malts, bread, nuts and alcohol. Hints of yeast. Flavour is different from the aroma. Notes of nuts, sweet malts, caramel, yeast and syrup. Perhaps a bit too sweet.

75 cl bt. with fine lighltly reddish head. red brown. nose with cinnamon, stone and minerals. a little lighter than expected.with some subdued fruitcake. Semifull body and some length. As always with belgien beers it is high carbonated with a little sugar, fruitcake and brown sugar, soft and very pleasant.
Pours cloudy dark brown with minimal creamy head. Smells mostly of yeast with hits of malt and sourness. Tastes mostly of sweet malt, dust and a hint of apple vinegar.
This is Pater 6s better older brother.  The thin mouthfeel issue I had with that beer is fixed in this one with a nice rich backbone with spices nuts and dark fruits.  Tasty and well done.

Pours a mix of a very deep mix of copper and amber with a foamy head. Aromas of bread, caramel, raisin, cherry, and toffee. Flavors of caramel, toffee, hints of cherry, and some bread. Has a light richness, medium carbonation, medium sweetness, and has a light bitter finish. Has many qualities of the abt 12 but to a lesser degree.
Big malty fucking delicious dubbel right here. Sweet and rich. Loving it. Nutty too

Dry grapey aroma.  Dark muddy brown body, tannish head.  Taste is bright with carbonation then drops to a deep malty finished with a slight sour. Very well balanced and complex.  The flavor builds after the sip, oddly similar to a scotch. Quite interesting.

bottle   pours hazy mid brown with thick beige head  . yeasty acetic aroma  . taste is acidic and fruity with malt underneath . alcohol warmth in the finish  . medium carbonation  . body a bit light for 8% abv
33 cl. bottle @ home. Hazy brown with a huge tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and dark fruits. Taste is sweet but certainly not too sweet. really balanced beer, maybe even better than the Abt.

Tasted this in a forgotten hostelry somewhere in Brussels in April 2012. 33cl bottle. Pours a muddy dark copper red with a thick off white head. Strong aroma of heather honey, long in intensity. Smooth creamy mouthfeel and superb lacing. Mixed malt complex gives a silky delivery of sweet caramelised fruit mixed with copious amounts of sweet honey. Little hops of note in the zip past aftertaste. Finish is sweet and malty. Flavours are glazed with honey as a warming mead alcoholic note comes to the fore and slips down the throat. Not as stellar as the 12 but highly recommended none the less.

From a 33cl bottle at Academie de la Biere in Paris. Pours a hazy brown with foamy head that dissipates and rings. Leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma is just wonderful, lots of yeast, some banana, and bubblegum. Taste is out of this world, malts, yeast, a bit of hops, a perfect sweet harmony with a sweet lingering aftertaste. Palate is a bit thick with moderate carbonation. Just a wonderful beer.

As you pour you get a yeasty sweetness aroma.  Its a hazy dark amber color you can see the yeast floating around.  Its a sweet taste but not overpowering.  Very malty. Then you get that alcohol taste.  Over all you get a medium body taste of malty delight.  I have not hade a beer yet from this abbey.  Great buy and will buy again.

The second beer in my St Bernardus evening, a brown 330ml bottle best before 5th Apr 2012, drank on 1st March 2008.

Poured into my Westmalle bowl glass it looks a lovely ruby red, deep and clean appearance. The beige head stayed for the whole experience, which I always like to see.

Plum pudding and christmas cake mix come to mind in the aroma, but it isnt strong and takes some finding. Burnt malts also in there somewhere.

The taste knocks spots off the 6.7% Pater 6 which is what I had prior to this (see how I did that?). This beer tastes like its aroma, plums, dried fruits (like found in a Christmas cake), malty, toasty and roasted.

Feels good, nicely balanced beer, the flavours stay and the beer is obviously well crafted.

As I stated earlier, I like a beer whos head stays throughout the drink, this beer has that trait. It is also a dam good tasting beer.

Very dark brown pour, the aroma doesnt really leave any distinctive sensations. Sadly I poured th beer wrong so the foam pretty much died instantly (or is that normal for this beer?). The taste itself is very good though! It has a roasted coffe taste, keeps me wanting from more!

Had this on tap at Mate Bar in Tel Aviv. Dark amber brown with a tan head. Smells like yeast, sweet dark fruits and some flowers. Taste is rich yet not overwhelming with spice, yeast, dark sugars and candy malts and sweet citrus hops. Med bodied. After taste has enough hops in it to keep it dry and balance the sweet flavors. Great brew!

Poured into a St. Bernardus chalice from a 11.2 ounce bottle best before 13-09-16.

A: Murky mahogany body with light only visible on the sides, thick dense tan head with good retention.

S: Semi-sweet malts with some brown sugar in there. This is simple, but smells great.

T: Sweet malts and brown sugar on the finish with slight cloves on the aftertaste. Warming sensation is down my throat with each sip. This is nice.

M: Thick with sharp carbonation towards the end of the sip.

O: Very solid beer, Im not sure which I like better of the two I had tonight this or Pater 6, two different takes on a dubbel, both being fantastic.

Bottle at the Lowlander, London. It pours deep ruby-brown, with a thick white head. The nose is caramel, earth, plum, date, fig, prune, spice and clove. The taste is wood, caramel, cola, prune, date, leather, spice, warming alcohol, bitter chocolate, roasted malt, earth and brown sugar, with a dry, warming finish. Very well balanced. Full body and moderate carbonation. A classic example of the style.
deep brown. complex aroma and taste. caramel, brown sugar, raisin. sweet, but not as much as other dubbels. there is enough flavor to hide the alcohol well.

Pours light brown with a medium head. Aroma licorice, malts, belgian yeast. . Medium palate and high carbonation. Somewhat fresh bottle and could probably use some aging to get the fullness out of this. Not Bad.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2012 Pours deep orange with large foamy head that sticks around for a bit.  Fruity, clovey, phenolic, yeasty smell - tad bit of spice, too, but the other smells predominate, esp. fruit (reminiscent of apricots, peaches, and bananas, in that order).  Biggest lacing Ive ever seen in a beer.  Incredibly sweet!  Bit of alcohol burn.  Malty, bready, even slightly tart aftertaste, still with the hints of orange fruits before (less banana/clove in the taste relative to the smell).  Very nice dubbel.  Impressed.  AUGUST RE-RATE: Bumping this up a bit on aroma and overall.  Not that far from Chimay Red.
Bottle. Deep brown with a thin head. Aroma is pepper and some caramel. Flavour is clean malt, burnt sugar and noticeable alcho. Finish us sweet warming
Pours brown with light frothy head that condenses down. aroma malty fruitness and abbey yeast. Taste is pleasantly sweet, plummy, rich; good brew

Pours a hazy almost opaque brownish copper color with a huge frothy head. Nose is sweet caramel. Very creamy mouthfeel, with flavors of caramel, malt and taffy with a very light hops note on the finish. Pairs well with soft cheeses or a light nut mix.
750 ml pours hazy brown with a tan head.  Aroma of sweet malt and yeast.  Taste is malt and brown sugar.  Nice beer

Bottle 330 ml. Appearance: Pours dark brown with a small brown head. Aroma: Dark fruits, raisin, caramel, plum. Sweet. Taste: Sweet, dark fruits, caramel, malt. Overall: Light version of Abt 12. A really good beer. Reallty complex and well balanced for a dubbel.

750 ml bottle into signature chalice, no bottle dating.  Pours cloudy dark reddish brown color with a fairly dense 2 finger off white head with good retention that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Some slight spotty lacing on the glass.  Aromas of big apple, grape, raisin, prune, dark candi sugar, molasses, pepper, toasted biscuit, and yeast spices.  Fantastic and standard dubbel aromas with great complexity and strength.  Taste of big raisin, prune, caramel, molasses, biscuit, clove, pepper, dark candi sugar, light chocolate, roasted nut, and yeast spices.  Lingering notes of dark fruit, molasses, apple, candi sugar, clove, and yeast spices on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic flavor balance and complexity; with no cloying sweetness.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a fantastic fairly creamy and slick mouthfeel.  Very smooth to drink but is still a sipper.  Alcohol is very well hidden with hardly any warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an absolutely mind blowing Dubbel.  Fantastic flavor complexity, balance, and super smooth drinking.  Hands down the best Dubbel I have ever had.

Murky brown pour with faint ruby highlights, under an awesome persistant beige fluffy head.  Aroma was a little like cake batter in its sweetness with a bit of dark fruit undertones like cherry and raisin, but also a subdued noble hop bitterness that doesnt take any spotlight away from the murky dark fruity maltness.  Mouthfeel was balanced and well rounded, full.  Malty with sweet brown sugar notes, some dusty yeast, a dry slightly herbal hoppiness, a touch of raisin, and some light boozy esters on the finish.  For my taste, its a little hoppy and dry, otherwise its pretty dang good.

A - Fruity with more coriander and spice then the "6"
A - Hazy golden-brown with thin lasting head
T - Sweet with light sour and slight roasted bitter
P - Full and soft
O - Good

Première question : cette bière est-elle une dubbel ? Par la couleur dans
le verre, oui. Mais rien ne le dit sur létiquette, elle est juste présentée comme une bière dabbaye. 
Donc bière dabbaye faite par un brasseur de la "belgian family brewers"
et qui sappelle Prior. La première peut être une double, mais cest un long débat qui nous entraînerait trop loin...
Couleur brun sombre roux, dans le style dun Porto tawny.
Clarté pure (si on met la levure à part, comme toujours)
Pétillant : bien, sans excès (et la mienne est à date au 8/4/2015).
Arômes de prune, poire mûre, figue, mûre et une pointe de myrtille.
Première bouche superbe sur les fruits susdits et les céréales. Légère
nuance dun porto de classe.
Deuxième nez dun grand brassin, sur les raisins et les dattes.
Deuxième bouche de très beaux pruneaux dAgen.
Troisième nez riche et capiteux.
Troisième bouche avec des nuances variées, mais de grande classe, 
avec des pointes darmagnac de Ténarèze et de cognac fins bois.
Longueur avec un bel équilibre des saveurs, et une pointe damertume.
Levure de bonne facture, soyeuse et un rien vineuse.
Alcool bien dosé,  sans prise excessive.
Finale dans la grande aventure dune bière de catégorie supérieure.
Beaucoup de classe, du caractère, peu de sucre, des nuances qui se 
précisent à la suite lune de lautre, et en arrière bouche.
Du style, de la brillance et pourquoi pas une maîtrise qui appartient souvent à dautres domaines de la gastronomie, pour ne pas nommer 
le vin, qui sy croit souvent un peu trop, et ferait bien de regarder sa petite
soeur la bière....
Nous, chez Ratebeer, nous savons de quoi nous parlons.
Fuller, thicker version of the pater. Delicious sugary sweet aroma. Full mouthfeel with lots of burnt sugar. Fantastic dubbel style from an ex trappist contract brewery

De Vinos, DC 330ml ($5): Pours a murky brown with an awesome looking head. Aroma is a healthy pairing of fruitiness and yeast. I should also mention those nice little malts who dropped by. Taste is slightly sweet. Combines a lot of fruity flavors. The hops give off a little bite. The carbonation give the beer a nice bubbly feel, while at the same time letting it retain its thickness. Pretty much, this is a perfectly crafted dubbel. There are no errors here, only delicious beer.

Muddy brown appearance with medium tan head.  Nice aroma of yeast, baking bread, caramel and brown sugar, raisins.  Body full but not overly so, a little carbonation when cooler.  Flavor is malty and yeasty and off-dry.  Some spices and esters and coffee.  Faint hops.  Nicely complex, not as much so as the 12 and not as much thought needed but a little more drinkable also.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 Le St. Bernardus sono semppliemente pazzesche. Aroma speziato, di mosto duva, toffee e mele caramellate. Gusto simile allaroma, con qualcosa di vanilla , punta subito al dolce per poi virare a un leggero amaro venato da sentori di frutti di bosco (more e mirtilli). Lalcool si sente e non è perfettamente mascherato così come il lievito ( questultimo un pò marchio di fabbrica) difetti tuttavia veniali. Ottima davvero.
Très bonne brune. Du goût et de la présence. Un vrai régal. Pas trop agressive non plus.
Date color (brown and murky) with a small but lasting head. Aroma of malt, Belgian spices and flowers. Taste of raisins, malt, and alcohol which bites your tongue. Medium finish and full body.
Pours a cloudy brown with a ivory head.  Dark fruit, raisin, and Belgian yeast aromas.  Flavor is malty and sweet with prune and raisin notes.  Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel.

Pours hazed dark brown with a frothy beige head with good retention. Aroma of dark fruit, lots of malt, some molasses, some earthy yeast, banana, clove. Taste is sweet fruity yeast and malt. Great beer, gets better as it warms and loses a little bit of carbonation.

Pours a very dark brown with a tall frothy off-white head. Aroma is yeast with dark fruits, dark sugar and hints of spices. Taste is also dark fruits, some yeast and spices with a hint of chocolate leading to a sweet fruity after taste. Lovely beer although not as good as the amazing 12.

Bottled. Dark bownish color with medium lacing and head. Very sweet aroma with citrus zest and fruit notes.  A lil bit carbonated, sweet malty taste with added fruits and earth tones. Finishing sweet malty, caramel, and mildly hoppy.  Very balanced and unique.
Fruity and a nice sugar taste. Beautiful dark brown color with nice white head. Moderate carbonation. Very good beer.

2012.03.06 - 750ml bottle in Chimay glass.    Pours a dark caramel color.  Vigorous 1 finger light tan head.  Aroma is fairly neutral to my nose.  Taste is lovely.  Good balance of sweetness and bitter, a bit of alcohol bite.  Very nice.
My second bottle of night at Brabant belgian Brasserie.  Pours deep amber brown with frothy head.  tastes of yeast, cloves, toffee, dark fruits, earth, malt.  very nice way to end my mussels meal.

Bottle, approximately two years or more old.  Whoops?  Pours a deep ruby tinged garnet brown with a medium sized deep beige head.  Oxidized, but softer and sweeter than the previous two.  Big soft caramel and fruit on the nose. A touch floral, hints of lavender and laundry drying in the summer sun.  Medium bodied, rich and full of warm caramel, oxidized sweet malt, a touch of caramel and brown sugar.  Hints of deterioration show up along the way, the faintest tinges of paper, but still delicious and coherent.  Finishes with a lingering warmth, and a touch of bakers cocoa.  Lovely.
The hazy hazelnut appearance is a welcome sight after a good meal.  The complexity of the varying sugars are thick and deserve a pause of enjoyment.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle. Murky brown pour with a off white head. Fruit and nut on the nose. Medium palate. Taste is fruit and malty nut. Awesome.

Bottle. Murky brown with diminishing off-white head. Wonderful nose. Fruity candy shop notes. Lovely malty wash. Sweet and fruity. Belgian candy sugar an Belgian yeast blended smoothly for a well-balanced and complex melange. Delicious.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.

Bottle from BelgianShop.com. Pours hazy dark hazelnut with a huge creamy tanned head. Aroma of nutty malts, dark fruits and spices. Taste is moderate sweet, nutty and toffee malts, weak alcohol burn warms nicely. Smooth mouthfeel, long finish.

From notes.  First reviewed 4/15/2009.  Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle into a goblet.

Prior 8 has a thick, walnut brown color that is impossible to see through. I observed small sentiment floating around the edges before disappearing into the brown abyss, with some residue from the last drops resting on top of the lace hat looks like cinnamon. The head foams up nicely to about 4 cm. Eventually it fades, but some head and loose lacing remain around the beer for the duration of the glass. 

A developed but nuanced smell, the major players are a strong Belgian yeasty malt and some fall spices. Cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg are all noticeable. Dates and raisins round out the aroma. 

Nothing too surprising here, although the dark fruit takes more of the lead. A strong, pleasant, yeasty malt dominates up front. Only a hint of the spices I smelled find their way into the taste. A light, somewhat tart hop flavor comes in at the end of the sip, but its not quite citrusy. I think it is a light starfruit taste.

A medium bodied, smooth feel. A nice level of carbonation, and there is a level of sediment that is nice.

This is a very drinkable beer. The strong, dark flavor and high alcohol content make it a nice sipper.
Big off white head with small bubbels. Very creamy mouthfeel, dark brownish colour, malty, slightly sweet flavours. Overall a very good brew!

Pours hazy amber, a lot of pine-tree-honey flavours first, then malt, esters (raspberry) and almond. Very nice nose !
Medium bodied, aromas dominated by honey, alcohol is not so well integrated. Very malty profile with a hint of bitterness in aftertaste. Less volume and complexity than ABT 12!

Dark Brown Pour, Generous Cream head.  Aroma is Merrange, alcohol and malt. Taste is Nutty with an overbearing alcohol hit. Mild carbonation and a burning finish. A bit disappointing to be honest.. I preferred the 6.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of black licorice, raisin, dust, roasted cereal malts and grassy hops.  Dark hazy brown hue with an average off-white foamy head that mostly diminished and left little lace.  Flavor is very sweet and a little bit bitter.  Palate is full bodied and oily lively.  Overall a big and intense brew.  Good representation of the style.
Bottled. Cloudy dark brown, thin tan head. Aroma is dark fruit and some caramel malts. Taste is like the aroma (raisins, figs, plums). mouthfeel is quite spicy and dry...

Bottle at 30/01/12 Appellation tasting. Pours an amber brown colour with a decent, light tan head. Aroma is very malty with Weetabix, candy sugar and orange zest. Flavours of honey, ginger, alcohol, Weetabix and yeast.  Alcohol lingers. Moderate carbonation and CO2 prickle with a foamy mouth-feel.
Pours clear brown with a high head. Aroma is sweet malts, yeast and alcohol. Flavor is pretty much the same. Pretty nice.
Great nose...very complex. Amber, clear and nice head. Light bitter? Medium body. Great dubbel.
Excellent, of course. It pours a dark amber brown with nice off white head. Very well balanced beer. It is malty sweet with clove and dark fruits.

In bottle; aroma of caramel and sugar. Poured a deep hazy brown with solid head. Taste was medium/full bodied with great caramel and toffee notes. very good beer (better than I expected). I must buy more ....
Che dire. E una trappista che non si dimentica perchè è eccezionale sia al naso e sia al palato . Non dico nulla sulla composizione dico solo che va bevuta. Punto.
Almost as good as the 12.  Dark brown, sweet with notes of clove, citrus and candied fruits.  Full bodied with a smooth mouthfeel. Tried with Jess, Olivier, and Dave in the Hague in Jan, 2012.

fles 33cl
Kleur: bruin met een lichtbruine mooie schuimkraag
Geur: zoet en kruidig.
Smaak: Licht zoet met een lekker bittere nasmaak. Verder kruiden.
Redelijk wat koolzuur.
A really well balanced dubbel. Sweet with some acidity and a nice bitterness at the end. Notes of dark fruits, spices and a bit of smoked flavor.
Bottle from the beer store in a gift pack. Pours a dark amber/brown with a sweet aroma. Tastes sweet, malty with some grapes, caramel. Excellent.

Bottle, opens with a huge rush of carbonation. No gusher, though. Pours into a red wine glass, dark brown/ruby, with garnet highlights. Huge, quickly billowing off-white head that retains at about half an inch. Honeycomb lacing. Grape, clove, cognac-soaked fruits on the nose. Yeasty undertones. Taste puts the fruits upfront, with more grape and clove, a bit of ripe apple, burnt sugar. Very busy carbonation. Wonderful.

Bottle 33cl.
Pours a clear amber colour with a strong size head and good carbonation.
Vague fruity and malty aroma, hard to distinguish anything special there.

Pours medium reddish brown with frothy tan head. Aroma is yeast, caramel, dried fruit. Mouthfeel is full, a little syurpy but not too bad. Taste is sweet, but not cloyingly so. Finish is slightly bitter, a nice balance to the initial sweetness. Also some alcohol taste in the finish. Overall a great beer, one of my fave doubles.
Bottle in tulip glass. Malty aroma. Dark brown colour with off white head. Taste is subtlely sweet. Quite nice.
Bottle shared with northropfrye. Sweet satisfying, tastes just as good as it smells. Rich chestnut colour.  Excellent frothy head. I really loved this beer.
Bottle, pours hazy dark brown with medium head. Aroma is dark fruits, malts, yeast. Taste is sweet with dark fruits, raisins. Good
A pretty sweet beer with flavours of fruit and caramel. Cloudy brown in colour with a white head.
Deep hazy-brown with beige head. Medium bodied. Taste is average abbey dubbel with some extra toffee, which gives it an interesting extra sweetness.

Bottle served in a tulip. Hazy dark amber-brown in color with a medium-sized head. Decent retention and lace. Big time dark fruit and light spice aroma. Medium sweet, malty flavors. Medium+ body, creamy-oily texture, soft carbonation, and a long sticky-malt finish. Very good, but not quite great.

330ml bottle 
8.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on December 16, 2011 at "Bar Volo" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer pours a medium reddish brown with a thin tan coloured cap.  The aroma consists of yeast, dark sugars, malt, and plums.  The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour is sweet malt, fruit, sugar, grains, butterscotch, and yeast.  Nothing like a good Belgian yeast.

A - Pours a dark mahogany with a very light tan head. The head disappeared quite quickly.

Ar - I have a cold.

T - There is a subtle sweetness to this beer. Malt forward with a dry, crisp and almost fruity finish. As the beer warms up, a little bit of the alcohol heat can be felt in the middle and the light hop bitterness comes through at the end.

D - A good beer to sip on while working. Im not a particular fan of dubbles but I would never turn this down. Though multiple would be tough for those are more accustomed to lighter beers.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours hazy brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruit, alcohol and yeast, Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long fruity and malty finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, over carbonated.
Bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown colour with a thin white head that soon disapears. Plenty of malt and sugar in the aroma, the taste is malty with hints of  dark fruit with a dry warming finish.

Very dark for a dubbel. Looks like cola with light yellow head. Pretty effervescent. Dark fruit and alcohol nose. Heavy sweet malt character, probably as close one can come to drinking a cake. Very thick textured body, but lacks enough hop presence to leave a lasting finish. I enjoyed this, but not as much as I expected.

Pours a hazy brown colour with a short lived white head. The aroma is basement, desk drawer, burnt sugar and dark fruits. The flavour starts out with burnt sugar and dark fruits, oak, walnuts and a sorta woody bitterness in the finish. Good stuff for sure.

330 ml bottle bought @ Bierkompass.de and consumed on December 6. Gusher! Pours hazy and very dark chestnut brown with a huge creamy brownish white head that slowly dissipates leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is malty sweet and spicy with raisins, cloves, pumpernickel and alcohol. Taste is sweet and full bodied with cloves, raisins, orange zest, dark bread, molasses, liquorice root, yeast and a warming alcohol sensation. Finish is sweet and vinous with spices and alcohol.

Raisin nose with lesser notes of dates. hazy brown, enoromous yellow head. Dry and malty, much fewer fruity esters on the palate than the nose. Low intensity. Subtle candied date finish. Medium body, tasteful alcohol content. Bottle is 4 years old, which is probably too old for this beer.
Bottle. Pours a medium brown with a whiteish head.  Smells are caramel, bread, nuts. Tastes of dried fruit.. some raisins perhaps.. kind of a winter warmer taste.. Solid offering.

Bouteille de 33 cl. Couleur rouge-marron foncé, mousse plutôt abondante de belle tenue. Intense aromatiquement, fruitée, caramélisée et légèrement fumée. Une belle évolution en bouche doublée dune agréable texture. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2011 Bottle from Beers of Europe
Appearance - chestnut brown, slight haze, large off white head that dissipated to thin layer 
Aroma -  fruity, dark fruits - raisins, caramel malt, sweet dark sugars, some yeast.
Taste -  rich dark malts, yeast, caramel, dark sugar, fruity, raisins, quite complex, rich malty flavour, alcohol well hidden, well balanced, nothing over done.
Palate medium carb, full bodied, rich and smooth, a little dry. Finish smooth with rich dark malts and  fruit, some rich toffee, leaving rich residue, some warming alcohol.
Overall - great tasting, smooth, rich malty beer, superb smooth malty finish, easy drinking for 8%.

75cl bottle @ Bir&fud Bottega Monk Tunic color (what else...) big dirtysnow head, cloudy but no turbid at all appearance. Aroma and taste: dried fruits and flowers, yeast, bread, brown/burnt sugar, spices, raisin and, above all the rest, a lot of malt. Quite carbonated, honestly i got a light/medium body and just a hint of alcohol. Its real balanced and none of its characteristics is too strong or prevails on the others. It feels like a fancy wine without being viney. a beer full of style and elegance, just a classic. It doesnt punch you in the face with its strength, it instead made you fall in love with beer.

on draft and pours almost the same color as their christmas ale. light tannish head. the aroma of sweet malt, yeasty dough and almost a band aid scent (seriously). it was sweet in flavor with that spicy finish and bread..it was a good beer but the abt 12 is much better.

Bottle thanks to 17thfloor. Pours a hazy brown amber with a small light beige froth. Aroma is sweet and rich with raisin, brown sugar, nice spicy cake character, nutty and dark fruits. Flavor starts sweet and fruity, all those dark fruits, lightly candied coming out with some mellow spice and bready character. Medium to medium full body and a soft carbonation. Very nice dubbel
Raisin, bread. Pours dark hazy brown. With a nice light brown sticky head. Sweet round taste. Very little hops. Rather short taste.raisin taste. Medium to full body. Very low carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2012 2nd bottle - pours dark and moody brown with a good tan head. lots of lacing on the glass. aroma of brown sugar, raisins, dark fruits. taste is quite deep, some liquorice, cherries. there is quite high carbonation, some coffee bitterness/dry finish. not as complex as the 12, but its still very nice.

Malt, yeast, spice, bread, caramel, and other fruit in the aroma.  More of the same in the flavor, along with caramel, toffee, and brown sugar.  Carbonation and alcohol provide a great balance.  One of the truly great beers out of Belgium.

Dark tan, big head, lots of lacing. Very malty nose with raisins, yeast and alcohol. Taste is dried fruit, yeast, alcohol, malt and sugary sweetness. Dry finish with some hops. Mouthfeel is creamy smooth with a lively carbonation. Very nice.

330 ML / 11.2 FL OZ bottle; pours perfectly in my Chimay goblet, leaving a dark, hazy brown body with a solid, long-lasting tan head and plenty of lacing.  The aroma is big, bold, malty and full of dark fruit and alcohol.  This ale is fairly dry from start to finish, but the palate is  full-bodied, creamy and well-carbonated.  The flavor profile evokes raisins, dates and figs, with a hint of apricot in the dry, hoppy, long-lasting and well-balanced 8% ABV finish.
nice dark malty aroma, lots going on, cherries, raisin? sweet buttery liquid (not as thick as the 12 though) with a long bittersweet maltheavy finish (some smoke at the end?)
Flesje van de supermarkt. Donker bier met een goede kraag. Redelijk zoet maar een beetje te weinig body naar mijn smaak.  Ik zal m niet snel nog een keer kopen.

Aroma has fruity hints with notes of caramel. Pours dark amber with frothy head.  Starts moderately sweet with boozy notes with long smooth finish with subtle bitter notes.  Medium body with creamy texture, very slight carbonation.   Overall a fantastic beer.

Bottle - thanks diarmaidbhk! - pours a lovely brown with 2 fingers of head. The off whitehead lingers for years with some great lacing on the glass. Aroma is malty, with molasses and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet with some pepper from the alcohol. Palate is medium weight with a creamy mouthfeel. Very nice!

0,75 l. bottle from a supermarket. Deep brown colour with a big creamy tan head that  leaves a lot of nice lacing. Very malty, powerfull aroma with fruity alcohol notes, a lot of dark fruits and apricot - typical complex Belgian yeast. Sweet and malty  taste with light toast notes and plenty of apricot, raisins and dark fruits like figs. Alcohol notes as well as some light flowery hops serve to balance the sweetness. Full body with a lively carbonation. Finish is dry but leaves a creamy palate.  A big and very malty beer but well balanced with a great, long lasting finish. Excellent.
Bottle. Brown with a beige head. Smelled malty. Yeasty, fruity flavor with toffee. Better body than 6, not as strong as 12.

From notes: Pours hazy nut brown with a small white head.  Bready, yeasty aroma with some earthiness and a very mild banana ester note.  Medium-thick with a nice depth.  Nutty and earthy flavors with a touch of spice and maybe even some citrus in the finish.

Aroma: Sweet, almost candy like, with hints of banana, spice and caramel. Still, there is a beer aroma to this--perhaps a smell of fresh baked bread or dough that lingers.
Appearance: Cloudy dark amber, almost brown, with a thick white head that dissipates quickly. 
Taste: Medium sweetness, with a light sourness and hint of saltiness in the finish.
Palate: Full body, thick, oily texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: Meh...its a solid, drinkable beer with obvious talent behind it, but nothing that just blows my mind.

Bottle.  A dark red opaque beer with an off-white head.  Sweet fruity aroma of raisins, orange peel, alcohol.  Sweet taste of dark fruits, some licorice, citrus.  A ton of carbonation, medium body.  Dry, but not bitter finish.

33cl bottle. Pours a plummy-brown colour with a generous frothy head, a good amount of which hangs around. The nose has oranges, dried cake fruit and cake mixture. The taste has tangy oranges, more cake mixture and a zingy sortbet finish. The palate is medium to large in structure, there is big tangy middle section with a zesty finish. Overall, tasty and complex!
Pours a funky brown color with a light brown head.  Pretty medium sized.  Smells some malts and brown sugar.  Pretty good taste.  Nice molasses and brown sugar with some bitterness.  I like it!!

This poured a murky brown color with a beige head. Aroma was darker candy sugar, some brown sugar, spices and yeast. Flavor was very yeast, some metallic notes, some dark fruits and light roast and toffee. Decent but not great.
Hazy brown coloured beer with medium off-white head and no carbonation visible. Malty sweet aroma. Full sparkling and bit creamy palate. Finish is fruity fresh with a bitter dry sweet ending. Nice.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2011 33cl bottle. Dark brown/green with a small to medium head (served cold) that dissipated rather quick. Dried fruits, cherry, alcohol and malty aromas in my nose. Sip : Smooth body with a low carbonation, little flaffy, sweet and really fruity. Nose armoma are confirmed ;  mostely cherry, caramel. Makes me think about a chocolate with raisins but not screaming. Alcohol notes are there but less prenounced then the 12abt. I must say I prefer it more then the 12 version. I can easly get another glass. Good !

This beer has a foggy brown body and a nice plush head Id expect from a true Dubbel. Smells mellow and smooth, like raisins and caramel with hints of spices. The taste is inviting - fitting the palate well with a bold malty spiciness. Notes of dark fruits and alcohol linger with a smooth warm finish. Perhaps an after dinner drink, as it makes a great sipper.
Strong and malty all around with a dark fruit edge to it, a very good Dubbel.

This beer pours a nice caramel dark red color with a very thin tan head. The nose on this beer is very flat, only a small malty flavor. the taste of this beer however is fairly big. Very toasty fruity flavor with citrus notes that give it a doughy alcoholic taste. Good beer would get again.
Taste is predominantly sweet ;Flavour is mild ripe fruits, sour malts, sweet caramel,Excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2012 Reviewed from notes (2007).

A: Dark brown body with a health tan head that creeps down the glass sides

S:  Sweet roasted malts, hints of banana and spice as well as belgian yeast

T: The roasted malts come through big and give a nice nutty, banana, yeast blend which are accented by subtle spices.

M: Medium bodied with a smooth, velvety feel and good amounts of carbonation...

O: Much like the Pater 6, this beer is a joy to drink and goes down easy!

Light Salty malted aroma with hints of toffee, caramel and plums. Brown color ruby highlights. Complex malty flavor of raisins, caramel and toffee with light alcohol hints and a bit of fruity esters. A little high un fusel alcohols for a dubbel, similar to a quadrupel but interesting.
Bottle. Nice, hazy brown pour with a big, tanned head. Aroma of ripe apples, yeast and some alcohol. Sweet flavour of the apples. Bit of alcoholic warming. Nice and longlasting flavour. Really nice.

Bottle looks simple but really good. Beer in the glass dark brown, huge head. Malty-fiery aroma. Starts strong, warm-malty, fine alcoholic, not too much. Fine spicy notes. Finish well balanced and warming. Soft-malty aftertaste. Great!

Pours a cloudy rust colour with a medium off-white head. Aroma is yeast, honey, walnuts, fruit. Creamy mouthfeel with a slight tingle from the carbonation.  Taste is predominantly sweet - berries, honey, vanilla, brown sugar, with a slight aftertaste of walnuts.  I think this would have to be the greatest of the Abbey Dubbels.

Cloudy dark brown pour thin and creamy off white head lots of sticky lacing .... aroma of dried overripe fruits and some caramel malts .... taste is of overripe fruits (raisins, figs, plums) with a little spicy bite, caramel malts and some warming abv in the finish

Malziger, weinartiger Geruch. Süßer Antrunk. Die Mitte präsentiert sich mit schokoladigen und nussigen Aromen, wobei im Hintergrund der Alkohol mitmischt. Zum Abschied wird das Bier malzig und der Alkohol ist nun deutlich zu spüren. 
Noch ok. Test vom 10.7.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2013 Aroma: Smells remarkably like Westvleterens beers. They (and this beer in front of me) have this very strange floral sweetness to them, along with a smooth caramel malt scent and backed with lots of dark fruit. Like Rochefort, its very unique and probably one of the best scents in the world. In fact its right up there along with a nasty fart you laid that makes your entire group of beer buddies leave the room.

Appearance: 750 into Abdij St. Sixtus Trappist glass. All sorts of brown/red hues with a huge, creamy fine off-white head and lacing galore. Supreme.

Taste: Caramel malts, candied sugar, some very slight barnyard but that varies by bottle. Chocolate and butterscotch too. Raisins and fruit throughout.

Palate: Mouth filling and well bodied. Balance superb. I cant find the alcohol.

Overall: I love this...one of my favorite beers and equal to Westvleterens 8 which would be no surprise.

From bottle at the Hotel De La Paix in Poperinge.  Dark brown with a well formed head.  Rich, spiced aroma.  Smooth and decent flavour.  Its good but a little 2D, needs to mix another flavour in.  None-the-less enjoyable.

Bottle.  Dark ice tea pour with nice white head and great retention and lacing.  Nose of a Belgian double.  Big on fruit, malt and yeast.  The taste follows the nose.  A little heavy on the carbonation, even for a dubble.  Good stuff.
Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Nice dark brown color. Not much smell, but a nice taste. Average carbo and body.
Not my favorite style but having tried a number of the top beers in this style I thing this is the best of the bunch
Dark brown color Thick off-white head. Sweet malty aroma with notes of fruit. Good malty flavor. A beer with a good warm feeling.

Extraordinary taste, every sip makes me happy. I tasted this beer for the first time in bruges. On my next holiday to belgium I imported more bottles. Now I ordered 2 bottles of 75 ml from a dutch website. This beer hasnt been able to rest yet, so unfortunately the sediment is mixed with the beer. But it still tastes great to me...
Smell of prumes, berries and walnut. Taste of caramel/chocolate... and an extremely long oily aftertaste that leaves satisfaction...
This is next to Westmalle dubbel my favorite... And I favor dubbel over the rest mostly...

Bottle as shown. Pours a dark brown with a creamy light tan head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is caramel and roasted malt. Thick mouthfeel with brown sugary malt and toast. Easy to drink, a very good dubbel from St. Bernard.

One of my favourites, poured from a bottle bought in a Belgian supermarket for just over 1 euro. Amazing! Pours a beautiful dark brown colour with a nice beige head. Aroma is lovely, Sweet and creamy, lots of malt with a little bit of hoppiness. Taste is medium sweet, bit of honey and chocolate and nice and rich. Nice and full body with a lovely smooth aftertaste. Great beer, not at all flashy, but beautiful in its simplicity.

on tap at the r&hum NYC. fruity,flowery, fragrant and substantial. malt and underwhelming hop it is smooth and satisfying. i was enjoying a flight and this one stood out. an additional serving later and still appreciative of the vanilla and honey flavors and overall load on the senses. surprised i must have got a really good one.

On tap at RnH w Andy Streets James. Pour is a dark ruby color. Bready, yeasty aroma and similar taste. Nothing mind-bending, but a little intriguing b/c it starts plain and finishes chocolatey and sweet. Not a favorite, but solid.

Bottle from Csakajósör.hu. Poured clear, with a ruby color and a beige foam that quickly disappeared. Aroma of yeast, caramel, dark chocolate, honey, plum, raisins, molasses. Mdium dense, pretty high carbonation. Smooth on the palate, with slight taste of the alcohol. Sweet, long lasting, dark chocolatety aftertaste with slight sourness. This ones excellent.
Murky orange brown body with an off white head. Sweet aroma with caramel, licorice, fruits and chocolate. Great sweet flavour with fruits and chocolate and a dry finish.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2013 Another beloved beer that Im just not on board with the rest.  First of all, so much sediment floating around that it is distracting and disgusting.  Control your turbidity.  Appearance is not enough to give this a mediocre rating.  The flavor is nothing exceptional--light caramel malts, yeast.  Sorry, not going to bend over for Bernardus.

Poured from 330mL bottle into goblet a rich hazy brown color with big beige head with great retention and lacing.  Aromas of roasted malts and yeast.  Nicely balanced flavours, sweet malt with some yeast and a mild hop bitterness in the finish.  Nice body and feels fizzy on the tongue.  Overall, a great Dubbel from a great brewery.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2011 Pours medium dark, big frothy head, moderate malty aroma. Only slight bitterness, light complexity, with flavors of raisin, plum, maybe a little banana. A nice, lighter Belgian ale. Missing some depth and complexity that I like in Belgians, but taken for what it is, one worth returning to many times.

750ml bottle from 16th St.Liquor in West Vancouver. Pours a thick, dark rust colour with big large-bubble tan head that endured. Amazingly complex but subtle aromas of raisins, orange and almonds. Taste was complex with high maltiness but low overall sweetness. Dusty, full palate. High yeast content but it stayed in the bottom well and I could pour all but about an ounce. No hint of the alcohol. Left me wanting another.

Pours a dark ruddy color with a brown foamy head. Rich sweet malts and deep dark fruits are caught up in the aroma. Some baked cookies and raisins are also in the nose. The rich fruits are very notable upfront in the palate. Some baked cookies on the palate as well. A long dry finish ends nicely
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, roasted noted and dried fruit. Flavour is caramel, breaddy notes, alcohol, roasted notes and dried fruit.
(bottle)   Beer club outing at Salt Gasto Pub in Byram.  Aroma of Belgian yeast and berries.  Cola flavors in traditional Dubel style.  Good, but not on the top for this style.

Bottle at unos in neshaminy. Mild, semi-sweet yeasty aroma, brown sugar, caramel malts. Taste is a brilliantly balanced sweetness of sugar, dark fruits, against the belgian yeast and moderate malt character. Its not abt 12, but its still great.
Hmmmmm, I thoroughly enjoyed the 6 and the wit but this 8 is falling short.

Bouteille de 330ml. Visuel: Bière brune-cuivrée avec une mince couche de mousse beige. Olfactif: On retrouve des noix grillées avec du chocolat. Une rondeur et douceur est perceptible. Gustatif: Le chocolat est bien agréable, lalcool est doux, la bière est ronde et chaleureuse tout en étant digeste. La structure malté donne un squelette et un corps de musclé. Résumé: St. Bernardus est un très bon brasseur et cette Prior 8 prouve hors de tout doute que le style Dubbel peut donner des bières de grande qualité. Ici nous sommes au sommet du style.

Bottle.
Reddish brown with a large tan head.
Aroma: yeast, ripe fruit, quite a freshness to the aroma.
Taste: fruity, candy, brown sugar, coke, not as much dried fruit as in the Pater.
Medium-bodied, moussy.

Bottle. Dark brown with a light brown head, good lacings. Aroma moderate/heavy malty, brown sugar, raisin, plum and hoppy. Flavor moderate/heavy sweet and bitter, in good balance. Medium/full body, syrupy, soft carbonated. Moderate in alcohol.
Draft.  Pours a cloudy brown with a thin tan head.  Bready aroma.  Smooth, sweet malt taste, with caramel, butter and merlot wine characteristics.  Some hop bitterness.

Bottle 750ml, dark brown with very nice big fluffy off white head, metallic, berries, dark fruits aromas, the flavor is very nice dark berries, resin, flowers, caramel.... medium body, light bitter.... a bit salty palate...... very nice beer !

Copper-brown in colour, clear, clean and a creamy white head that leaves good lace. Smells of dates, allspice, caramel, artisan brown bread, apricot skins and dessert slice. Fruity goodness.
The flavour was not what I was expecting. I anticipated sweetness and stonefruit. What I got was a slightly sour note on dates and pumpernickel. Its soft and intriguing. There is a lingering aftertaste of stewed apricot flesh and a lick of biter chocolate. A standout beer.

Bottle. Murky brown body with a fine and lasting head. Aroma has hops, yeast, and brown sugar. Rich malty palate. Taste has more hops than the other dubbels I have tried. It is just really carefully balanced and a pleasure to sip.

Deep amber color, with notable foam. Aroma of caramel and toast sugar, slightly spicy. Great body. In mouth is fabulous, super creamy, and a mixed of flavours (candy sweet malt, red fruits and spices). Only at the end some alcohol appears, but its very pleasant (fine old rum) with herbal reminiscences. Surprising and spectacular. One of my bests.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2012 Bottle pours medium brown with gold around rim, beige head. Sweet bready smell, sugary and fruity with some clove. Tastes sweet but not overly, just right. Big full mouth feel with a full carbonation but not stinging, it is soft and forgiving. Spicy, something like cinnamon and clove but softer, some light fruity flavors  come out but i didn?t try too hard to find them, some fig and date, i just enjoyed it. Big sweet belgian yeasty finish, lingering grainy feel too with a touch of dryness under the sweetness, Excellent. One of my personal favorites for a dubbel.
Dark red/brown color with thick cream collar. Smell of sweet caramel with tiny flavour of freshness. Tastes lickerish with small sweetness, as "drop" in dutch.

Bottle. Dark brown with a light brown head, good lacing. Aroma moderate/heavy malty, brown sugar, raisin, plum and hoppy. Flavor moderate/heavy sweet and bitter, in good balance. Medium/full body, syrupy, soft carbonated. Moderate in alcohol.
This is quite a good abbey dubbel beer, but its not my favorite style, hence the low score.

33cl bottle at the Paas, The Hague.
Creamy white head.  Hazy amber blond pour.
Hazy brown colour with light head. Malty and yeasty aroma, bread and raisins. Sweet malty taste with slightly dry finish. Heavy body and low carbonation. Very drinkable

Sevida al The Drunk Monk (Mataró). The color was cloudy brassy amber with floating sediment. The head was creamy, thin, and off-white. The aroma was dark fruit, alcohol, and sweet. The flavor was sweet, alcohol, dark fruit, and spice. The palate was lively and medium-bodied. The finish was warm.

Wow, what a Dubbel. The pour is dark murky brown with orange/red notes. A large two finger yellowish beige head with a beautiful sparkle of bottle conditioned bubbles. The aroma is sweet and malty with a large bready caramel malt and a tons of sweet dark fruits. The middle is sweet and caramel with raisin and plum with a light spice note. The finish is slightly bitter with a light bitterness and moderate alcohol finish. The mouthfeel is amazing with a medium to full body and a beautiful texture of tiny bubbles and sweet smooth head. The best dubbel ever.

Bottled.  Pours a clear brown color with a frothy off-white head. The aroma is sweet and malty with candi sugar, caramel, ripe plums, and a hint of cocoa.  The flavor is dark malts with an emphasis on caramel and cocoa. Fruit flavors lean toward darker fruits like plums.  Additional flavors are vinous, light alcohol, some roast with hints of the Belgian candi sugar.  Medium-plus body.  This is a solid classic brew.

Really nice aroma, you can clearly smell caramel. It as a brown color and a beige head. The taste is really fruity, you can also taste caramel and molasse. Theres not too much carbonation which is a damn good thing !  Its an easy beer to drink, Ill have to order some more ! Awesome !

The beer is medium brown colored with a tannish head. The beer is hazy and you cannot see through it. The aroma is caramel and toffee with some molasses mixed in. I also get a little bit of dark fruit. The flavor is full of caramel, Belgian yeast, candy sugar and a little bit of grape/other dark fruit. The alcohol is barely noticeable and the beer is very easy to drink. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Prior 8 on väriltään punertavan ruskea. Sen vaahto on jotakuinkin valkoinen. Tuoksu on kypsän hedelmäinen, rusinainen ja mausteinen. Maultaan olut on rusinainen, mausteinen ja kypsän hedelmäinen. Suutuntumaltaan mukavan runsas ja muutenkin lämmittävän miellyttävä olut.

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown with a slight red touch, amber colour. Nice beige head. In the Nose, it gives hints of caramel, malt, and some sweetness, but is not as strong as expected. The taste is very pleasant, easy to drink, and must incude some Münchener malt (red colour). It is rich and stays reasonable long. What I miss is some bitterness to compensate the sweet part.

Pours a hazy brown with 1 inch head.

Deserving little brother to the ABT 12.

Pleasant, aromatic, feels great on the tongue.

Would be the number one beer in any other brewerys line of beers.

Bottle.  Upon trying to pour, the bottle gushed a little less than an ounce.  I was able to catch most of it, but wondering if this was an issue or an infected bottle.  However it tasted as it should.  Anyways....Pours a dark amber brown with little floaties and a tan head.  Smells of sweet fig, a little banana and yeast aromas.  Tastes of fruity, malty that is somewhat complex with some spice notes.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. Enyhén narancsos árnyalatú, sötétbarna szín, habja piszkosfehér, és közepesen kitartó. Illata karamellás, élesztős, és aszalt cseresznyés, illetve likőrös. Ízének is ez a cukros, karamellás, aszalt gyümölcsös édesség adja az alapját, kellemes belga élesztős és komlós lenyomatokkal, likőrös utóízzel. Pezsgőre hasonlító szénsavasság, nem annyira nagy test és cukros keserédesség jellemzi.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2012 Bottle @ home. Pours a dark brown body with a tan head. Big candy sugar, somewhat fruity, Belgian yeasty, deep caramel malty nose. Very caramel malty, strong candy sugar, light fruity, raisins, dark fruity, Belgian yeasty flavor. Sweet, caramel finish. Well carbonated. Excellent Abbey Dubbel.
Orange colour with medium head. Aroma of fruits and alcohol with bread-like yeast aroma. Taste is medium sweet with finish that stays on the tongue for several moments.
pours deep reddish brown with a lasting off-white head and lots of spotty lacing.  milky fruit aroma.  taste is rich with over-ripe fruit, licorice, molasses and maple.  finish is sweet.
Bottle at De Paas. Some alcohol in aroma and flavor which slightly spoils the beer
dark brown coloured body with a off white head a spicy malty roasted aroma a spicy roasted malty fruity caramel sweet alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a thin head. Aroma is faint, but the predominant aromas are belgian esters. Taste is slightly boozy with accents on a nice malt palate. Foremost are figs and caramel. Finishes very clean without relying heavily on a particular flavor.
Very nice. Excellent aftertaste, spicy taste and fine aroma. Good head and shape.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours brown with a beige head.  Aroma of caramel and bread malts, doughy/spicy yeast, and very faint hops.  Flavor about the same.  Average texture, and not a lot of carbonation.  A pretty good dubbel, but a little too malty for my taste.

330 ml bottle picked up in Belgium and had at home. Pours a hazy dark brown color with a tan head. Aoma is caramel and dark fruit , with heavy malts. The taste is caramel, fruit, and very sweet. The alcohol is there throughout and noticeable. Palate has a light sting of alcohol. Nice solid, complex, delicious beer.

Bottle; Pour is dark, murky brown with amber highlights. Very nice. fine bubbled beige head into this Bernardus glass. Terrific retention, spider web lacing - unlike the bottle of 6 I just had. I have an affinity for sweeter Belgians, I admit. It makes it really easy to enjoy the 8, versus the 6. I just find it far more flavorful, as far as my palate in concerned. Terrific sweet bread, sugary sweet, dark fruit nose. This brew does share the herbal, grassy hop profile from the 6, but the malt backbone more than dominates, really. I highly enjoyed this brew.

330ml bottle from Bierzwerg

Pours dark brown with a massive head. Nice aroma with hints of malts, raisin and fruits. Taste is quite heavy and complex with hints of malts and raisin. Alcohol warms nicely.
Aroma/Malty-bread light, Appearance Head/size small, Head/Color white, Body/Hue-yellow, Initial Flavor-adidic light, Finish Flavor-acidic light, Palate/Body-light to medium, good beer

Another great moster head... dark brown/black in color.... Nutty, malty aroma with some light spices.  Taste is malty, light spices, some dark fruits, walnuts... maybe a slight tartness... cherry?  Light texture, medium carbonation level...really easy to drink. Overall nice beer dubbel.
bottle, full floral, nuts aroma,amber, brown, hazy, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, very lovely nice fullbodied beer
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: AUG 13, 2014 Pours a brown amber with a beaige head. Aroma is very malty with caramel, plums and belgian yeast. Taste of caramel, ripe fruits, hints of alcohol, caramel, some hops and some belgian yeast here aswell.
pours deep brown. modest head. sweet yeasty aroma. dryer taste than it looks like it should have. well balanced. flavour pales in finish.
Bottle, 33cl. Deep reddish/brown colour with a great tan head. Aroma is of yeast and some dry fruit. Smooth and fruity, very sweet. Strong alcohol finish.
Rather good abbey dubbel with an alright colour and nice malty flavour.

Bottle. Pours a hazy brown color with a thin tan head. The beer has a very caramel and dark fruit aroma, with heavy malts. The flavor is caramel, fruit, and very sweet. The alcohol is faintly noticeable. Nice solid, complex, delicious beer.

750ml bottle from Sweetsteak IPB 2010.
Appearance : Clear amber with a big fluffy white head. Lots of lacing.

Aroma : Nice yeasty bananas with yeast and dark fruits. Nutty hints with caramel.

Taste : Nutty and fruity. Light caramel and spices. Notes of banana bread. Bitter and dry finish. Nice soft carbonation.

Overall : Quite drinkable for the style and the abv. Nice banana bread profile which is not very common for the style AFAIK. Nice nose, great complexity.
