UPDATED: MAR 20, 2003 a muddy brown swamp sat below a most unusual head of large and ugly bubbles..the aroma was a musty, chocolatey, salty mixture of melted toffee, maybe a burnt raspberry or two, some grapes, a couple lumps of natural sugar, and a couple loafs of bread..flavor was very bready..toasty, slightly nutty, a little acidic..some cocoa..semi-thin body though...salty bitterness coming in the end..

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2003 My favorite Belgian brewery hits it perfectly with bubblegum, tropical fruit, chocolate, banana and stewed fruit in perfect balance.  Creamy, perfect palate.  At half the price of Westvleteren, this deserves major Overall Impression points.  This is the Belgian I'm going to buy on a regular basis.  UPDATE:  After many samples of this one, it's still my favorite Belgian.  On draft, I encountered tremendous lively complexity, with the ester bubblegum coming out a bit more than usual, but tempered perfectly with the light chocolate notes.  I cannot say enough.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2007 Ruby red-brown color, thick creamy foam. Aroma of malt, chocolat, bit nutty even, ripe fruit. Sweet taste, creamy of chocolat, bit sparkling as well, but still not heavy to drink. Beautiful beer.
Dark brown color with nice head. Malty aroma. Nice complex taste, malty, a little fruity, spicy, toffees. I liked this one.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2006 Dark brown with nice lasting head. Very nice malty nose and flavor. A bit fruity, yeasty and some caramel. A thinner version of the 12, but less complex as well. Smooth malty finish.

This is a good BSA.  Complex and fruity, with a great character.  I wonder if this is one of the belgian brews that masquerades as a trappist - if so, it measures up pretty well.  Ill look forward to trying the triple.

Nice strong frothy head, it seemed to grow overtime instead of reduce.  Has a fruity flavor with a strong presence of yeast.  A slight tangy aftertaste which in my opinion is detrimental to the beer.  Make the mouth feel quite full after which is alittle of putting.  All in all not a bad beer, happy to have this again.

I had this and the Apt.12 last night while this is no Apt. 12 it is still a great beer. This darker brown, cloudy beer, has a slim foam on top. It has smells of vannilla and bananas, but the taste is a smooth fruity, caramel, toffee taste. A good beer with a little less puch than the Apt. 12.

Fruity, spicy nose, opaque reddish-brown body, medium light tan head. Bready, spicy flavor with some dark fruit. Im going to wind up rating this higher than the 12, largely because I had high expectations for the 12, which it didnt satisfy (i.e., it was supposed to be a top-50 Westy 12 clone).  This is a very pleasant dubbel with a nice spicy zing.
Very nice dark brown colour. Quite complex flavour with heavy fruits (plums, prunes?) and rum. Lightly bitter finish. Not bad, but definately too sweet for me.
Note quite as good as the 12, this is a lighter version with the same banana notes but with more prominent spices.  As good as the Trappistes.
Most of the flavor of the 12.  Great  malt flavor.
Licorice, yeast, Fernet Branca/medicine, herbs, banana, cocoa, raisins, its all there. A great and complex brew with a fine head.
Vinuous aroma that is far more intense than the weakish malty yeast taste. Thinner than it should be too, but it looks great.
A little spicy flavour (liquorice?) at first. Then a malty sweetness and a alcoholic finish. Fruity aroma. The glorious middleway between no. 6 and 8.
hmm Great beer.  Lasting head, dark colour. Sweet aroma. Kinda chocolate, sweet taste, but also a little spicy. Palate is a little off (too alcoholic).

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2003 11/14/2001: Very dark coloured. Very full, yeasty and fruity. Great beer: drink it slowly. 09/20/2002 re-rate: Little smoked, prune, spicy aroma. Almost creamy head, perfect lace. Light sweet, spicy, herbs, complex, butter. Little alcohol burn in the finish.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2006 very dark piano colour. tastes like melted down violet crumble. stench of blue cheese and vegemite. rich, heavy and tasty, without getting out of control like the 12. rer8: this bottle was useby last year so i dunno how old that makes it, but it was noticeably smoother, more complex, and dryer in the finish too. full body with chocolate and honey sweetness, then a long gentle drying out with coriander and rum. perfect on a cold winters night. for some reason the yeast came out like black pond-sludge so i painted a bit of a jackson pollock inspired piece with it on top of the white creamy head.rer8: 3 years past useby date: oh my god. this stuff is delicious.
Very dark brown, nice full head.  Flavour like banana bread.  Nice - though I dont generally like banana tasting beers.
Very good. It is a half-way house between Bernardus 6 & 12. A little fruity and prickeling.
real slivovice aroma. tastes of barbecue shapes and licorice with some stewed fruit. manages not to be too stodgy and is almost refreshing
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2006 Deep amber brown, generous head. Toffee and malt, a hint of spice, really delicate, amazingly soft on the palate, like drinking liquid marshmallow.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2004 Dark red with a medium head. Aroma: sweet, malty and a bit sour. Taste: Medecine, maybe some chocolate and some port. Like the Pater 6 this comes close to the noble trappists. A very good beer.
Nothing much to say about this. Very little nose. Dark amber beer that smells like a pighouse according too my notes. Resampling anyone?
Slightly flat, but a very black beer. The lovely fruit and malt combination makes this beer flavoursome and palatable.
Malt and liquorice in the aroma. Sweetish taste with a hint of roasted malt. Liquorice, chocolate and blackcurrant. Bit tart. It is not the real Westy, but it will certainly do as a substitute.

Very dark and brown.  Mine was clearly a bit shaken as it was really lively when i opened it.  A lovely smell, not too strong of alcohol - which is the same with its taste.  IIts really smooth, and easy to drink.It has loads of malts, with tastey sweetness.  Cant wait to try the other versions.

Dark ruby port-wine hazy colour with medium mid size beige moderately well lasting head. A real smorgasbord of an aroma - sweet nectar, esters, glue aromatics, old port wine, tropical fuits and yeasty cured meats. Flavour is bitter-sweet doughy-yeast and fainter sweet cider and molasses. Palate starts bitter, then sweet, medium to full bodied with a rather weak sweet bitter finish. An interesting beer and one I found quite hard to rate and one that I think would change markedly with temperature. Possibly could even be called a desert beer. Overall for me the Abt 12 definitely, and the Pater 6 probably, are both better.

Well, another beer perhaps ruined by the disturbance of yeast when cap was opened.  My westveletern did this to me last time.  It opened with a nice pfft and yeast came rushing to the top.  therefore making it impossible to get a dregless pour.  The bottle hadnt been disturbed for months so that is not an issue.  My opinion of this brewery is slowly diminishing.  I love the Triple but the 6 and the 8 are bogey.  I am sure the Abt 12 will be nice, got that coming here soon.  This just tasted too dag gone similar to the 6; just a little more beefy.  Rummy nose as Oakes put it, with raisins, dates, and alcohol.  I dont care for the hard water in this as I didnt in the 6.  Taste is alcohol, caramel, cocoa and hints of passion fruits.  Sounds better than it really tastes.  Other than I can see it aging well, this is a disappointment.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 31, 2003 Deep brown colour, with lasting head with nice lace. Mollases in the aroma (unpleasant). Sweet malty, with no "noticeable" hops, too much sweet fat malts, no balance, like their 12. Supposedly their recipes are the same as westvleteren, well, they are a far way off getting the balance, subltey, flavour and texure right.
dark brown colour, big creamy head, banana and mango aroma, heavy, oily, very sweet, long disgusting banana aftertaste - almost not finishable

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2008 Muddy light brown, just like the style ought to be.  Figgy, plummy malt-ester depths to the nose, with a hint of alcohol.  Deep dark fruitiness, smooth slightly toffeeish malts and a rich, sticky finish with a splash of alcohol.  Well-balaned...quality brew.
